story:
Das sozial-ökologische Restaurant

Was möchten wir tun?

Mit dem Aufbau eines Restaurants via Internet, durch die User und dem Fach-Personal, unter Berücksichtigung sozialer und ökologischer Aspekte, wollen wir die Demokratisierung der Wirtschaft, die Erhöhung der gemeinsamen Lebensqualität und die Lösung gesellschaftlicher Probleme erreichen.

Welches Problem lösen wir damit?

Wir präsentieren auf einer Internet-Seite das Grundkonzept eines sozial-ökologischen Restaurant. Jeder Interessierte kann dann dort, bis zu einem festgelegten Termin, seine Ideen und Wünsche in Bezug der Einrichtung, Dienstleistungen, Lage, Speisen, Getränke usw. loswerden. Für ein Sponsorengeld (welches ein Teil des Kapitals des Restaurants werden wird) von 10 bis 50€, kann dann nun jeder „Mitunternehmer“ mit abstimmen. Bei dieser Abstimmung wird auch festgelegt, wie viel des Gewinns des Restaurants, in welches soziale oder ökologische Projekt fließt. Die Ideen und Kreativität der User entscheiden wie erfolgreich das Unternehmen werden kann und sie sind gleichzeitig an der Lösung sozialer und ökologischer Probleme mit beteiligt. Dieses Projekt stellt die Demokratisierung der Wirtschaft, unter Berücksichtigung sozialer und ökologischer Aspekte, via Internet dar. Ziel ist es in möglichst vielen Gemeinden Restaurants aufzubauen.

Welche Vorteile vor anderen Produkten/Dienstleistungen/Projekten bringt unser Konzept? Was ist der USP?

Vorteile unseres Unternehmens:-aus der Sicht der Arbeitenden: die Sicherheit der Beschäftigten die egalitäre Einkommensverteilung die Teilhabe am Eigentum des Produktivvermögens die gleichberechtigte Teilnahme an den betrieblichen Entscheidungen der kooperative, demokratische, freundschaftlich Geist untereinander die Einbettung in die Lebensräume-aus der Sicht der Planung: die weitsichtige und zukunftsorientierte Politik des Genossenschaftsrats die hohe Produktivität die Dynamik die Transparenz die effektive Kontrolle aller Arbeitsbereiche durch die Werktätigen und „Aktionäre“die straffe Entscheidungsstruktur des Betriebs und ihrer Vernetzung-aus der Sicht der Kunden und Verbraucher: die entsprechend ihrem gebrauchszielfachlich, ökologisch bzw. biologisch hohe Qualität das gute Gefühl, dass das ausgegebene Geld nicht nur einer Elite zu Gute kommt, sondern unter den Arbeitenden gerecht aufgeteilt wird, um dann wieder in den Wirtschaftskreislauf zurückzukehren und so eine gemeinsame hohe Lebensqualität der Gesellschaft zu gewährleisten das soziale Engagement des Betriebs Ein weiterer Kundennutzen besteht darin, dass wir den Bürgern über das Restaurant, eine Möglichkeit einräumen aktiv in das Wirtschaftsleben und in die Gestaltung ihre Region einzuwirken. Ein Unternehmen zu gestalten welches ihren Wünschen, Bedürfnissen entspricht und einen Teil des Gewinns in soziale und ökologische Projekte reinvestiert, von denen sie unmittelbar profitieren werden.

“Go for a cause”: Wofür engagieren wir uns mit dieser Idee? Welches Anliegen ist uns wichtig?

Ethisches Beschaffungsmanagement-Kooperation nur mit Lieferanten, welche sich an den sozial-ökologischen Werten der Gemeinwohlökonomie orientierenEthisches Finanzmanagement-Kapital wird durch „Aktionäre“, NGO´s und Lieferanten bereitgestellt Arbeitsplatzqualität- wird durch Mitarbeiterbeteiligungsmodell gewährleistetGerechte Verteilung des Arbeitsvolumen- ergibt sich aus der MitarbeiterselbstbestimmungFörderung ökologischen Verhaltens der Mitarbeiter- durch Bestimmung der „Aktionäre“ und ständige WeiterbildungGerechte Verteilung des Einkommens- entsteht durch egalitäre Lohnverhältnisse und den Teil des Gewinns, welcher in die Region reinvestiert wird, Gleichstellung ist eine der Grundvoraussetzungen unseres ProjektsInnerbetriebliche Transparenz und Mitbestimmung-gewährleisten wir durch das Mitarbeiterbeteiligungsmodell und einer „offenen Zahlenpolitik“Ethisches Verkaufen-erfolgt durch den sozial-ökologischen Aktionärsauftrag und die nachhaltigen ProdukteSolidarität mit Mitunternehmen-entsteht durch langfristige Verträge und Erzeugung von Win-win-SituationenÖkologische Gestaltung der Produkte und Dienstleistungen-resultiert durch Erzeuger und Kooperation mit Bio-Verbänden und UmweltschutzorganisationenSoziale Gestaltung der Produkte und Dienstleistungen-gewähren wir durch sozial engagierte Produzenten und dem speziellen Aktionärswunsch (Spezialangebote für Kinderreiche und Arbeitslose usw.)Erhöhung der sozialen und ökologischen Branchenstandards-entwickelt sich automatisch durch Lieferanten, Aktionäre und Kooperation mit UmweltverbändenGesellschaftliche Wirkung/Bedeutung der Produkte/Dienstleistungen-ergibt sich aus den gesellschaftlich hochwertigen Produzenten bzw. Lieferanten und den Einfluss der Aktionäre auf das Restaurant (Internetplattform)Der Beitrag zum Gemeinwesen-folgt aus der demokratischen Wirtschaftsweise, den sozial.ökologischen Produkten und der Unterstützung sozial-ökologischer ProjekteReduktion ökologischer Auswirkung-wird durch ständige Weiterbildungsmaßnahmen und der Zusammenarbeit mit Umweltschutzorganisationen gewährleistetMinimierung der Gewinnausschüttung an Externe-Gewinnausschüttung an Externe findet nur als Investition in soziale und/oder ökologische Projekte der Region statt/ AktionärsauftragGesellschaftliche Transparenz und Mitbestimmungist eine der Grundvoraussetzungen unseres Unternehmens und wird durch die Internetplattform (demokratische Wirtschaftsweise) und einen jährlichen Gemeinwohlbericht verbreitet

Wofür planen wir das Geld, welches wir durch das Crowdfunding einnehmen, einzusetzen?

Das Crowdfundinggeld würde für den Aufbau der Internetplattform eingesetzt werden. Bevor wir mit unserem Restaurant wirklich durchstarten, werden wir eine Internet-Seite aufbauen. Diese Internet-Seite wird das Herzstück unserer Unternehmung werden. Auf jener wird dann das Grundkonzept eines sozial-ökologischen Restaurant vorgestellt. Jeder Interessierte kann dann dort seine Ideen und Wünsche in Bezug Einrichtung, Dienstleistungen, Lage, Speisen, Getränke usw. loswerden. Des Weiteren können sich Sponsoren( Organisationen, Vereine) und zukünftige Lieferanten/Partner (auch mit ihren Waren) vorstellen/werben. Bis zu einem vorher festgelegten Termin werden alle Vorschläge gesammelt. Die Besten, die Kreativsten und Durchführbaren werden anschließend auf der Internet-Seite präsentiert. Für ein Sponsorengeld (welches ein Teil des Kapitals des Restaurants werden wird) von 10 bis 50€, kann dann nun jeder „Mitunternehmer“ mit abstimmen. Für IT-Fachleute werden dann auch die API´s geöffnet sein, damit sie, wenn sie Lust und Laune haben, die Plattform nach ihren Vorstellungen gestalten können. Nicht zu vergessen, bei dieser Abstimmung wird auch von den Mitunternehmern festgelegt, wie viel des Gewinns des Restaurants, in welches soziale oder ökologische Projekt fließt. So entscheiden die Mitunternehmer durch ihre Ideen und Kreativität (und ihr Sponsoring), wie erfolgreich das Unternehmen werden kann und sind gleichzeitig an der Lösung sozialer und ökologischer Probleme mit beteiligt. Dieses Projekt stellt die Demokratisierung der Wirtschaft, unter Berücksichtigung sozialer und ökologischer Aspekte, via Internet dar. Somit kann jeder Mitunternehmer ein Stück Zukunft mitgestalten, alles nach dem Motto: Wir investieren nicht wegen der Renditen, sondern wir investierten in die Demokratie und in gemeinsame Lebensqualität. Das ist das WEB 2.0, das ist die Zukunft!

Was bieten wir unseren Crowdfunding-Unterstützern als Dankeschön für ihre finanzielle Unterstützung an?

Da viele hochrangige Wirtschaftsexperten der Meinung sind, dass sich mit dem „Bioboom“ auch das sozialverantwortliche Unternehmertum stark entwickeln wird, sehen wir gerade jetzt die große Chance, uns in diesem Marktsegment zu etablieren. Unser Ziel wäre eine Kooperation/Allianz bestehend aus Lieferanten, Erzeugern, Händlern, Organisationen/Verbänden, Gästen bzw. Kunden und Medien zu erschaffen, aus welcher win-win Situationen entstehen. Der immaterielle Konsum steigert das persönliche Glück mehr als der materielle. Deshalb steht in unserem Konzept die Erhöhung der Lebensqualität und die Förderung der ressourcenschonenden „Konsumartikel“ wie Kultur, Kunst, Naturerleben, Persönlichkeitsbildung usw. im Mittelpunkt. Die direkte Investition und Mitbestimmung der Lieferanten, Händler und der Bürger (welche im Konzept näher beschrieben werden) dient nicht der Profitmaximierung, sondern der direkten Erhöhung der Lebensqualität der Bürger und der Region. Durch den effektiv-nachhaltigen Einsatz von Sachkapital, Naturkapital, Humankapital, Sozialkapital und Finanzkapital versuchen wir einen ständigen Strom an Gütern und Leistungen zu erbringen, die zum Wohlbefinden der Bürger beitragen. So entsteht ein soziales Wachstum, welches nicht auf Kosten des Natur- und Sozialkapitals entsteht. Im Gegenteil, Human- und Sozialkapital werden ausgebaut und Naturkapital wird erhalten. Diese Art des Wirtschaftens gibt dem Sach- und Finanzkapital eine vollkommen neue Rolle und Wirkung.

Zusätzliche Informationen

Sobald die Finanzierung der Internetplattform steht, versuchen wir über das Internet und andere Medien die größtmögliche Aufmerksamkeit zu erregen. Die Internetplattform stellt das Herzstück unserer Unternehmung dar. Auf dieser wird dann das Grundkonzept eines sozial-ökologischen Restaurant vorgestellt. Beispiel für München: Ein Stadtteil, Bürgerinitiative, interessierte Bürger gestalten dann mit den Gastronomen (uns), nach dem opensource- und crowdsourcing-Prinzip, ihr „Ideal-Restaurant“, welches genau auf ihre Wünsche und Bedürfnisse ausgerichtet ist. Alle Ideen/Vorschläge zu den verschiedenen Themen werden bis zu einem vorher festgelegten Termin veröffentlicht. Für einen bestimmten Geldbetrag (dieser wird das Grundkapital des Restaurant werden) kann jeder an der Abstimmung teilnehmen. Wichtig dabei ist, das wir NGO´s die Web 2.0-Szene in diesen Prozess miteinbeziehen, da dieses Projekt die Demokratisierung der Wirtschaft via Internet darstellt. Alles nach dem Motto „Investiert nicht wegen der Renditen, sondern investiert in die Demokratie und in gemeinsame Lebensqualität!“, da ein von den Wählern festgelegter Prozentsatz des Gewinns in soziale und/oder ökologisch Projekte der Region zurück fließt.

Stufe 2

Nach dem Aufbau des Restaurants verbindet dieses sich langfristig mit einem Bio-Landwirt in unmittelbarer Nähe der Stadt München. Das Restaurant finanziert die jährlichen Kosten des landwirtschaftlichen Unternehmens im Voraus und erhält den dem entsprechenden Teil der Ernte. Durch die Kooperation mit dem Bio-Landwirt entsteht ein Vertrauensverhältnis zwischen den „Aktionären“/Gast/Kunde und dem Bio-Hof, welcher einen gewissenhaften und nachhaltigen Umgang mit der Natur gewährleistet. Die „Aktionäre und das Restaurant erhalten ein Mitbestimmungsrecht über den Anbau und die Wahl der Sorten und Tiere, welche auf den Hof gepflanzt bzw. gehalten werden. Die Erzeugnisse werden an das Restaurant geliefert, durch dieses veredelt und zum Kauf angeboten. Überschüsse der landwirtschaftlichen Produkte werden kostengünstig an sozial schwache Bürger abgegeben. Die Zusammenarbeit mit dem Bio-Hof unterliegt dem Konzept der solidarischen Landwirtschaft. Die Vorteile dieser Landwirtschaft:

Die „Aktionäre“/Kunde/Gast/Restaurant erhalten:

  • Qualität: frische, lebensspendende Nahrungsmittel

  • Transparenz: Wissen wo und wie Nahrungsmittel angebaut werden, wer sie anbaut und zu welchen Kosten

  • Regionale Nachhaltigkeit: Aufbau von ökonomischen Strukturen, durch eine lebendige lokale Landwirtschaft gestärkt wird

  • Erfahrungsräume und Bildung: Bewusstsein über die Beziehung zur Erde, dem Land und den Prozessen, die unser Leben möglich machen                                                                                  

Der Landwirt erhält:

  • Eine Gemeinschaft: Planungssicherheit und die Möglichkeit der Unterstützung

  • Ein gesichertes Einkommen: Möglichkeit eines planbaren Einkommens und sich daher einer gesunden Form der Landwirtschaft widmen können

  • Freude an der Arbeit: Zu wissen für wen die Lebensmittel bestimmt sind

Der Hof:

  • ist geschützt vor Schwankungen des Marktes

  • ist geschützt vor schädlicher landwirtschaftlicher Praxis

Die Region:

  • wird durch die Vielfalt in der Landwirtschaft ein Ort mit höherer Lebensqualität

  • wird gestärkt durch das Zusammenbringen von Menschen, die gesunde Bedenken über unsere Zukunft teilen

  • erfährt einen ökonomischen Wandel, da die Wertschöpfung verstärkt in der Region bleibt

  • wird entlastet durch die kurzen Versorgungswege

Solidarische Landwirtschaft Stand Juli 2012
story_txt:
Das sozial-ökologische Restaurant
Was möchten wir tun?
Mit dem Aufbau eines Restaurants via Internet, durch die User und dem Fach-Personal, unter Berücksichtigung sozialer und ökologischer Aspekte, wollen wir die Demokratisierung der Wirtschaft, die Erhöhung der gemeinsamen Lebensqualität und die Lösung gesellschaftlicher Probleme erreichen.
Welches Problem lösen wir damit?
Wir präsentieren auf einer Internet-Seite das Grundkonzept eines sozial-ökologischen Restaurant. Jeder Interessierte kann dann dort, bis zu einem festgelegten Termin, seine Ideen und Wünsche in Bezug der Einrichtung, Dienstleistungen, Lage, Speisen, Getränke usw. loswerden. Für ein Sponsorengeld (welches ein Teil des Kapitals des Restaurants werden wird) von 10 bis 50€, kann dann nun jeder „Mitunternehmer“ mit abstimmen. Bei dieser Abstimmung wird auch festgelegt, wie viel des Gewinns des Restaurants, in welches soziale oder ökologische Projekt fließt. Die Ideen und Kreativität der User entscheiden wie erfolgreich das Unternehmen werden kann und sie sind gleichzeitig an der Lösung sozialer und ökologischer Probleme mit beteiligt. Dieses Projekt stellt die Demokratisierung der Wirtschaft, unter Berücksichtigung sozialer und ökologischer Aspekte, via Internet dar. Ziel ist es in möglichst vielen Gemeinden Restaurants aufzubauen.
Welche Vorteile vor anderen Produkten/Dienstleistungen/Projekten bringt unser Konzept? Was ist der USP?
Vorteile unseres Unternehmens:-aus der Sicht der Arbeitenden: die Sicherheit der Beschäftigten die egalitäre Einkommensverteilung die Teilhabe am Eigentum des Produktivvermögens die gleichberechtigte Teilnahme an den betrieblichen Entscheidungen der kooperative, demokratische, freundschaftlich Geist untereinander die Einbettung in die Lebensräume-aus der Sicht der Planung: die weitsichtige und zukunftsorientierte Politik des Genossenschaftsrats die hohe Produktivität die Dynamik die Transparenz die effektive Kontrolle aller Arbeitsbereiche durch die Werktätigen und „Aktionäre“die straffe Entscheidungsstruktur des Betriebs und ihrer Vernetzung-aus der Sicht der Kunden und Verbraucher: die entsprechend ihrem gebrauchszielfachlich, ökologisch bzw. biologisch hohe Qualität das gute Gefühl, dass das ausgegebene Geld nicht nur einer Elite zu Gute kommt, sondern unter den Arbeitenden gerecht aufgeteilt wird, um dann wieder in den Wirtschaftskreislauf zurückzukehren und so eine gemeinsame hohe Lebensqualität der Gesellschaft zu gewährleisten das soziale Engagement des Betriebs Ein weiterer Kundennutzen besteht darin, dass wir den Bürgern über das Restaurant, eine Möglichkeit einräumen aktiv in das Wirtschaftsleben und in die Gestaltung ihre Region einzuwirken. Ein Unternehmen zu gestalten welches ihren Wünschen, Bedürfnissen entspricht und einen Teil des Gewinns in soziale und ökologische Projekte reinvestiert, von denen sie unmittelbar profitieren werden.
“Go for a cause”: Wofür engagieren wir uns mit dieser Idee? Welches Anliegen ist uns wichtig?
Ethisches Beschaffungsmanagement-Kooperation nur mit Lieferanten, welche sich an den sozial-ökologischen Werten der Gemeinwohlökonomie orientierenEthisches Finanzmanagement-Kapital wird durch „Aktionäre“, NGO´s und Lieferanten bereitgestellt Arbeitsplatzqualität- wird durch Mitarbeiterbeteiligungsmodell gewährleistetGerechte Verteilung des Arbeitsvolumen- ergibt sich aus der MitarbeiterselbstbestimmungFörderung ökologischen Verhaltens der Mitarbeiter- durch Bestimmung der „Aktionäre“ und ständige WeiterbildungGerechte Verteilung des Einkommens- entsteht durch egalitäre Lohnverhältnisse und den Teil des Gewinns, welcher in die Region reinvestiert wird, Gleichstellung ist eine der Grundvoraussetzungen unseres ProjektsInnerbetriebliche Transparenz und Mitbestimmung-gewährleisten wir durch das Mitarbeiterbeteiligungsmodell und einer „offenen Zahlenpolitik“Ethisches Verkaufen-erfolgt durch den sozial-ökologischen Aktionärsauftrag und die nachhaltigen ProdukteSolidarität mit Mitunternehmen-entsteht durch langfristige Verträge und Erzeugung von Win-win-SituationenÖkologische Gestaltung der Produkte und Dienstleistungen-resultiert durch Erzeuger und Kooperation mit Bio-Verbänden und UmweltschutzorganisationenSoziale Gestaltung der Produkte und Dienstleistungen-gewähren wir durch sozial engagierte Produzenten und dem speziellen Aktionärswunsch (Spezialangebote für Kinderreiche und Arbeitslose usw.)Erhöhung der sozialen und ökologischen Branchenstandards-entwickelt sich automatisch durch Lieferanten, Aktionäre und Kooperation mit UmweltverbändenGesellschaftliche Wirkung/Bedeutung der Produkte/Dienstleistungen-ergibt sich aus den gesellschaftlich hochwertigen Produzenten bzw. Lieferanten und den Einfluss der Aktionäre auf das Restaurant (Internetplattform)Der Beitrag zum Gemeinwesen-folgt aus der demokratischen Wirtschaftsweise, den sozial.ökologischen Produkten und der Unterstützung sozial-ökologischer ProjekteReduktion ökologischer Auswirkung-wird durch ständige Weiterbildungsmaßnahmen und der Zusammenarbeit mit Umweltschutzorganisationen gewährleistetMinimierung der Gewinnausschüttung an Externe-Gewinnausschüttung an Externe findet nur als Investition in soziale und/oder ökologische Projekte der Region statt/ AktionärsauftragGesellschaftliche Transparenz und Mitbestimmungist eine der Grundvoraussetzungen unseres Unternehmens und wird durch die Internetplattform (demokratische Wirtschaftsweise) und einen jährlichen Gemeinwohlbericht verbreitet
Wofür planen wir das Geld, welches wir durch das Crowdfunding einnehmen, einzusetzen?
Das Crowdfundinggeld würde für den Aufbau der Internetplattform eingesetzt werden. Bevor wir mit unserem Restaurant wirklich durchstarten, werden wir eine Internet-Seite aufbauen. Diese Internet-Seite wird das Herzstück unserer Unternehmung werden. Auf jener wird dann das Grundkonzept eines sozial-ökologischen Restaurant vorgestellt. Jeder Interessierte kann dann dort seine Ideen und Wünsche in Bezug Einrichtung, Dienstleistungen, Lage, Speisen, Getränke usw. loswerden. Des Weiteren können sich Sponsoren( Organisationen, Vereine) und zukünftige Lieferanten/Partner (auch mit ihren Waren) vorstellen/werben. Bis zu einem vorher festgelegten Termin werden alle Vorschläge gesammelt. Die Besten, die Kreativsten und Durchführbaren werden anschließend auf der Internet-Seite präsentiert. Für ein Sponsorengeld (welches ein Teil des Kapitals des Restaurants werden wird) von 10 bis 50€, kann dann nun jeder „Mitunternehmer“ mit abstimmen. Für IT-Fachleute werden dann auch die API´s geöffnet sein, damit sie, wenn sie Lust und Laune haben, die Plattform nach ihren Vorstellungen gestalten können. Nicht zu vergessen, bei dieser Abstimmung wird auch von den Mitunternehmern festgelegt, wie viel des Gewinns des Restaurants, in welches soziale oder ökologische Projekt fließt. So entscheiden die Mitunternehmer durch ihre Ideen und Kreativität (und ihr Sponsoring), wie erfolgreich das Unternehmen werden kann und sind gleichzeitig an der Lösung sozialer und ökologischer Probleme mit beteiligt. Dieses Projekt stellt die Demokratisierung der Wirtschaft, unter Berücksichtigung sozialer und ökologischer Aspekte, via Internet dar. Somit kann jeder Mitunternehmer ein Stück Zukunft mitgestalten, alles nach dem Motto: Wir investieren nicht wegen der Renditen, sondern wir investierten in die Demokratie und in gemeinsame Lebensqualität. Das ist das WEB 2.0, das ist die Zukunft!
Was bieten wir unseren Crowdfunding-Unterstützern als Dankeschön für ihre finanzielle Unterstützung an?
Da viele hochrangige Wirtschaftsexperten der Meinung sind, dass sich mit dem „Bioboom“ auch das sozialverantwortliche Unternehmertum stark entwickeln wird, sehen wir gerade jetzt die große Chance, uns in diesem Marktsegment zu etablieren. Unser Ziel wäre eine Kooperation/Allianz bestehend aus Lieferanten, Erzeugern, Händlern, Organisationen/Verbänden, Gästen bzw. Kunden und Medien zu erschaffen, aus welcher win-win Situationen entstehen. Der immaterielle Konsum steigert das persönliche Glück mehr als der materielle. Deshalb steht in unserem Konzept die Erhöhung der Lebensqualität und die Förderung der ressourcenschonenden „Konsumartikel“ wie Kultur, Kunst, Naturerleben, Persönlichkeitsbildung usw. im Mittelpunkt. Die direkte Investition und Mitbestimmung der Lieferanten, Händler und der Bürger (welche im Konzept näher beschrieben werden) dient nicht der Profitmaximierung, sondern der direkten Erhöhung der Lebensqualität der Bürger und der Region. Durch den effektiv-nachhaltigen Einsatz von Sachkapital, Naturkapital, Humankapital, Sozialkapital und Finanzkapital versuchen wir einen ständigen Strom an Gütern und Leistungen zu erbringen, die zum Wohlbefinden der Bürger beitragen. So entsteht ein soziales Wachstum, welches nicht auf Kosten des Natur- und Sozialkapitals entsteht. Im Gegenteil, Human- und Sozialkapital werden ausgebaut und Naturkapital wird erhalten. Diese Art des Wirtschaftens gibt dem Sach- und Finanzkapital eine vollkommen neue Rolle und Wirkung.
Zusätzliche Informationen
Sobald die Finanzierung der Internetplattform steht, versuchen wir über das Internet und andere Medien die größtmögliche Aufmerksamkeit zu erregen. Die Internetplattform stellt das Herzstück unserer Unternehmung dar. Auf dieser wird dann das Grundkonzept eines sozial-ökologischen Restaurant vorgestellt. Wichtig dabei ist, das wir NGO´s die Web 2.0-Szene in diesen Prozess miteinbeziehen, da dieses Projekt die Demokratisierung der Wirtschaft via Internet darstellt. Alles nach dem Motto „Investiert nicht wegen der Renditen, sondern investiert in die Demokratie und in gemeinsame Lebensqualität!“, da ein von den Wählern festgelegter Prozentsatz des Gewinns in soziale und/oder ökologisch Projekte der Region zurück fließt.
Stufe 2

Überschüsse der landwirtschaftlichen Produkte werden kostengünstig an sozial schwache Bürger abgegeben. Die Zusammenarbeit mit dem Bio-Hof unterliegt dem Konzept der solidarischen Landwirtschaft. story:
WE MADE IT!!!

Tremendous thanks to all of you who contributed and spread the word! 

Now stay-tuned to your inboxes, Facebook, Twitter and oroeco.com for more news about our impending beta launch...

 

"Oroeco’s mission is to fundamentally shift the global economy towards sustainability" - Forbes

"The Captain Planet of Web 2.0" - VentureBeat

"Oroeco rewards you for personal climate action" - Clean Technica

"See how purchases directly impact climate change" - Discovery

"Oroeco tackles climate change, one purchase at a time" - Reuters

"A big, intriguing idea" - Boston Globe

 

What's awesome about Oroeco?

Hi Indiegogoers! Welcome to Oroeco, the app that tracks how your personal values link to your everyday life, then rewards you for improving upon the things you care about most. 

What exactly do we mean by that? Well, we're building a system that automatically links your spending and investment transactions to scientific data that calculates the impacts of each decision. You'll be able to see how your personal impacts compare to your neighbors, as well as your Facebook friends, and even (we hope) celebrities. AND (even better), you'll be able to compete to improve vs. yourself and your friends, get personalized tips, and earn "oro" points to cash in for both virtual and real world prizes.

We're aiming to empower you with information to sort out big choices from small. We think you deserve to get rewarded when you put your money where your heart is, and the more information and incentives you have for making better choices, the more companies will be encouraged to make more sustainable products (since they won't get your money if they don't).

oroeco = your $ + your $'s impacts + tips, games, & rewards

 

Oroeco 1.0 & OPTIMUM

What we're launching through Indiegogo is our first web app. This app will automatically track your spending and investments (initially through Mint.com), then add social and environmental impacts, starting with greenhouse gas emissions. So our first app will essentially be a fun, social, real-time carbon calculator that shows how all aspects of your life impact global climate change. Then you'll get rewarded for helping us refine your figures, reducing your impacts, and sharing and competing with friends. 

All Oroeco users will get the ability to track their spending impacts for free. Oroeco OPTIMUM subscribers will also be able to track the impacts of their investments. For those of you who love bullet points, here's the scoop on Oroeco 1.0 and Oroeco OPTIMUM:

Oroeco 1.0 app:

  • Automatically track spending transactions;
  • Visualize the climate change impacts of each transaction;
  • Get personalized tips for improvement;
  • Set goals for yourself, and be reminded to fulfill them;
  • Compare and compete with Facebook friends;
  • Earn "oro" points, virtual prizes, and real world rewards.

Get personalized tips, set goals, and add reminders to help meet them. [Product mockup. With your help our 1.0 app will look a lot better!]

Dissect your impacts and watch them improve over time.

Estimate impacts from individual purchases.

Challenge yourself and your friends.

Earn "oro" points, along with both real and virtual rewards.

Track your community's progress and watch your influence grow!

 

Oroeco OPTIMUM app (all of the above + the following):

  • Automatically track the climate impacts of your stock portfolio;
  • Get personalized tips for improving investment impacts;
  • Compare, compete, and earn rewards for better investments;
  • Ability to customize the appearance of your entire Oroeco profile.

Oroeco OPTIMUM visualizes your investment impacts. [Product mockup. The real deal will look better than this, with your help!]

Find investments that return profits while protecting people and the planet.

 

Our Master Plan (and why we need your $$$)

Climate change is just the first of many personal value-related impacts that we plan to eventually let you track through Oroeco. We're also looking at some great databases that will link your spending and investments to a bunch of other important social, environmental, and personal health indicators (like living wages, forced labor, local sourcing, water quality, air pollution, biodiversity, health impacts related to your diet and exercise habits, and the influence of corporate money in politics).

We're focusing on climate change because we have to start somewhere, and it's an important issue our team is passionate about. We also already have all the climate data we need to make a very cool proof-of-concept product. 

So what we've got now is a solid team of scientists and engineers who have already linked up a spending data feed from Mint.com to climate change data. And we just added Facebook friend comparisons, along with personalized improvement tips. 

What we're lacking is the ability to pay a user-interface (UI) designer to make our app fun, intuitive, and utterly gorgeous. What you see above are just mockups to give a sense of the functionality we're initially going for, so please don't hold the clunkiness of the current design against us! Our current alpha product has most of this functionality illustrated above, but we're planning to substantially improve the aesthetics and UI before our 1.0 launch (we just need $$ to do it). 

We'd also like to raise enough funding for a mobile design specialist who can turn our web app into a sexy little portable package (initially HTML5, then native iOS, Android, and Windows Mobile). There are also server hosting fees we'll need to cover as we grow, and plenty of other development costs that have been piling up.

So that's why we're reaching out to all y'all Indiegogoers to help turn our Master Plan into reality. We're fully "bootstrapping" at the moment, so all our costs have been coming out of our own (quite limited) pockets. We're hoping to far exceed our $15k goal, but that's the minimum amount we need to launch our first version of Oroeco. The more money we can raise, the more resources we'll have to add in other environmental, social and health impact indicators, and the more useful (and fun!) Oroeco will become.

Master Plan = you use Oroeco and get your friends to do the same >> good companies get rewarded, bad companies are encouraged to clean up (or close) >> a sustainability revolution driven by informed citizens!

 

What you get out of the deal

All of our Backers who pledge $5 or more get access to our private beta. So you'll get to start using Oroeco before we launch it to the public, and you'll also have the opportunity to tell us how to improve our functionality and design to suit your needs and aesthetic sensibilities.

Those of you who pledge more will get access to Oroeco OPTIMUM, which tracks impacts from your investments, as well as your spending decisions (see above for more info on Oroeco 1.0 vs. Oroeco OPTIMUM). We'll be launching Oroeco OPTIMUM as a paid subscription service, so our Backers will get a discount (that varies based on how much you pledge).

Folks who donate even more will get some spiffy artistic goodies as tokens of our undying affection.

Handcrafted Oroeco mugs. Your coffee never looked better!

Organic cotton T-shirts take Oroeco style to the streets.

 

Team Oroeco

Kirstin Cummings: After wrapping up grad school at Stanford, Kirstin began her career researching machine learning at Stanford's Center for the Study of Language and Information, writing code to help computer programs learn how to do things like solve math problems and navigate virtual cars down virtual roads. Moving into the start-up world, she became one of the first software engineers at imeem, an early music-streaming service. She's proudly earned certificates in both graphic design and artisan cheesemaking, and she's a founding member of women's vocal ensemble Musae.

Yang Ruan: Currently a grad student at UC Berkeley's Goldman School of Public Policy, Yang is building bridges between policymakers and engineers (fancying herself a bit of both). With an undergraduate degree in electrical engineering from MIT, she has experience in private sector supply chains from working on various stages of product development. Yang also worked on MIT's Climate CoLab project, attempting to make climate-economic models a bit more accessible to the public. She dabbles in a multitude of computer programming languages, and she's excited to delve into the intricacies of environmental finance and sustainability gaming with Oroeco.

Ian Monroe: Raised on a small farm in the wilds of Mendocino County, CA, Ian picked up undergrad and grad degrees in Earth Systems from Stanford. He spent most of the last decade bouncing around the world on projects linked to clean energy, international development, and sustainable business, working with clients ranging from ginormous corporations and government agencies to NGOs and family farmer cooperatives. He's rather obsessed with the power of environmental life cycle assessment (LCA), as well as edible mushroom hunting. He also moonlights as a Visiting Scholar and Lecturer at Stanford, where he teaches courses on climate change and renewable energy technologies.

There are a bunch of other quality humans who have contributed substantial time, ideas, and/or artwork to the Oroeco endeavor. We didn't cram them all into the video, but check out our Team page for their bios and sexy pics. Plus, we've rounded up over 40 fabulous advisors, who are constantly tossing in more ideas and connections to help nudge Oroeco in the right direction.

A few of the faces bringing Oroeco to life. [click for more info]

 

Our Story (as told by Ian)

The idea for Oroeco started brewing slowly, and it's grown through hundreds of conversations, personal experiences, and technical experimentation. 

I've been working around the globe for much of the past decade. From Asia and Africa, to Latin America, Europe and all over the US, I've gotten a chance to poke my head into many of the complex supply chains that make up our global economy. I've seen plenty of companies exploiting workers and the environment. But I've also seen a growing number of companies that take corporate responsibility quite seriously, spurred on by both aware consumers and internal champions for change.

The piece that's still missing though, is better information transfer, particularly information that makes it all the way from raw materials production and manufacturing to individual shoppers and investors (i.e. all of us). While many companies have realized it can pay to be "green," many just go far enough to get a label (organic, fair trade, etc) then blow the rest of their budgets on marketing. Governments can force companies into better practices, but politics and conflicts of interest keep much from happening, and globalization makes it easy to sweep unsightly images under someone else's rug.

Seeing this made me wonder whether the best way to drive a real, systemic shift towards sustainability would be to create a system that empowers all of us with better information and incentives. The easiest way to do this is to track the impacts of how we spend and invest our money, since many of the things we care about (both big and small) are ultimately driven by the collective power of our wallets.

Oroeco estimates full "life cycle" impacts of products and services.

Around the same time these thoughts were bubbling to the surface, I started doing research on environmental life cycle assessment, a scientific method for evaluating net impacts. This research made me realize that there are already huge databases that calculate the impacts of our choices, from how we get to work and power our homes, to what we eat for lunch. The problem has been that this data sits tucked away in the nooks and crannies of academia, industry, and high-priced consultants. Even when data is publicly available, it's generally not packaged in a way that's relatable, and it's certainly not automatically linked to our decisions in a way that's engaging.

The idea for Oroeco really clicked when I realized we can now combine life cycle data with smart phones, online banking (via Mint.com, and similar sites), social networks, and gaming mechanics to create a service that's informative, rewarding, and (most importantly) FUN! 

So "Oroeco" ("oro" for gold, "eco" for both ecology and economics) was born in the spring of 2011, and I set off on a quest to round up teammates. First was my friend David, a Stanford physicist and journalist who had just biked 21,000 miles around the Americas researching and talking about climate change. A few months later I reconnected with Kirstin, another college friend with a passion for personal sustainability, and the tech skills to turn ideas into actual app development.

Yang enthusiastically joined our crew last winter, adding more app developer mojo and life cycle assessment experience to the team (from her research at MIT and UC Berkeley). Then Yang roped in her friend Dav, a Berkeley+MIT guru of behavioral psychology, climate informatics, and database programming, who's PhD research is a perfect fit for what we're building.

Team Oroeco has now evolved from a network of friends into the first version of a product we hope takes the world by storm. We're mostly scientists and engineers, with some artists and (do-gooder) lawyers tossed in for good measure. We are all passionate about this project, and we're convinced we've got the technical skills to pull it off. Now we just need your help to fund us along the way!

Oroeco = happier, healthier planet + happier, healthier you!

 

you + Oroeco + your friends = a better world                   (cheesy, but we're convinced it's true)

We've got all the data and tech we need to breathe life into Oroeco. The more money we raise, the better our first version of Oroeco will be. But even more fabulous is the fact that each one of you who pledges your support is demonstrating that you care about the impacts of your everyday decisions, and that you're willing to help create a system that makes these impacts more transparent.

Once we launch Oroeco 1.0, our biggest challenge will be finding and engaging users. Ultimately, Oroeco's positive influence on the planet will depend on 1) the number of users we have, and 2) the amount our users use Oroeco to inform their decisions. Thus, we'll constantly be looking for ways to improve our user experience, beautify our UI, create more enticing rewards, and spread the word far and wide. We hope you and our other first users from Indiegogo will play a large role in all these endeavors. The more you encourage your friends to use Oroeco, the more our impacts will scale, and the more leverage we'll have for shaping the world we really want to live in.

Thanks for your support, and spread the word!
story_txt:
WE MADE IT!!! 
Tremendous thanks to all of you who contributed and spread the word! 
Now stay-tuned to your inboxes, Facebook, Twitter and oroeco.com for more news about our impending beta launch...
 

"Oroeco’s mission is to fundamentally shift the global economy towards sustainability" - Forbes
"The Captain Planet of Web 2.0" - VentureBeat
"Oroeco rewards you for personal climate action" - Clean Technica
"See how purchases directly impact climate change" - Discovery
"Oroeco tackles climate change, one purchase at a time" - Reuters
"A big, intriguing idea" - Boston Globe 
  
What's awesome about Oroeco?
Hi Indiegogoers! Welcome to Oroeco, the app that tracks how your personal values link to your everyday life, then rewards you for improving upon the things you care about most. 
What exactly do we mean by that? Well, we're building a system that automatically links your spending and investment transactions to scientific data that calculates the impacts of each decision. You'll be able to see how your personal impacts compare to your neighbors, as well as your Facebook friends, and even (we hope) celebrities. AND (even better), you'll be able to compete to improve vs. yourself and your friends, get personalized tips, and earn "oro" points to cash in for both virtual and real world prizes.
We're aiming to empower you with information to sort out big choices from small. We think you deserve to get rewarded when you put your money where your heart is, and the more information and incentives you have for making better choices, the more companies will be encouraged to make more sustainable products (since they won't get your money if they don't).

oroeco = your $ + your $'s impacts + tips, games, & rewards
 
Oroeco 1.0 & OPTIMUM
What we're launching through Indiegogo is our first web app. This app will automatically track your spending and investments (initially through Mint.com), then add social and environmental impacts, starting with greenhouse gas emissions. So our first app will essentially be a fun, social, real-time carbon calculator that shows how all aspects of your life impact global climate change. Then you'll get rewarded for helping us refine your figures, reducing your impacts, and sharing and competing with friends. 
All Oroeco users will get the ability to track their spending impacts for free. Oroeco OPTIMUM subscribers will also be able to track the impacts of their investments. For those of you who love bullet points, here's the scoop on Oroeco 1.0 and Oroeco OPTIMUM:
Oroeco 1.0 app:

Automatically track spending transactions;
Visualize the climate change impacts of each transaction;
Get personalized tips for improvement;
Set goals for yourself, and be reminded to fulfill them;
Compare and compete with Facebook friends;
Earn "oro" points, virtual prizes, and real world rewards.

Get personalized tips, set goals, and add reminders to help meet them. [Product mockup. With your help our 1.0 app will look a lot better!]

Dissect your impacts and watch them improve over time.

Estimate impacts from individual purchases.

Challenge yourself and your friends.

Earn "oro" points, along with both real and virtual rewards.

Track your community's progress and watch your influence grow!
 
Oroeco OPTIMUM app (all of the above + the following):

Automatically track the climate impacts of your stock portfolio;
Get personalized tips for improving investment impacts;
Compare, compete, and earn rewards for better investments;
Ability to customize the appearance of your entire Oroeco profile.

Oroeco OPTIMUM visualizes your investment impacts. [Product mockup. The real deal will look better than this, with your help!]

Find investments that return profits while protecting people and the planet.
 
Our Master Plan (and why we need your $$$)
Climate change is just the first of many personal value-related impacts that we plan to eventually let you track through Oroeco. We're also looking at some great databases that will link your spending and investments to a bunch of other important social, environmental, and personal health indicators (like living wages, forced labor, local sourcing, water quality, air pollution, biodiversity, health impacts related to your diet and exercise habits, and the influence of corporate money in politics).
We're focusing on climate change because we have to start somewhere, and it's an important issue our team is passionate about. We also already have all the climate data we need to make a very cool proof-of-concept product. 
So what we've got now is a solid team of scientists and engineers who have already linked up a spending data feed from Mint.com to climate change data. And we just added Facebook friend comparisons, along with personalized improvement tips. 
What we're lacking is the ability to pay a user-interface (UI) designer to make our app fun, intuitive, and utterly gorgeous. What you see above are just mockups to give a sense of the functionality we're initially going for, so please don't hold the clunkiness of the current design against us! Our current alpha product has most of this functionality illustrated above, but we're planning to substantially improve the aesthetics and UI before our 1.0 launch (we just need $$ to do it). 
We'd also like to raise enough funding for a mobile design specialist who can turn our web app into a sexy little portable package (initially HTML5, then native iOS, Android, and Windows Mobile). There are also server hosting fees we'll need to cover as we grow, and plenty of other development costs that have been piling up.
So that's why we're reaching out to all y'all Indiegogoers to help turn our Master Plan into reality. We're fully "bootstrapping" at the moment, so all our costs have been coming out of our own (quite limited) pockets. We're hoping to far exceed our $15k goal, but that's the minimum amount we need to launch our first version of Oroeco. The more money we can raise, the more resources we'll have to add in other environmental, social and health impact indicators, and the more useful (and fun!) Oroeco will become.

Master Plan = you use Oroeco and get your friends to do the same >> good companies get rewarded, bad companies are encouraged to clean up (or close) >> a sustainability revolution driven by informed citizens!
 
What you get out of the deal
All of our Backers who pledge $5 or more get access to our private beta. So you'll get to start using Oroeco before we launch it to the public, and you'll also have the opportunity to tell us how to improve our functionality and design to suit your needs and aesthetic sensibilities.
Those of you who pledge more will get access to Oroeco OPTIMUM, which tracks impacts from your investments, as well as your spending decisions (see above for more info on Oroeco 1.0 vs. Oroeco OPTIMUM). We'll be launching Oroeco OPTIMUM as a paid subscription service, so our Backers will get a discount (that varies based on how much you pledge).
Folks who donate even more will get some spiffy artistic goodies as tokens of our undying affection.

Handcrafted Oroeco mugs. Your coffee never looked better!

Organic cotton T-shirts take Oroeco style to the streets.
 
Team Oroeco
Kirstin Cummings: After wrapping up grad school at Stanford, Kirstin began her career researching machine learning at Stanford's Center for the Study of Language and Information, writing code to help computer programs learn how to do things like solve math problems and navigate virtual cars down virtual roads. Moving into the start-up world, she became one of the first software engineers at imeem, an early music-streaming service. She's proudly earned certificates in both graphic design and artisan cheesemaking, and she's a founding member of women's vocal ensemble Musae.
Yang Ruan: Currently a grad student at UC Berkeley's Goldman School of Public Policy, Yang is building bridges between policymakers and engineers (fancying herself a bit of both). With an undergraduate degree in electrical engineering from MIT, she has experience in private sector supply chains from working on various stages of product development. Yang also worked on MIT's Climate CoLab project, attempting to make climate-economic models a bit more accessible to the public. She dabbles in a multitude of computer programming languages, and she's excited to delve into the intricacies of environmental finance and sustainability gaming with Oroeco.
Ian Monroe: Raised on a small farm in the wilds of Mendocino County, CA, Ian picked up undergrad and grad degrees in Earth Systems from Stanford. He spent most of the last decade bouncing around the world on projects linked to clean energy, international development, and sustainable business, working with clients ranging from ginormous corporations and government agencies to NGOs and family farmer cooperatives. He's rather obsessed with the power of environmental life cycle assessment (LCA), as well as edible mushroom hunting. He also moonlights as a Visiting Scholar and Lecturer at Stanford, where he teaches courses on climate change and renewable energy technologies.
There are a bunch of other quality humans who have contributed substantial time, ideas, and/or artwork to the Oroeco endeavor. We didn't cram them all into the video, but check out our Team page for their bios and sexy pics. Plus, we've rounded up over 40 fabulous advisors, who are constantly tossing in more ideas and connections to help nudge Oroeco in the right direction.

A few of the faces bringing Oroeco to life. [click for more info]
 
Our Story (as told by Ian)
The idea for Oroeco started brewing slowly, and it's grown through hundreds of conversations, personal experiences, and technical experimentation. 
I've been working around the globe for much of the past decade. From Asia and Africa, to Latin America, Europe and all over the US, I've gotten a chance to poke my head into many of the complex supply chains that make up our global economy. I've seen plenty of companies exploiting workers and the environment. But I've also seen a growing number of companies that take corporate responsibility quite seriously, spurred on by both aware consumers and internal champions for change.
The piece that's still missing though, is better information transfer, particularly information that makes it all the way from raw materials production and manufacturing to individual shoppers and investors (i.e. all of us). While many companies have realized it can pay to be "green," many just go far enough to get a label (organic, fair trade, etc) then blow the rest of their budgets on marketing. Governments can force companies into better practices, but politics and conflicts of interest keep much from happening, and globalization makes it easy to sweep unsightly images under someone else's rug.
Seeing this made me wonder whether the best way to drive a real, systemic shift towards sustainability would be to create a system that empowers all of us with better information and incentives. The easiest way to do this is to track the impacts of how we spend and invest our money, since many of the things we care about (both big and small) are ultimately driven by the collective power of our wallets.

Oroeco estimates full "life cycle" impacts of products and services.
Around the same time these thoughts were bubbling to the surface, I started doing research on environmental life cycle assessment, a scientific method for evaluating net impacts. This research made me realize that there are already huge databases that calculate the impacts of our choices, from how we get to work and power our homes, to what we eat for lunch. The problem has been that this data sits tucked away in the nooks and crannies of academia, industry, and high-priced consultants. Even when data is publicly available, it's generally not packaged in a way that's relatable, and it's certainly not automatically linked to our decisions in a way that's engaging.
The idea for Oroeco really clicked when I realized we can now combine life cycle data with smart phones, online banking (via Mint.com, and similar sites), social networks, and gaming mechanics to create a service that's informative, rewarding, and (most importantly) FUN! 
So "Oroeco" ("oro" for gold, "eco" for both ecology and economics) was born in the spring of 2011, and I set off on a quest to round up teammates. First was my friend David, a Stanford physicist and journalist who had just biked 21,000 miles around the Americas researching and talking about climate change. A few months later I reconnected with Kirstin, another college friend with a passion for personal sustainability, and the tech skills to turn ideas into actual app development.
Yang enthusiastically joined our crew last winter, adding more app developer mojo and life cycle assessment experience to the team (from her research at MIT and UC Berkeley). Then Yang roped in her friend Dav, a Berkeley+MIT guru of behavioral psychology, climate informatics, and database programming, who's PhD research is a perfect fit for what we're building.
Team Oroeco has now evolved from a network of friends into the first version of a product we hope takes the world by storm. We're mostly scientists and engineers, with some artists and (do-gooder) lawyers tossed in for good measure. We are all passionate about this project, and we're convinced we've got the technical skills to pull it off. Now we just need your help to fund us along the way!

Oroeco = happier, healthier planet + happier, healthier you!
 

you + Oroeco + your friends = a better world                   (cheesy, but we're convinced it's true)

We've got all the data and tech we need to breathe life into Oroeco. The more money we raise, the better our first version of Oroeco will be. But even more fabulous is the fact that each one of you who pledges your support is demonstrating that you care about the impacts of your everyday decisions, and that you're willing to help create a system that makes these impacts more transparent.
Once we launch Oroeco 1.0, our biggest challenge will be finding and engaging users. Ultimately, Oroeco's positive influence on the planet will depend on 1) the number of users we have, and 2) the amount our users use Oroeco to inform their decisions. Thus, we'll constantly be looking for ways to improve our user experience, beautify our UI, create more enticing rewards, and spread the word far and wide. We hope you and our other first users from Indiegogo will play a large role in all these endeavors. The more you encourage your friends to use Oroeco, the more our impacts will scale, and the more leverage we'll have for shaping the world we really want to live in.
Thanks for your support, and spread the word!

story:
El Camino Real de los Tejas National Historic Trail Association is a non-profit, 501 (c)(3) organization.  The association is an advocacy group that seeks to protect the historic integrity of the trail, to educate the public about its significance, and to promote resource development, interpretation, and tourism along its path.

The goal of our fundraising effort is to jump at an amazing opportunity to purchase and protect a piece of the trail in east Texas.

El Camino Real de los Tejas means “the royal road of the Tejas Indians.”  Historically the road connected Mexico City to Los Adaes, the first capital of Texas.  This allowed Spanish influence to spread into the province.  The road also allowed Anglo settlers to head west into Texas in the 1800s, and was a major artery of trade and culture.  The trail created the cultural diversity of Texas that we know today.

El Camino Real is composed of many famous sites and segments.  These include places such as the Alamo and the San Antonio Missions, Mission Tejas and Caddo Mounds, and Los Adaes.

On October 18, 2004, El Camino Real de los Tejas was designated as a National Historic Trail and part of the National Trails System.

This makes El Camino Real part of a unique group of trails that have been deemed “nationally significant” by the US Congress.  So if you can imagine all of the history of our country, only nineteen events have been deemed “nationally significant,” and this trail that led to the founding of Texas is one of them!

Yet, even for the national significance of El Camino Real, it is one of the most endangered historic resources in Texas.  This is due to the fact that the trail spans 2,580 miles across 40 counties, 2 parishes, and 2 states, and only 1% of the trail is protected in public sites such as state parks.

Highway expansion, housing and energy development all destroy the trail little-by-little each day.  Yet, we have the opportunity to purchase and protect a portion of the trail from such a fate.

In far east Texas, there is a set of trail remnants that are unparalleled in their magnitude!  Seven remnants of the Royal Road, as much as 20 feet deep and 12 feet wide, lay side-by-side, as a sort of “superhighway.”  The property is for sale, and with your contribution, the association can acquire and protect it.

When the association acquires the property, it will be protected forever.  We will also develop a visitor use and stewardship plan for the site.  This will allow the property to be opened to the public and ensure a vicarious experience of traveling the trail, just as explorers and settlers did hundreds of years ago!

Join us in preserving a piece of irreplaceable history on the landscape.  And make sure that the road that led to the founding of Texas is not forgotten!

Thank you for your support!

story:
Don't Frack the Briggs


Hey folks. We're a campaign in Bishopbriggs, created by local residents, with the goal of preventing fracking, unconventional gas extraction, shale gas exploration and so on from occurring in Bishopbriggs. 
We feel this campaign is incredibly important because there is so much at stake. We don't want to experience earthquakes, we don't want our water table to be compromised by toxic gases, we don't want to open yet another fossil fuel industry which is slowly, but surely, destroying our environment.
A contribution from yourself will help us out massively. We are a local, non-profit, community pressure group. We are completely self-funded, with help arising from either donations from the community or the Bishopbriggs community council. But we don't want to be reliant on the council, as they have other issues that they must deal with, which means it isn't fair for us to keep running away with their coins.
A donation is greatly appreciated, and will go a long way.

What We Need 


We have signed up with a target of £500. This, hopefully, will allow us to get people to protests, book lets for public meetings, movie nights and other community activities.

The month of November saw us host the biggest public meeting in relation to fracking in Scotland to date, with over 335 attendees. We drew massive names into the debate, including Patrick Harvie of the Scottish Green Party, and Tom Pickering, a senior director from Ineos. 

Every single penny goes right back into protesting against fracking, from banners, to reusable placards, from transport to and fro protests, to hiring halls for public meetings.

The Impact


Our project is just one of hundreds of thousands of local anti fracking groups in the world. It is so heartening to see so many communities come out and oppose fracking and we personally hope this continues.

So far we have organised buses for folk to come to and fro protests, and are currently organising a bus for the 25th of January. We're hoping the money raised here could go towards that.

Also, we are in the process of organising a fracking movie night in Bishopbriggs Academy, and hope that it can be a roaring success, just like the public meeting.

There are many ways to contact us, so if you want to know how your money is being used you can ask us via Facebook, twitter or email.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money then don't worry, you can still help us out massively!

  • You can get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by sharing our page on Facebook, by tweeting us and talking to your friends and family about us.
  • Remember, you can use the Indiegogo share tools, too!

story:
Community Solar Comes to Minnesota!

Northfield Area Community Solar (NACS) is currently in the process of creating a solar garden to provide Northfield residents the opportunity to access solar energy to power their homes! In order to participate in the community solar garden, residents must purchase a "leaf" (a subscription to the solar garden). However, this can be difficult to afford for many households and families. To make solar energy accessible to all, the Community Action Center of Northfield (CAC) is teaming up with students to create a campaign to provide low income housing complexes in Northfield access to solar energy!


What We Need & What You Get

Where your money is going:

Your donations will go directly to the CAC. The CAC will then use this money to purchase as many leaves as possible for meters attached to low income housing complexes. The CAC will then use the money saved to subsidize heating expenses equally throughout the low income housing complexes because the CAC actively subsidizes for heating expenses for all of the complexes but only pays for electricity for a select few residents. In the end, this campaign functions as a means to support the community and promote solar energy locally, while also making renewable energy accessible to parts of the community that would not otherwise have the ability to purchase a subscription. 

Why $930?

We need to raise approximately $930 to afford one leaf subscription. Each leaf costs $889, but IndieGoGo requires a portion of the money. If we are able to raise enough money for multiple, then the CAC will purchase as many leaves as possible. If the donations do not add up to a full leaf subscription, the CAC will use a portion of their own budget to afford an additional leaf. 

The Impact

The campaign supports the community and encourages local solar energy production, while also expanding accessibility to renewable energy to parts of the community that would not otherwise have the ability to purchase a subscription. By saving on energy costs, your donations will help ease the burden of low income households and promote environmental justice for all.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Share the link with family and friends! No matter how far, anyone is welcome to donate and become a part of the Northfield Area Community Solar Garden.

story: Students in Professor Evans' Conservation Biology course  this semester at Sewanee: The University of the South, learned how the demand for palm leaves by churches on Palm Sunday has created a market for illegally harvested palm leaves from the rain forests of Belize.This "palm connection" is precipitating the loss of biodiversity in Chiquibul National Park, one of the last great rainforest preserves in Central America. Friends for Conservation and Development (FCD), a non-profit located in the Chiquibul, is leading the efforts to solve this complex problem. The goal is to generate awareness of the "palm connection" to the loss of rainforest biodiversity in Belize and raise money to support FCD. So please help us by donating today!

story:
FLIR Expansion Project

ShaleTest is a non-profit organization that provides FLIR video and environmental testing to families and communities who are negatively impacted by shale oil and gas extraction. The FLIR camera detects and visualizes harmful gases quickly from a safe distance and in real time. FLIR technology has been a game-changer in the fight to protect our environment from dangerous impacts of shale oil and gas development. We want to do more - we want to be active on as many shale plays across the country as we can.

Professional FLIR training for John Fenton

We need to raise $3,000 for FLIR camera training and travel expenses.

  • John Fenton has volunteered to head up our FLIR Expansion Project.
  • All money raised through this fundraiser will go towards FLIR training for John and toward the FLIR Expansion Project. If we aren't able to reach our goal, all money raised will go towards FLIR filming in areas  for those who are impacted by shale oil and gas activities.

Toxic pollution from shale oil and gas drilling and production are real and our use of FLIR videography is of benefit to all citizens, scientists and grassroots organizations

Public health, safety and environmental justice are basic human rights. Our goal with ShaleTest is to bolster these rights through responsible and informed scientific testing, disclosure and transparency.

    • These FLIR videos are used for education, research and community outreach.
    • The video findings stand in strong contrast to statements made by industry representatives and policymakers seeking to expand drilling by dismissing claims of health impacts as personal anecdotes and isolated incidents.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, we understand, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Spread the word about negative impacts of shale oil and gas development.
  • Volunteer for local environmental groups.
  • Of course, we all need to reduce our carbon footprint – simply reduce, reuse and recycle. Use less plastic and rely on wind and solar as much as possible!
story_txt:
FLIR Expansion Project 

ShaleTest is a non-profit
organization that provides FLIR video and environmental testing to families and
communities who are negatively impacted by shale oil and gas
extraction. The FLIR camera detects and visualizes harmful gases quickly
from a safe distance and in real time. FLIR technology has been a game-changer
in the fight to protect our environment from dangerous impacts of shale oil and
gas development. We want to do more - we want to be active on as many shale plays across the country as we can.


Professional FLIR training for John Fenton We need to raise $3,000 for FLIR camera training and travel expenses.  John Fenton has volunteered to head up our FLIR Expansion Project. All money raised through this fundraiser will go towards FLIR training for John and toward the FLIR Expansion Project. If we aren't able to reach our goal, all money raised will go towards FLIR filming in areas  for those who are impacted by shale oil and gas activities.
    
Toxic pollution from shale oil and gas drilling
and production are real and our use of FLIR videography is of benefit to all
citizens, scientists and grassroots organizations
 
Public health, safety and environmental justice are basic human rights. Our goal with ShaleTest is to bolster these rights through

story:
Join Sirena on the Arizona Trail Trek- celebrating the trail and connecting Gateway Communities one step at a time to raise $20,000 for the Arizona National Scenic Trail!

Why the Campaign? 

The Arizona Trail Association (ATA) needs your support! This campaign is a crowd funding effort to rally outdoor and environmental communities to support the future of this incredible national scenic trail. Federal funds for land preservation and trail maintenance are drying up due to sequestration and federal spending cuts. Improving the quality of the Arizona Trail, protecting its corridor, and taking the necessary steps to ensure its long-term preservation is not a priority of state or federal decision makers. We know it’s important to those who use and love the trail. 

Funds from this campaign will directly support: 

  • trail maintenance and protection 
  • repairing segments of trail damaged by wildfire and erosion 
  • installation of steel gates that keep motorized vehicles off the trail 
  • map printing and distribution 
Working together we can sustain the AZT for future generations.


What is the Arizona National Scenic Trail?

The Arizona Trail is an 800+ mile recreation trail from Mexico to Utah that connects mountain ranges, canyons, deserts, forests, wilderness areas, historic sites, trail systems, points of interest, communities, and people. It serves dayhikers, backpackers, equestrians, mountain bicyclists, trail runners, nature enthusiasts, cross-country skiers, snowshoers, and mule and llama packers. 

The Arizona Trail Association's mission is to build, maintain, promote, protect and sustain the Arizona Trail as a unique encounter with the land.  

The Arizona Trail Trek is an interactive thru-hike from March 14th to May 31st with 14 Gateway Community events, selected hikes and backpacking trips highlighting the best the trail has to offer, and on-the-trail updates as Sirena hikes up the state.

Who is Sirena Dufault?

Sirena is the Gateway Community Liaison for the Arizona Trail Association and an avid hiker/backpacker.  In 2007 she began volunteering with the ATA, helping to build many miles of trail near Tucson. In 2008-2009 she section-hiked the Arizona Trail to raise awareness of Fibromyalgia, a chronic pain condition she has had since 1997.  The adventure kindled a passion for the trail and the wild lands of Arizona.  She became the Trail Steward for Passage 16c, responsible for maintaining 5.5 miles of trail along the Gila River.  Now, as the Gateway Community Liason, she has cultivated a relationship between trail users and the 33 Gateway Communities along the trail while promoting area tourism to stimulate local economies.  Learn more about Sirena and follow her adventure on the AZT through her blog at: http://desertsirena.wordpress.com/.

Urgency to Support the ATA

In 2011 we celebrated the completion of the 800+ miles of trail from Mexico to Utah, but there is still a lot of work to do.  

  • 120 miles of trail need reconstruction to meet the standards of a National Scenic Trail, including moving the tread away from roads and creating a more sustainable trail. 
  • Many gates and crossings require upgrading to better accommodate equestrians.
  • The ATA needs funds to protect the corridor in the face of land management changes such as mining projects, utility development and exploratory natural gas drilling. 
  • The cost of routine trail maintenance by professional trail crews (who do the work volunteers cannot) is $150,000 annually. 

    • The Forest Service budget is shrinking dramatically, and this is impacting how the AZT is managed and supported by our federal agency partner. The ATA is the leading organization in the building, maintenance, protection and promotion of the Arizona Trail. The ATA works hard to protect the trail in ways federal agencies can’t to ensure the trail experience won’t be compromised and the AZT will be here for future generations.

    What Is In It For You?

    There are a number of levels for giving, each with it's own unique and exclusive incentives.  

    All Donations of $25 or more receive a Limited Edition AZT Trek Bandana and Sticker.  (Please note that there is a additional charge for international shipping.)



    $10: Saguaro Shout-Out  You are amAZing, and you're committed to making the AZT one of the premiere trails in America.  We'll give you a shout-out from the trail!

    • $25: Made in the Shade  Get the Limited Edition AZT Trek Bandana to keep your noggin' cool in the Arizona sunshine.  We'll throw in the matching AZT Trek Sticker, too - just 'cause you're amAZing!


    • $50: Sip It  Get the special Arizona Trail pint glass (frosty beverages not included) for showing your support while you sip your favorite drink trail side.


    • $100: In the Know The new guidebook to the Arizona National Scenic trail, signed by the author and Sirena means you will have the latest and greatest information on the Arizona National Scenic trail at your fingertips!

    • $250: Journey to Center Receive the original signed art print by Cole Habay "Journey to Center" representing the many wonders found along the Arizona Trail.

    • $300: Capture YOUR Arizona This is a once-in-a-lifetime experience: a special invitation to a 4-hour custom Arizona Highways Photo Workshop: Capturing Memories on the Arizona Trail!


    • $500: AZT Swag Pack You'll be sporting the finest Arizona Trail Attire, AND be in the know!  You get AZT hat, t-shirt, pint glass, socks, signed Guidebook and Topo CD - plus original signed art print by Cole Habay "Journey to Center". A fine art print (your selection) from the AZT Trek Collection signed by Sirena, Recognition in the ATA Newsletter. Limited edition bandanna and AZT Trek sticker included.


    • $500: Raft the Colorado River Colorado River Discovery will take you and a guest on a guided motor raft tour of one of the most dramatic stretches of river found in the western United States. Recognition in the ATA Newsletter. An epic journey AND supporting the AZT - that's a win-win.

    All Donation levels over $800 will be invited to a special reception for Arizona Trail Supporters! 

    • $800: Burnin' Up the Trail! A limited edition, handcrafted, custom steel Arizona Trail chimenea...the next best thing to a campfire beside the trail. Recognition in the ATA Newsletter. (Item to be pick-up at ATA office or donor pays shipping charges).


    • $1000: Trail Brew Master  One exclusive opportunity for 2 lucky people to be "Brewers for a Day" with THAT Brewery in Pine , AZ.  Includes THAT Arizona Trail Ale, 2 limited edition AZT Pint Glasses, Bag and signed Guide Book. Recognition in the ATA Newsletter. 

    • $3000: Pedal It  You and 2 of your friends are invited to experience the Arizona Trail by mountain bike with ATA Executive Director Matt Nelson.  This full-day trip will be custom designed for your experience and skill level, and will include lunch on the trail and car shuttle. Since Matt is a former professional guide, you’ll learn about the botany, biology, geology and cultural history too!  Also includes 3 Limited Edition Pint Glasses; 3 Guidebooks signed by author and Sirena; signed limited edition print “Journey to Center" by Cole Habay; and Recognition in the ATA Newsletter.

    • $5000: The High Point  A guided 3 day / 2 night fall color backpack on the AZT in Flagstaff area customized for up to 4 people.  Get tales from the trail from the woman who's seen it all, not to mention great backpacking tips and local information.  Also includes 4 Limited Edition Pint Glasses; 4 Guidebooks signed by author and Sirena; signed limited edition print “Journey to Center" by Cole Habay; and Recognition in the ATA Newsletter.

    • $10,000: Leading the Way For the ultimate AZT supporter: premier photo workshop with Arizona Highways Photo Workshops at the Grand Canyon for 1 person. Take a look: Grand Canyon - Rim to Rim. Also includes 4 Limited Edition Pint Glasses; 1 Guidebook signed by author and Sirena; a signed limited edition print “Journey to Center" by Cole Habay; and Recognition in the ATA Newsletter.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Become Member of the Arizona Trail Association! Consider becoming a long-term supporter and friend with the Arizona Trail Association as we work to preserve and protect this incredible corridor and trail. See here for details!

    Spread the Word! We need ALL the help we can get sharing this campaign.  Please consider doing one or all of the following throughout our 60 day campaign!

  • On Facebook (use a photo of yourself on the AZT!)
  • On Twitter (use  # AZTtrek and include @AZTRAIL)
  • In emails to your friends and family
  • With any hikers, writers, bloggers, outdoor magazines & publications
  • Create photos and flyers and post at local retail shops!
  • Hiked on the AZT? Share your photos and stories with us!  You can email them to: azttrek@aztrail.org

    • Referral Contest!

    To show our appreciation for your help, we will recognize the person with the most Indiegogo referrals with a special Oracle Gateway Community Prize Package.  Package for 4 includes one night at El Rancho Robles Guest Ranch, lunch at Oracle Patio Cafe, and a Zip Line Adventure.  Restrictions apply.

    Here's how you participate:

    1. Log in to your Indiegogo account you utilized to make your donation.
    2. Cut & paste the URL in the "Share This Campaign" section to share your the personalized link on your social media (e.g. Facebook, G+, LinkedIn, Twitter), email, and websites.
    3. Track Referrals - when someone clicks on your shared link and contributes to this campaign, they will appear in your referrals (under My Profile beneath your name when you login)

    We will share the top three contenders regularly until the campaign closes to keep you informed of the status.

    Campaign Sponsors

story:
Thank you for considering a donation to our campaign! 

The Story:

We're a group of residents living in Norfolk, VA who are affected by coal dust from Norfolk Southern's (NS) Lambert's Point coal export facility. We're mothers, fathers, sisters, daughters, sons, brothers, grandmas and grandpas and everything in between.  We've been campaigning for over a year to get NS to take simple, common-sense measures to stop their toxic coal dust from blowing into our neighborhoods: enclose the dumpers and the conveyances to the ships and cover the coal cars. These are commonplace practices in similar facilities, but NS, a Fortune 500 giant, refuses to act on the 1973 recommendation of their own consultant and resident complaints made over many years. They have even spread misinformation about the issue in local media and have publicly proclaimed that their coal dust is harmless, contrary to documented links to respiratory and heart diseases and premature death. We have met with and asked NS directly to take the requested mitigation measures. Also, over 500 people signed a petition asking the Norfolk City Council for a resolution to the same effect. The Virginia Department of Environmental Quality (DEQ) granted NS an exemption to the Clean Air Act 50 years ago and refuses to take any regulatory action, despite the threat to public and environmental health. The Norfolk City Council refuses to act on the resolution. 
We can't stand by while NS continues to dump 90,000 or more pounds of coal dust into our neighborhoods each year.  


The Goal:

This fundraising campaign is to raise money for print, online, and billboard advertising. This would enable us to recruit more people into the campaign and put more public pressure on NS. 

Here is how our fundraising goal breaks down for a 6 month period: 


Facebook/Online Ads: $4,800
VA Pilot Online Ad: $5,000
Radio Ads: $2000
Billboard: $25,000
Total: $36,800

Here is how our perks break down: 

Any donation amount: You'll receive a confirmation email for your donation. We'll also list you on our Facebook Page in a "Thank You" post, unless you opt out. 
Donation of $5 or more: STOP THE COAL DUST bumper sticker  
Donation of $20 or more: STOP THE COAL DUST bumper sticker and a STOP THE COAL DUST yard sign delivered (if you live in Norfolk, Portsmouth, Chesapeake, or Virginia Beach) 
Donation of $40 or more: STOP THE COAL DUST bumper sticker, a STOP THE COAL DUST yard sign delivered (if you live in Norfolk, Portsmouth, Chesapeake, or Virginia Beach) and a complimentary pass for 1 movie at the Naro Cinema 
Donation of $100 or more: STOP THE COAL DUST bumper sticker, a STOP THE COAL DUST yard sign delivered (if you live in Norfolk, Portsmouth, Chesapeake, or Virginia Beach), a complimentary pass for 1 movie at the Naro Cinema, and a gift certificate to a Ghent business. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute you can still help!

  • Like our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/CoalDustBlues, share it with your friends, and share this Indiegogo campaign as well! 
  • Sign our petition to NS CEO James Squires asking him to stop the coal dust!
  • Sign our petition asking Norfolk City Council to support the coal dust resolution
  • If you live in Norfolk and deal with coal dust you can file a complaint 3 ways: 
  • 1). Dept. Environmental Quality at tinyurl.com/DEQCOMPLAINT
  • 2). Dept. of Emergency Management at 800.468.8892, 24-hr hotline; 
  • 3). File complaints to Norfolk Southern's "Coal Dust Reporting Hotline" at 800.621.0772


More Background information: 

Here is a more background info (and even more here)... The NS Lamberts Point terminal in Norfolk, VA is the largest coal export facility in North America. While transporting and unloading millions of tons of coal from 200,000 rail cars each year, NS allows 90,000 lbs of toxic coal dust to escape into our neighborhoods and the Elizabeth River. The cumulative amount of coal dust released over the past 50 years may come to 2 million pounds.  Despite reaping billions in profits annually, NS has refused thus far to honor our request since April of 2014 to implement reasonable mitigation measures. 

We daily see the effects of coal dust. It routinely covers our cars and houses and anything else outdoors. That presents a nuisance factor and an added cleaning expense; however, the greatest harm comes from the link to adverse health effects from the arsenic, mercury, lead and other heavy metals in the dust: decreased lung capacity, increased childhood bronchitis, asthma, pneumonia, emphysema, heart disease, increased infant mortality rates and premature death. 

Norfolk Southern could easily solve this problem with less than 1% of its annual gross revenue by simply enclosing the dumpers, the conveyors and the ship loading chutes and covering the rail cars. Instead they deny that there is a problem or even acknowledge the scientific fact that their coal dust harmful.
