story:
UPDATE - Community Celebration Party planned for Feb 7th!

To conclude the crowd-sourced campaign, WaterWealth has teamed up with Major League 2 Pub in Chilliwack to host a celebration event on Friday, February 7th. Everyone is welcome to attend, however donors through the Indiegogo campaign will receive a complementary drink or dinner ticket! If you live close to the Fraser Valley we need you to come out and join the team that cares about ensuring long-term, effective protection for the region's waterways.

Great news... We've secured some amazing home-water inspired works of art to offer as perks! 

Thanks to the generosity of Gary Haggquist -- a talented Fraser Valley artist and good friend of WaterWealth -- we will be offering prints of his original works at the donation levels of $500 (The Mighty Fraser) and $1000 (A Watershed Moment), 12"x36" paper backed prints and 24"x36" canvas backed prints respectively. You can also receive Gary's art as postcards at the level of $50 (Stream On).

How fantastic, right? Not only would donors at these levels be super-star supporters of our efforts here at the WaterWealth Project, but they will also have a beautiful piece of artwork to enjoy and remember us by! 

Thanks to all who have generously given so far, and remember to help us spread the word -- please tell all your friends, family, and colleagues about The Home Waters Campaign!


OUR WEALTH IS IN OUR WATER, LET'S PROTECT IT!

Hey, I’m Sheila and I work as the Director of The WaterWealth Project with Larry, Nat and Ian. The WaterWealth Project’s goal is “100% Community Control over Our Local Home Waters.” We've made it our mission to empower our local residents to regain control over decisions that affect their home waters - the rivers, lakes and aquifers that are the lifeblood of our towns, cities and regions. 

We are non-partisan, but we engage in the political process to amplify the need for more local control. We encourage our fellow community members to engage alongside us as we work to make the political conversation more accessible for everyone.

We want to demonstrate for communities across North America that taking action to protect our freshwater can unite a democratic movement to shift power back to where it belongs - our communities.


OUR CAMPAIGN:

We focus on what brings us together, rather than what keeps us apart, but we are not shy to speak up on the critical issues. Our core values are respect for First Nations' Rights & Title, the human right to water, and local people having the power to say 'yes' or 'no' to proposals that affect them and their home waters. We believe in a sustainable economy based on businesses that plan to stay in our region, as opposed to those that extract our precious natural resources to make a quick buck, get out of town, and leave long-term costs for our children and grandchildren.

We take our work very seriously, but we use creative tactics - like our blue water lycra suits -  to make water issues visible and maintain a level of fun that ensures we can stick with our mission for the long haul. 

How we'll win

Our communities and our water wealth are facing an onslaught of threats -- pipelines, Nestle, gravel mining, diversions (see below for more detail). Fighting each of these battles individually will only get us so far. So we've decided the only way to truly succeed is by getting proactive and transforming our decision-making structures. We're going to put the power back into the hands of local people and ensure that our communities have the ability to say 'yes' or 'no' to the decisions that affect them (and their children and grandchildren).

By using a strategy of community organizing and tactics of community engagement we will build a team of residents equipped with knowledge and skills to mobilize effectively. With leadership from the Sto:lo First Nations, we will support our communities in working together to develop a powerful vision and protection plan for our rivers, lakes and aquifers. With the support of tens of thousands of local residents we will ensure that government works for our communities, and in the process set a precedent for British Columbia and the rest of the continent.

Where will your donation go?


Our goal is $10,000. If we achieve our goal this will allow us to support two of our local organizers, Nat and Ian, to develop our ground game and get out on the streets engaging and mobilizing our community. This means:

1) Recruiting volunteers. We know they're out there because everywhere we've gone in our communities people have been excited to be part of what we're building. But we need to be in more places and talking with more people. Hey, by the way, do you want to volunteer? If so, click here. 

2) Training our volunteers. We want our volunteers to become change agents and enthusiastic practitioners of community organizing at its finest.

3) Developing materials and getting these on the airwaves, in the papers and on social media. We want to ensure our volunteers are armed with the materials they need and that our campaign is reaching every household in our region.

Your donation will allow us to do these things. It gives us chills just thinking about it!

BONUS! When you make a donation you will also be a lucky recipient of one of our unique perks, as well as a heartfelt thank you from the WaterWealth team.


OUR HOME WATERS

We’re based in Chilliwack, in the heart of the Fraser Valley, and the territory of the Stó:lō First Nations. Our Valley is a jewel of British Columbia and one of the most productive freshwater systems in the world.

  

This valley is home to:

  • STO:LO FIRST NATIONS -  the Stó:lō ('People of the River') are the long-term stewards of our home waters having lived here for thousands of years. The territory is unceded as the Stó:lō  First Nations still have unresolved treaty negotiations in the region.

  • A DIVERSE & GROWING POPULATION - the population of the entire Valley is rapidly increasing. Healthy flowing waters have been essential in supporting a way of life inherently connected to these waters - everything from growing food to family getaways to spiritual practices.
  • SALMON - six beautiful species of salmon, including the largest spawning of pink salmon in North America. Every fall, over 10 million salmon swim upstream through our towns and cities against fierce currents to spawn.

  • EAGLES - the world’s largest convergence of bald eagles. More than 10,000 eagles come to feed off the salmon in this region every year!
  • STURGEON -  the healthiest population of the Giant White Sturgeon on the planet. This species is the largest freshwater fish in North America and can live for more than 150 years. In fact, the largest Giant White Sturgeon was recorded right here in the Fraser River and was over 1,100 pounds and over 12 feet long. 

  • FISHING & RECREATION - one of the best and most popular fishing and freshwater tourism locations in the world. Over 100 businesses are engaged in tourism in Chilliwack alone ranging from accommodations to numerous commercial outdoor operators.
  • AND MUCH MUCH MORE - The wealth in our home waters is reflected by the memories and the stories of the people who call this place home. We have undertaken a process of storymapping to amplify the diverse values the connect us to our local waterways.

What we're up against

This region is now facing unprecedented threats from powerful global forces.

  • KINDER MORGAN TRANSMOUNTAIN PIPELINE - Texas-based energy giant, Kinder Morgan (run by a former Enron Executive), has started shipping thick, tar-like bitumen from the Alberta oil sands through a 60 year old pipeline that runs directly through our drinking water aquifer and crosses dozens of farmer’s fields, school yards, rivers and streams. This bitumen pipeline has a leaking problem with more than 4 ruptures in the Lower Mainland the last 7 years. Instead of replacing or removing their leaky pipeline, Kinder Morgan is seeking approval to build an even bigger one right next to it - tripling the volume of bitumen and increasing the risk of a disastrous spill in our backyards.
  • NESTLE - This year we helped expose that Nestle, the world’s largest food and beverage company, has been grabbing more and more water from our local aquifers without paying a single cent for the privilege. To rub salt into the wounds, Nestle then sells this water back to us in plastic bottles to generate enormous profits.
  • GRAVEL MINING -The region is also being opened up to gravel mining, another mega-industry with deep pockets and influence over government. The mining threatens to rip up the sides of surrounding mountains which filter and regulate the flow of water into our Valley.
  • DIVERSIONS - Every flowing creek and river has been slated for some kind of private power diversion. These are small scale hydro projects that affect fish spawning channels, sacred sites, local swimming holes and some of the best white water kayaking on the West Coast.
  • TOXIC WASTE DISPOSAL - Recently, Ontario-based waste management company Aevitas has put forward a proposal to build an industrial waste disposal site directly alongside the main artery of our home waters - the Fraser River. The site would handle 'toxic & infectious substances' including up to 500,000 mercury and non-mercury light bulbs monthly, and 5,000 litres of electrical transformer oil with a PCB level up to 500 parts per million. 


A MODEL FOR COMMUNITIES ACROSS NORTH AMERICA

We know we are not the only community facing major threats to our home waters. All across North America, local communities are being confronted with the same powerful global forces seeking to build bitumen pipelines, contaminate groundwater with fracking wells, and divert local water sources. If we can win in our community we will share our successes and practices with communities across the continent, and show that water not only gives us life, it can give us hope, democracy, and the power to change how decisions get made.


In addition to your donation, there are three things you can do to help us be successful in our campaign:

1) SHARE, 2) SHARE & 3) MORE SHARE

Use the sharing tools on this page to share our campaign with at least 10 of your friends and family.

Thank YOU!

story:
Welcome!

Greetings and thank you for taking the time to stop by and learn more about me and what I hope to gain from a trip to Costa Rica in January of 2014!

My love for  travel, for the world and for its people, is deep rooted and remains a prominent theme in my quest for mission and purpose in this life. In 2008, I was gifted the opportunity to live and study in Beijing, China--in complete immersion--for an academic year.

It changed my life. I've spent years thinking about what that means exactly and how I can explain it to others and I believe it's this: my life changed when I realized that the boundaries of my reality--my daily routine of school-work-home, and what I dwelled on as "problems"--did not define the limits of what this world had to offer me. And that is a gift in itself.

It is important to me to make the most of this gift. This trip to Costa Rica (through Under30Experiences) will allow me to learn more about and experience the green sustainability of an entire community through a hands-on approach. Rancho Margot in El Castillo, Costa Rica (be sure to watch the video posted above!) is considered a "living university", and my time there will be a stepping stone in my journey to define my path and to give back to our local and global communities by educating myself on how to sustain it for generations to come.

Your contribution will help make this possible!!! 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What Are You Funding?

The cost of the trip is $1000--to cover lodging, transportation, meals, and activities at Rancho Margot. This does NOT include airfare. That's the fun part :) Flights to CR are between $800-$900. Indiegogo's fees range from 4-9% of total campaign funds depending on whether or not you reach your goal (which I am confident we will!).

I've rounded total trip cost to $2000 and have set the campaign to $2200 to account for all fees. EVERY PENNY over the minimum expense for this trip will be donated to an organization of need in one of Under30Experiences' unique travel destinations--I will follow-up with each of you for an update on the recipient of these funds. You have my word that it will be put to GREAT use.

In addition to spending time with locals to understand the challenges of CR, and teaching English to students, I will have the opportunity to explore jungles, volcanoes, mountains, and rainforests. I know those of you that know me well are having a hard time picturing the second half of that sentence! And believe me, the thought of those adventures are located in the polar opposite of my comfort zone.

But that's precisely why I want to do this. Dr. Jasmina Patel--not just my chiropractor, but someone I have come to admire, once told me "vulnerability is the birthplace of hunger, innovation, joy, and success." Thank you for such words of wisdom Doc, sometimes a girl just needs a little push to truly understand the value of a challenge :)

My time spent under chiropractic care has also taught me the importance of investing in myself. In order to reach my goal in 60 days, I'll need to raise about $37 a day. I'll be checking this site daily and will be investing myself--after all, that's the only way I can even think of asking you to do the same.

I'm READY. Let's.Do.This!!!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Other Ways You Can Help

There is no place in my heart that feels a financial donation merits our friendship. You are not obligated to nor owe me anything.  

Even if you cannot contribute at this time, there are other ways you can help!

Help me get the word out about this campaign! You have my gratitude and my permission to post this link to Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, etc.

***Please be sure to use Indiegogo's share tools to help you do this!

Knowledge is power. Visit Under30Experiences to learn more about the opportunities you have to see the world and understand it.

Visit The Beijing Center to see where my journey of self-development began.

And of course, connect with me on LinkedIn or shoot me an email at cohanian87@gmail.com! I'd love to talk to you about my travels and answer any questions you may have.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Most importantly, and from the bottom of my heart, THANK YOU! I am a firm believer in the POWER and VALUE of meaningful travel, and in paying my blessings forward every day. I promise to make you proud and pay this experience forward exponentially.

Rancho Margot in El Castillo, Costa Rica (be sure to watch the video posted above!) is considered a "living university", and my time there will be a stepping stone in my journey to define my path and to give back to our local and global communities by educating myself on how to sustain it for generations to come. Your contribution will help make this possible!!!  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------What Are You Funding?

The cost of the trip is $1000--to cover lodging, transportation, meals, and activities at Rancho Margot. This does NOT include airfare. That's the fun part :) Flights to CR are between $800-$900. Indiegogo's fees range from 4-9% of total campaign funds depending on whether or not you reach your goal (which I am confident we will!). 
I've rounded total trip cost to $2000 and have set the campaign to $2200 to account for all fees. EVERY PENNY over the minimum expense for this trip will be donated to an organization of need in one of Under30Experiences' unique travel destinations--I will follow-up with each of you for an update on the recipient of these funds. You have my word that it will be put to GREAT use.In addition to spending time with locals to understand the challenges of CR, and teaching English to students, I will have the opportunity to explore jungles, volcanoes, mountains, and rainforests. I know those of you that know me well are having a hard time picturing the second half of that sentence! And believe me, the thought of those adventures are located in the polar opposite of my comfort zone. But that's precisely why I want to do this. Dr. Jasmina Patel--not just my chiropractor, but someone I have come to admire, once told me "vulnerability is the birthplace of hunger, innovation, joy, and success." Thank you for such words of wisdom Doc, sometimes a girl just needs a little push to truly understand the value of a challenge :) My time spent under chiropractic care has also taught me the importance of investing in myself. In order to reach my goal in 60 days, I'll need to raise about $37 a day. I'll be checking this site daily and will be investing myself--after all, that's the only way I can even think of asking you to do the same.I'm READY. Let's.Do.This!!!---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------





Other Ways You Can Help
There is no place in my heart that feels a financial donation merits our friendship. You are not obligated to nor owe me anything.  
Even if you cannot contribute at this time, there are other ways you can help!
Help me get the word out about this campaign! You have my gratitude and my permission to post this link to Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, etc. 
***Please be sure to use Indiegogo's share tools to help you do this!
Knowledge is power. Visit Under30Experiences to learn more about the opportunities you have to see the world and understand it.
Visit The Beijing Center to see where my journey of self-development began.
And of course, connect with me on LinkedIn or shoot me an email at cohanian87@gmail.com! I'd love to talk to you about my travels and answer any questions you may have.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Most importantly, and from the bottom of my heart, THANK YOU! I am a firm believer in the POWER and VALUE of meaningful travel, and in paying my blessings forward every day. I promise to make you proud and pay this experience forward exponentially.

story:
The Project

Hi, the project leaders on this project found the news of the terrible typhoon in the Philippines horrible and we wanted to do whatever we can to help. We're huge fans of the Korean pop band "B.A.P" and thought it was a good idea to call BABYz, kpop fans or just regular good hearted to donate in the name of B.A.P. You will be getting some rewards depending on how much you donate.

Many of us Babyz know that the members are donating things to funds, especially Yongguk.  He has been encouraging us for donating and so on. So I wanted us Babyz to do our fair share of the helping. This is for a good cause, it might save lifes.
It both saves lifes and will bring the Baby fandom and B.A.P’s name a better reputation.
You don’t have to be a B.A.P fan to donate, you might be a K-Pop fan or just want to help with the things happening there right now as I write this message and you’re reading this.
I will collect money for 20 days, and I want to bring in about 500$. Even the little dollar helps.

Have any questions? Or just want to know what’s happening on the project?

We will be updating on everything happening on
http://babyz-helping-philippines.tumblr.com/
https://twitter.com/BABYHelping
https://www.facebook.com/babyzhelpingphilippines

Or just send us an e-mail at: babyzhelpingphilippines@gmail.com
We will be happy to answer all your questions!

We just wanted this information to be up as soon as possible and I will be going out with this fundraiser in the city looking for donations, I will also create little "projects" like going out selling cookies and things like that for the fundraiser myself and stuff so I will be pretty active, please help! 


I can't donate, what can I do to help?

You can share this fundraiser and our websites to your friends, family and loved ones, just liking or following our pages will spread the word more so it will definitely help! Also, since this is for the Philippines you can also donate to your local funds for it, it won't get you the rewards and it won't be in B.A.P's name but it will also save lifes!

OBS! To get your perks, like the credit name, letter, picture you have to send us a printscreen of your screen when you're donating to the project for proof that you have actually donated, or have your name on so that it shows, or else we can't take your word on it, because people lie about this stuff.


I guarantee the money will go directly to the funding! We will give proof that we actually donated the money.
Love, some babyz from Sweden.

story:
What is the South Dakota Energy Fairness Initiative - and why should you support it?

South Dakota is one of only a handful of states without fair, marketplace standards set in place to reimburse people for the clean, renewable energy they produce and send back to their utility company or electric cooperative. "Net metering" is a fundamental standard that establishes fairness and opens up economic opportunity for homeowners, farms, ranches, small businesses, and communities. South Dakota has the potential to lead the country in distributed generation electricity, but our policies just don't support it.

So South Dakotans themselves are aiming to change that.

This year we launched the Energy Fairness Initiative, a grassroots campaign to show how right now, South Dakotans who have installed their own electricity generation systems are not being paid fairly for the energy they're feeding back to the grid. If they were, there might be more of a reason for even more people to invest in small-scale solar and wind, making South Dakota more energy independent and clean!

The Energy Fairness Initiative is hosting energy tours at local homes with solar and wind installations, growing a grassroots campaign with South Dakotans at the helm, building statewide coalitions, all with the goal of getting a policy passed in the 2014 Legislature to get South Dakotans a fair price for the energy they produce.

What we need and why

We're a grassroots organization, and a lot of legwork is being done by members. But we also have an organizer who will be at the state Capitol all session, coordinating our policy work and getting members to the Capitol building for some citizen lobbying and to testify.

Getting those members to Pierre, in the middle of South Dakota, in the middle of winter, takes some funding. And putting on energy tours takes funding. And putting out advertising, and radio spots, and direct mailings - it all takes funding.

$20,000 will get us a long way in building the grassroots support we'll need to get our bills passed this January. It will give us the ability to build our base and our power to make South Dakota more energy independent and fair. And it will launch a whole new wave of interest in small-scale energy production at exactly the moment when we need it the most!

The Impact

Small scale, renewable energy helps everyone. It helps even more in rural states like South Dakota, where electricity has to be wired over hundreds of miles for fewer customers than in urban areas. The less far the electricity has to go, the less waste - and the better off all customers are.

And, with the rising cost of coal and the decreasing cost of solar, distributed generation can open up a door to cost savings to everyone on the grid, not just to the person who put up the panels.

Your contribution will help get one of the last states on board for fair distributed generation policies, and will build momentum to help keep the policies already in place in other states like California and New Mexico on the books at a time when utilities are fighting it with all they've got.

Other Ways You Can Help

-Join Dakota Rural Action: We're a membership based grassroots organization, and our members lead the way. Join today and help run the campaign!

-If you're in South Dakota, make sure to contact your legislator and tell them you want fair prices for distributed generation!

story:
­­­Rainmaker Project: Sustainable Fundraising and a Global Game is a reincarnation of the planting activities and agricultural method practiced by the Rainmaker Organization reframed in a global game about sustainability.


レインメーカープロジェクト：サステイナブルファンドレイジングとグローバルゲームは、ファッション・デザインをきっかけに、誰でも参加できる活動として、植林・緑化をおこないます。その目的は、地球温暖化対策やエコロジーな精神を継続的に発揮できる、グローバルなプラットフォームを再構築することにあります。


Become a Rainmaker and participate in the Global game!


Rainmaker Project: Sustainable Fundraising and a Global Game is a game that takes place online and in real life that revolves around the exchanging and planting of seeds.The Rainmaker Project encourages everyone to play an integral role in their local community, as agents of sustainability. The game brings continuous support to the Rainmaker Organization.

“Rainmaker is a person whose influence can initiate progress or ensure success.” –Merriam Webster

The participants of the game are identified as “The Rainmakers” to reflect this identity. Rainmakers participate in collective and individual planting activities that ensure global sustainability success.


あなたが参加することで、レインメーカープロジェクトは、身近な活動からグローバルにひろがります。 

レインメーカープロジェクト：サステイナブルファンドレイジングとグローバルゲームは、植物の種を育てたり、交換することで参加することができます。レインメーカープロジェクトが提供する【グローバルゲーム】は、オンラインと実際の生活の中で、その楽しみと広がりをゲーム感覚で実感することができます。レインメーカープロジェクトは、世界に必要な役割を果たすために参加してくれる皆さんを、レインメーカープロジェクトをサポートしてくれる賛同者【エージェント＝Rainmakers】として認定いたします。

「Rainmakerとは成功のための進歩を開始し、影響力をあたえることができるひと。」-メリアムウェブスター

レインメーカープロジェクトの賛同者は、このポリシーを反映する"Rainmakers"として認められます。Rainmakersは、個人、グループとしての緑化・植林＋ファッション・デザイン・アートプロジェクトに協力することで、世界規模での地球温暖化対策などグローバルな活動を成功に導くための力になることができるのです。


We are aiming to invite the first 500-5000 Rainmakers and Rainmaker leaders!

私たちは、まず500人の影響力をもったRainmakersを募集します。
（2014年には5,000人に拡大する予定です）

I am a Rainmaker

Rainmakerであることを認定された賛同者だけに提供されるファッションアイテム。
それぞれのカラーによって世界共通のステイタスを表現します。

 

 

Before we begin, here is the back story…

“In Spring 2011, I discovered Rainmaker Organization in Japan founded by Masanobu Fukuoka, which promotes a simple, sustainable way to plant various seeds. The organization discovered that covering the seed with clay protects the seed from exterior damage. These clay balls naturally collect water from the air to nourish the seeds inside and can be placed on any soil without the need for water. The structure of the clay ball only allows the seeds that are compatible with the soil underneath to start growing.

During the 1990s, Rainmaker Organization helped grow more greens in Africa, Greece, India, and other dry lands in the hope to produce more green in the world. This was the original Rainmaker Project.

This sophisticated agricultural method has huge potential for sustainably revolutionizing agriculture in developing countries and also to foster interest in sustainable projects in the first world.

Rainmaker Organization needs effective supporters to bring about more awareness of the Rainmaker Project to continue their dream to spread more green in the world, on a personal level and at a global level. However, currently there are not enough supporters. This is especially true when the majority of Japanese people are focused on high-end goods and luxury life styles. The idea of sustainability is still taking time to penetrate into their identity.

After discovering Rainmaker Organization, I emailed them and they invited me to their facility where they told me more about their history and taught me how to hand-make clay balls. I left there wanting to produce new project ideas that would bring support to the organization as a visiting designer and was inspired to help draw more attention to this project. I told the organization that I would love to be a change maker and that there will be a day when I can share my vision with them.

So the reincarnation of the Rainmaker Project is my design gift to Japan and the rest of the world.”

Michelle Moriyasu - Designer


レインメーカープロジェクトのバックストーリー

レインメーカー協会の基盤は、様々な植物を育てるためのシンプルで、継続可能な方法を考案した、今はなき福岡正信氏によって設立されました。

福岡正信氏は、植物の種をオーガニックな養分でできた粘土で覆う事によって外部の損傷から種子を保護することを発見しました。

これらの粘土団子＝クレイシードは種を養うために自然に空気から水を吸収し、化学肥料を必要とせず、蒔かれた土地と相性のよい植物を、自力で発芽し発育することができます。

1990年代、レインメーカーのオリジナルプロジェクトは、世界中（アフリカ、ギリシャ、インド、その他多くの乾燥地帯）で多くの緑を育てることに成功。そのシンプルで洗練された手法は、持続的に発展途上国での農業に革命を起こしました。

そして今、地球温暖化や気候変動への関心が高まるなか、先進国でも、大きな可能性に新たな注目が集まっています。

レインメーカープロジェクトの夢は、世界により多くの緑を広めることによって、地球温暖化や気候変動に立ち向かうこと。その継続のためには個人レベルの支援をグローバルに広げていくことが、効果的であることは間違いありません。

ところが現在は十分な賛同者が存在しません。日本人の大半は、環境へ影響を無視したローコスト製品にばかり焦点を当てているのも理由の一つです。

サステイナビリティの考え方は、ハイエンドなデザイン・クオリティを志向し、自然体でラグジュアリーなアイデンティティを持つ層にのみ、浸透し始めたばかりです。

地球温暖化や環境への危惧を感じていた私が、レインメーカー協会の存在に気づいたとき、すぐにレインメーカー団体にメールでコンタクトをとりました。

その後、施設に私を招待していただき、そしてクレイシードの作り方と彼らの歴史について説明を受けました。私はその場で、デザインとファッションをベースとしたコンセプトと共に、この協会に協力できるようなプロジェクトの提案をすることを決意しました。

私はチェンジメーカーになりたいことと、そしていつか私達のビジョンを共有できる日が来るであろう事を協会の代表者へ伝えました。

さらに多くのみなさんに、レインメーカープロジェクトへの関心を抱いてほしいと考えています。今回ご紹介するレインメーカープロジェクトの新たなアプローチは、日本とまた世界へ、私からのデザインの贈り物です。

Michelle Moriyasu – Designer


So how do you play the game?

Rainmaker Project teaches Rainmakers about clay balls and invites them to grow seeds as their own personalized projects and assignments while documenting and recording their activities to share amongst other fellow Rainmakers. Rainmakers earn game points through their projects. Rainmakers can send seeds to and exchange seeds with other users. Mystery seeds and bonus seeds add to the sense of play and keep the drive going. An online catalogue of seed and plant information will help Rainmakers research and identify the various seeds that they are planting and watching grow.


Rainmakersになったあなたに起こること

レインメーカープロジェクトは、Rainmakersにくれいしーど緑化について教え、実際に育てていただきます。その成長を記録したものを他のRainmakersとの間で共有しながら独自のプロジェクトの発案や、テーマをもって種を育てるプロジェクトに招待します。

プロジェクトを通じてRainmakersはゲームのポイントを獲得できます。Rainmakersは、他のユーザーに自分の種を送る事や、相手の種と交換することもできます。ミステリーシードやサプライズシードでは驚きと遊びの感覚を育てられるでしょう。オンラインシードカタログはRainmakersが育てている種の情報を提供し、あなたの新しい挑戦を支援します。



Rainmaker Objects

レインメーカーオブジェクト

 

How do you become a Rainmaker?

The moment you support and participate in the project, you become a Rainmaker. Rainmaker Project consists of Rainmaker objects/products and fashion that serve to
identify the participants as Rainmakers. Rainmaker products come individually or in a kit: the RP soil, RP seeds, RP original T-shirt, RP project instruction book and an “identity code” for each user.

Identity codes --like sports jersey numbers-- are used online and in person. They help to identify Rainmakers, to allow access to the online hub, to track seed exchange and user participation, and to foster connection to other Rainmakers in the game.

Rainmaker Fashion is exclusively available to participants in the global game. Limited Edition T-shirts will be awarded to Rainmakers with high scores. During collaborative assignments, T-shirts function as game jerseys. Participants across the globe will be able to recognize each other through their fashion and through other Rainmaker products.


もうあなたはRainmakersの一員

あなたがこのプロジェクトに参加した瞬間、もうあなたはRainmakersの一員です。レインメーカープロジェクトはRainmakersとして参加者を識別するために役立つアイテムやファッションで構成されており、Rainmakersのためのオリジナルアイテムは、１つずつ、またはトータルで提供されます。

たとえばRP土、RP種子、RPオリジナルTシャツ、RPプロジェクト取扱説明書、そして、あなただけの "識別コード"です。

識別コードは、スポーツの背番号のようにあなただけのナンバーとして、オンライン上で使用します。Rainmakersを識別し、クレイシードの交換の記録やオンラインのwebサイトへアクセスするために必要となります。

レインメーカーのファッションアイテムは、グローバルゲームの参加者に特別に提供されます。限定版Tシャツは貢献度の高いRainmakersだけのステイタス。

グループプロジェクトではTシャツが識別コードとして機能します。世界中の参加者は、お互いのファッションとアイテムを通じて、チームとしての連帯感を感じることができます。（ぜひTシャツを着ている写真をオンラインにアップロードしてください）


The Rainmaker Hubs

Rainmakers primarily engage the global game online.

Online platforms such as Facebook and official Rainmaker website serve as hubs for Rainmakers to participate in the project. On the hubs, Rainmakers can read Rainmaker features, find out about local events, post photos, and track projects worldwide.  As part of the game, online sharing earns more points and encourages conversation, collaboration, meet ups, and seed exchange amongst fellow Rainmakers. Game sharing includes posting photos of: garden projects, group plant-a-thon activities, your latest mystery seed’s growth, Rainmaker Fashion or Product
sightings, etc.

 

レインメーカーのつながり

Rainmakersはオンラインでグローバルな運動を展開。

Facebookやレインメーカーの公式ウェブサイトなどのオンラインプラットフォームは、プロジェクトに参加するRainmakersを【つなぐ役割＝ハブ】としてあなたをサポートします。

ハブでは、Rainmakersは地元のイベント、写真の投稿や、世界的なプロジェクトについてリアルタイムでオンライン体験、また参加しているRainmakersの特徴を得ることができます。

あなたの活動をオンラインで共有することで、より多くの貢献と影響を与えることになります。オンライン上でのコメントのやりとり、コラボレーション、そしてオフラインでの交流でRainmakersの活動を充実したものにしていきましょう。

ゲームシェアリングのコンテンツには、様々な投稿写真が含まれています：ガーデニング・プロジェクト、グループでの植林活動、あなたのミステリーシードの成長記録、レインメーカーファッションやプロダクト目撃情報などやお勧めコーディネートを公開して共有しましょう。海外の最新情報もチェックしてください。

D3s (Data Driven Documents) will visually document Rainmakers, their locations, and the growth of the project throughout the world.

集められたデータは、デザイン・ビジュアル化され、Rainmakersの活動地域、そして世界中で行われているプロジェクトの成長を記録します。

 

Aims of the Rainmaker Project

The Rainmaker Project strives to achieve the following:

- Rainmaker Project provides the 21st Century with the chance to play an integral role in their local society and to belong to a larger, global community with shared interests and values: sustainability. Being a Rainmaker fosters a strong sense of belonging and offers ways to share sustainability in a playful but meaningful way.

- Rainmaker Project is tied to fashion. We are inviting you to add “sustainable identity” to your wardrobe.

- Rainmaker Project educates through game playing. Manual activities stimulate learning and provide the groundwork for long-lasting memories for all age groups, grandchildren to grandparents. Rainmakers of all ages integrate sustainability into their identity through playing a global game that has learning built in.

- Rainmaker Project serves as a platform to bring continuous support to the Rainmaker Organization in Japan, who grows green in the world.


レインメーカープロジェクトのさらなるビジョン

-レインメーカーのビジョンは、現代の社会において、グローバルなコミュニティに属しつつ、地域社会に不可欠な役割を果たすためのチャンスと、共有による利益と価値観：サステイナビリティーをRainmakersのみなさんに提供します。Rainmakersであることは、ゲームを楽しむように有意義な体験し、それを共有する事が出来ます。

-レインメーカープロジェクトは、ファッションと関係しています。私達はあなたのワードローブに、 "センスとインテリジェンス、問題意識と影響力を持った人物"であることを証明するためのアイテムを、特別にお届けいたします。

-レインメーカープロジェクトは、ゲームを通じてすべての年齢層のインテリジェンスを刺激します。直接手にふれる活動は、五感を通じての学習を促し、印象深い記憶をあなたの中に残すことをお約束いたします。

-レインメーカープロジェクトは世界でより多くの緑を育て、日本のレインメーカー協会への継続的なサポートを提供するためのプラットフォームとして機能します。


We are aiming to invite the first 500-5000 Rainmakers and Rainmaker leaders!

Why do we need your support for the Rainmaker Project?

I need your support to launch the initial phase of the Rainmaker Project.

Phase 1: Includes the cost of printing bags and T-shirts, packaging, seeds, which will help us expand the Rainmaker Project to a broader audience. $25,000 will invite approximately 500 - 5000 Rainmakers. The cost will also cover research to build the architecture of the web and consultation with web programmers.

Phase 2: Covers design development and implementation of the blue print to web design.

Phase 3: Launching the global game.


まず500人の影響力のあるRainmakersをご招待いたします。

そして2014年には、さらに10倍に拡大させることを目標に掲げています。


レインメーカープロジェクトにとって、あなたのサポートが必要な理由。

レインメーカープロジェクトが日本国内にはじめて上陸します。


そのための支援をお願いいたします。

フェーズ1：25000ドルはより広いユーザーにレインメーカープロジェクトを展開する為のバッグ、Tシャツ、パッケージングの印刷、クレイシードを生み出すために役立ちます。また、目標の5000 人のRainmakersを招待するためのWebのプラットフォームのリサーチに費やすことになります。

フェーズ2：RainmakersのためのWebデザイン、設計開発と実装に着手します。

フェーズ3：いよいよ本格的なグローバルゲームの立ち上げが始まります。

 


What You Will Get For Your Support

We want each and every backer to know how much we appreciate your support, and also showing your interest in becoming a Rainmaker and sharing this story with others. I trust that becoming a Rainmaker places you as important leaders and candidates for the 21st century identity.

You are helping a project that nurtures the transition of our minds, our life styles, and our entertainment to be in harmony with sustainability and connects all generations.

The Rainmaker Project is an unprecedented way to participate in sustainable activities that are fun and avant-garde, while making visible changes in the world.

 

あなたの支援が、私たちの生活スタイル、私たちの心の変化を支えることになります。

そして私たちのエンターテイメントは、サステナビリティと調和によって、世代をつなぐ事にもなります。

レインメーカープロジェクトは、世界で目に見える変化を提供しながら、楽しさと現代的スタイルで、地球温暖化対策・植林・緑化運動を推進するために、だれでも参加できる前例のないプロジェクトです。


Rainmaker Project: Sustainable Fundraising and a Global Game is a project by half Japanese, half European designer, Michelle Moriyasu. After graduating from Parsons the New School for Design with a degree in Architectural Design and a certificate in Web and Graphic Design from Digital Hollywood Technical School in Tokyo, she has been doing research on green and social sustainability in Japan. This project informs her mission to synthesize all forms of design to provide and address a unique interdisciplinary approach to sustainability using new ideas, tools, sensibilities, and methods.

 

レインメーカープロジェクトを再生・支援する新しいプロジェクト：【サステイナブルファンドレイジングとグローバルゲーム】は、日本人とヨーロッパの血を持つデザイナー、森安ミシェルによってスタートしました。

彼女は、ニューヨーク・パーソンズ美術大学建築総合デザイン学部を卒業、さらに日本のマルチメディア教育の先駆けである、専門スクール デジタルハリウッドでWebおよびグラフィックデザインを履修しました。それと同時に、緑化・環境・社会コミュニケーションに関する研究を行ってきました。

このプロジェクトは、再生されたアイデア、現代的なツール、あたらしい感性、およびデザインとファッションを融合したメソッドにより、現代における問題にユニークな学際的なアプローチを提供します。
story_txt:
­­­Rainmaker Project: Sustainable Fundraising and a Global Game is a reincarnation of the planting activities and agricultural method practiced by the Rainmaker Organization reframed in a global game about sustainability. 



レインメーカープロジェクト：サステイナブルファンドレイジングとグローバルゲームは、ファッション・デザインをきっかけに、誰でも参加できる活動として、植林・緑化をおこないます。その目的は、地球温暖化対策やエコロジーな精神を継続的に発揮できる、グローバルなプラットフォームを再構築することにあります。


Become a Rainmaker and participate in the Global game!

Rainmaker Project: Sustainable Fundraising and a Global Game is a game that takes place online and in real life that revolves around the exchanging and planting of seeds.The Rainmaker Project encourages everyone to play an integral role in their local community, as agents of sustainability. The game brings continuous support to the Rainmaker Organization.
“Rainmaker is a person whose influence can initiate progress or ensure success.” –Merriam Webster 
The participants of the game are identified as “The Rainmakers” to reflect this identity. Rainmakers participate in collective and individual planting activities that ensure global sustainability success.

あなたが参加することで、レインメーカープロジェクトは、身近な活動からグローバルにひろがります。 
レインメーカープロジェクト：サステイナブルファンドレイジングとグローバルゲームは、植物の種を育てたり、交換することで参加することができます。レインメーカープロジェクトが提供する【グローバルゲーム】は、オンラインと実際の生活の中で、その楽しみと広がりをゲーム感覚で実感することができます。レインメーカープロジェクトは、世界に必要な役割を果たすために参加してくれる皆さんを、レインメーカープロジェクトをサポートしてくれる賛同者【エージェント＝Rainmakers】として認定いたします。
「Rainmakerとは成功のための進歩を開始し、影響力をあたえることができるひと。」-メリアムウェブスター


レインメーカープロジェクトの賛同者は、このポリシーを反映する"Rainmakers"として認められます。Rainmakersは、個人、グループとしての緑化・植林＋ファッション・デザイン・アートプロジェクトに協力することで、世界規模での地球温暖化対策などグローバルな活動を成功に導くための力になることができるのです。


We are aiming to invite the first 500-5000 Rainmakers and Rainmaker leaders!


私たちは、まず500人の影響力をもったRainmakersを募集します。
（2014年には5,000人に拡大する予定です）





I am a Rainmaker


Rainmakerであることを認定された賛同者だけに提供されるファッションアイテム。
それぞれのカラーによって世界共通のステイタスを表現します。
 

 

Before we begin, here is the back story… 
“In Spring 2011, I discovered Rainmaker Organization in Japan founded by Masanobu Fukuoka, which promotes a simple, sustainable way to plant various seeds. The organization discovered that covering the seed with clay protects the seed from exterior damage. These clay balls naturally collect water from the air to nourish the seeds inside and can be placed on any soil without the need for water. The structure of the clay ball only allows the seeds that are compatible with the soil underneath to start growing.
During the 1990s, Rainmaker Organization helped grow more greens in Africa, Greece, India, and other dry lands in the hope to produce more green in the world. This was the original Rainmaker Project.
This sophisticated agricultural method has huge potential for sustainably revolutionizing agriculture in developing countries and also to foster interest in sustainable projects in the first world. 
Rainmaker Organization needs effective supporters to bring about more awareness of the Rainmaker Project to continue their dream to spread more green in the world, on a personal level and at a global level. However, currently there are not enough supporters. This is especially true when the majority of Japanese people are focused on high-end goods and luxury life styles. The idea of sustainability is still taking time to penetrate into their identity.
After discovering Rainmaker Organization, I emailed them and they invited me to their facility where they told me more about their history and taught me how to hand-make clay balls. I left there wanting to produce new project ideas that would bring support to the organization as a visiting designer and was inspired to help draw more attention to this project. I told the organization that I would love to be a change maker and that there will be a day when I can share my vision with them.
So the reincarnation of the Rainmaker Project is my design gift to Japan and the rest of the world.”
Michelle Moriyasu - Designer

レインメーカープロジェクトのバックストーリー


レインメーカー協会の基盤は、様々な植物を育てるためのシンプルで、継続可能な方法を考案した、今はなき福岡正信氏によって設立されました。

福岡正信氏は、植物の種をオーガニックな養分でできた粘土で覆う事によって外部の損傷から種子を保護することを発見しました。

これらの粘土団子＝クレイシードは種を養うために自然に空気から水を吸収し、化学肥料を必要とせず、蒔かれた土地と相性のよい植物を、自力で発芽し発育することができます。



1990年代、レインメーカーのオリジナルプロジェクトは、世界中（アフリカ、ギリシャ、インド、その他多くの乾燥地帯）で多くの緑を育てることに成功。そのシンプルで洗練された手法は、持続的に発展途上国での農業に革命を起こしました。

そして今、地球温暖化や気候変動への関心が高まるなか、先進国でも、大きな可能性に新たな注目が集まっています。


レインメーカープロジェクトの夢は、世界により多くの緑を広めることによって、地球温暖化や気候変動に立ち向かうこと。その継続のためには個人レベルの支援をグローバルに広げていくことが、効果的であることは間違いありません。


ところが現在は十分な賛同者が存在しません。日本人の大半は、環境へ影響を無視したローコスト製品にばかり焦点を当てているのも理由の一つです。
サステイナビリティの考え方は、ハイエンドなデザイン・クオリティを志向し、自然体でラグジュアリーなアイデンティティを持つ層にのみ、浸透し始めたばかりです。





地球温暖化や環境への危惧を感じていた私が、レインメーカー協会の存在に気づいたとき、すぐにレインメーカー団体にメールでコンタクトをとりました。

その後、施設に私を招待していただき、そしてクレイシードの作り方と彼らの歴史について説明を受けました。私はその場で、デザインとファッションをベースとしたコンセプトと共に、この協会に協力できるようなプロジェクトの提案をすることを決意しました。
私はチェンジメーカーになりたいことと、そしていつか私達のビジョンを共有できる日が来るであろう事を協会の代表者へ伝えました。
さらに多くのみなさんに、レインメーカープロジェクトへの関心を抱いてほしいと考えています。今回ご紹介するレインメーカープロジェクトの新たなアプローチは、日本とまた世界へ、私からのデザインの贈り物です。
Michelle Moriyasu – Designer



So how do you play the game?
Rainmaker Project teaches Rainmakers about clay balls and invites them to grow seeds as their own personalized projects and assignments while documenting and recording their activities to share amongst other fellow Rainmakers. Rainmakers earn game points through their projects. Rainmakers can send seeds to and exchange seeds with other users. Mystery seeds and bonus seeds add to the sense of play and keep the drive going. An online catalogue of seed and plant information will help Rainmakers research and identify the various seeds that they are planting and watching grow. 



Rainmakersになったあなたに起こること


レインメーカープロジェクトは、Rainmakersにくれいしーど緑化について教え、実際に育てていただきます。その成長を記録したものを他のRainmakersとの間で共有しながら独自のプロジェクトの発案や、テーマをもって種を育てるプロジェクトに招待します。
プロジェクトを通じてRainmakersはゲームのポイントを獲得できます。Rainmakersは、他のユーザーに自分の種を送る事や、相手の種と交換することもできます。ミステリーシードやサプライズシードでは驚きと遊びの感覚を育てられるでしょう。オンラインシードカタログはRainmakersが育てている種の情報を提供し、あなたの新しい挑戦を支援します。





Rainmaker Objects

レインメーカーオブジェクト

 
How do you become a Rainmaker?
The moment you support and participate in the project, you become a Rainmaker. Rainmaker Project consists of Rainmaker objects/products and fashion that serve toidentify the participants as Rainmakers. Rainmaker products come individually or in a kit: the RP soil, RP seeds, RP original T-shirt, RP project instruction book and an “identity code” for each user.
Identity codes --like sports jersey numbers-- are used online and in person. They help to identify Rainmakers, to allow access to the online hub, to track seed exchange and user participation, and to foster connection to other Rainmakers in the game. 
Rainmaker Fashion is exclusively available to participants in the global game. Limited Edition T-shirts will be awarded to Rainmakers with high scores. During collaborative assignments, T-shirts function as game jerseys. Participants across the globe will be able to recognize each other through their fashion and through other Rainmaker products. 



もうあなたはRainmakersの一員


あなたがこのプロジェクトに参加した瞬間、もうあなたはRainmakersの一員です。レインメーカープロジェクトはRainmakersとして参加者を識別するために役立つアイテムやファッションで構成されており、Rainmakersのためのオリジナルアイテムは、１つずつ、またはトータルで提供されます。
たとえばRP土、RP種子、RPオリジナルTシャツ、RPプロジェクト取扱説明書、そして、あなただけの "識別コード"です。


識別コードは、スポーツの背番号のようにあなただけのナンバーとして、オンライン上で使用します。Rainmakersを識別し、クレイシードの交換の記録やオンラインのwebサイトへアクセスするために必要となります。


レインメーカーのファッションアイテムは、グローバルゲームの参加者に特別に提供されます。限定版Tシャツは貢献度の高いRainmakersだけのステイタス。
グループプロジェクトではTシャツが識別コードとして機能します。世界中の参加者は、お互いのファッションとアイテムを通じて、チームとしての連帯感を感じることができます。（ぜひTシャツを着ている写真をオンラインにアップロードしてください）





The Rainmaker Hubs
Rainmakers primarily engage the global game online.
Online platforms such as Facebook and official Rainmaker website serve as hubs for Rainmakers to participate in the project. On the hubs, Rainmakers can read Rainmaker features, find out about local events, post photos, and track projects worldwide.  As part of the game, online sharing earns more points and encourages conversation, collaboration, meet ups, and seed exchange amongst fellow Rainmakers. Game sharing includes posting photos of: garden projects, group plant-a-thon activities, your latest mystery seed’s growth, Rainmaker Fashion or Productsightings, etc.
 


レインメーカーのつながり


Rainmakersはオンラインでグローバルな運動を展開。


Facebookやレインメーカーの公式ウェブサイトなどのオンラインプラットフォームは、プロジェクトに参加するRainmakersを【つなぐ役割＝ハブ】としてあなたをサポートします。
ハブでは、Rainmakersは地元のイベント、写真の投稿や、世界的なプロジェクトについてリアルタイムでオンライン体験、また参加しているRainmakersの特徴を得ることができます。
あなたの活動をオンラインで共有することで、より多くの貢献と影響を与えることになります。オンライン上でのコメントのやりとり、コラボレーション、そしてオフラインでの交流でRainmakersの活動を充実したものにしていきましょう。
ゲームシェアリングのコンテンツには、様々な投稿写真が含まれています：ガーデニング・プロジェクト、グループでの植林活動、あなたのミステリーシードの成長記録、レインメーカーファッションやプロダクト目撃情報などやお勧めコーディネートを公開して共有しましょう。海外の最新情報もチェックしてください。





D3s (Data Driven Documents) will visually document Rainmakers, their locations, and the growth of the project throughout the world.


集められたデータは、デザイン・ビジュアル化され、Rainmakersの活動地域、そして世界中で行われているプロジェクトの成長を記録します。

 
Aims of the Rainmaker Project
The Rainmaker Project strives to achieve the following:
- Rainmaker Project provides the 21st Century with the chance to play an integral role in their local society and to belong to a larger, global community with shared interests and values: sustainability. Being a Rainmaker fosters a strong sense of belonging and offers ways to share sustainability in a playful but meaningful way.
- Rainmaker Project is tied to fashion. We are inviting you to add “sustainable identity” to your wardrobe.
- Rainmaker Project educates through game playing. Manual activities stimulate learning and provide the groundwork for long-lasting memories for all age groups, grandchildren to grandparents. Rainmakers of all ages integrate sustainability into their identity through playing a global game that has learning built in. 
- Rainmaker Project serves as a platform to bring continuous support to the Rainmaker Organization in Japan, who grows green in the world.

-レインメーカーのビジョンは、現代の社会において、グローバルなコミュニティに属しつつ、地域社会に不可欠な役割を果たすためのチャンスと、共有による利益と価値観：サステイナビリティーをRainmakersのみなさんに提供します。Rainmakersであることは、ゲームを楽しむように有意義な体験し、それを共有する事が出来ます。

The cost will also cover research to build the architecture of the web and consultation with web programmers. 
Phase 2: Covers design development and implementation of the blue print to web design.
Phase 3: Launching the global game.

そのための支援をお願いいたします。

フェーズ3：いよいよ本格的なグローバルゲームの立ち上げが始まります。





 






What You Will Get For Your Support
We want each and every backer to know how much we appreciate your support, and also showing your interest in becoming a Rainmaker and sharing this story with others. I trust that becoming a Rainmaker places you as important leaders and candidates for the 21st century identity.
You are helping a project that nurtures the transition of our minds, our life styles, and our entertainment to be in harmony with sustainability and connects all generations. 
The Rainmaker Project is an unprecedented way to participate in sustainable activities that are fun and avant-garde, while making visible changes in the world.

story:
Cruzin'Cob Website

My Homestead Video (203 Blackburn St. is For Sale!!!)



My name is Claudine Desiree and I live in Santa Cruz, California where I have a business called Cruzin' Cob. I build modern day "cob" buildings (using local clay, sand and straw), teach cob workshops, and consult.  I support the expansion of these hand-sculpted earthen living sculptures into our current building culture.  I support many many people in the realization of their dream to build their own unique natural homes or spaces for very little cost in materials.  These buildings are not only healthful, inexpensive and beautiful , they also represent a movement towards building shelter that supports the long-term health of the Planet and the well-being and housing needs of People.  How many more trees can we afford to fell and concrete can our Planet absorb?



AWESOME 6 MINUTE VIDEO YOU MUST SEE!!!! (by my son Viva!)


My mission is to LEGALIZE MY COB BUILDING making it the first permitted cob structure in Santa Cruz and in a US seismic zone, and one of only a few in the US.  This project, once completed, sets a precedent for and initiates the beginning of legal cob building.  My contribution to the evolution of building codes and policy is a first step. It will open and familiarize the minds of building officials, city government, contractors and residents with COB as a new building option that is clean, simple, sustainable and affordable.  Being the first to permit a cob building in the City of Santa Cruz , I ask for your financial support to make it happen for all of us.  I am helping to make it possible, cheaper and easier for the next cob builders, until cob eventually becomes an approved building material on its own and cob houses will paint the landscapes and neighborhoods .  A beautiful uplifting energizing sight.

Cob buildings require a minimal financial outlay for materials, which are often found on site or nearby.  They are rot-, fire-, termite-, wind-, mold- and even rodent-proof, and perform extraordinarily in earthquakes. 

Shake Test at Univ of British Columbia

They outlive wood, and can return back to Earth cleanly, unlike concrete, steel or treated wood, and do not create any waste material.  They outperform standard conventional building materials (that have strong lobbies behind them) in their overall cost/benefit and pros/cons analysis for the well-being of their inhabitants/builders and that of the Planet. Not even a question. Check out the hundreds of years old buildings that dot the Planet...even the California missions still standing after all the earthquakes...

In addition to feeding the Soul's need for unique, beautiful, personable, natural spaces to reside in, cob buildings support society's call for stimulating visual experiences...Don't you smile every time you drive on the 280 North towards San Francisco and stretch your neck over to see that orange cob dome complex on the right? Don't you love seeing cool handmade original living structures, let alone stepping into them and experiencing their warmth and coziness??? Do you want to live in a world of fun and unusual houses made from a variety of pure and simple materials? Do you want to be able to build yourself a house without hiring a contractor or paying it off for the next 30 years and needing to buy everything from stores and companies?

Ten years ago I built an AWESOME 200 round foot cob studio for myself in my backyard in downtown Santa Cruz, California and when I was done built a second smaller 80 round foot one.  Everyone who sees them loves them. Last year I committed to getting my cob studio permitted no matter what it would take. I wanted to create a legacy for all my cob work and more importantly create an opening for legal cob building to become mainstream.  It has taken a few tries with different engineers and consistent determination and now what I need is only $16,500 to complete the process!!!  I have already invested $3400 in the earlier stages with another engineer and permit fees.

Thus far I have received the permit to go ahead ($2000) and now need to implement the added structural reinforcement (the structural value of the embedded straw mesh is not recognized by engineers yet) designed by the engineer ($9000) using my amazing El Salvadoran creative partner Jorge's skillful work ($3000), buying the materials ($2000) and paying the Special Inspector for the compression tests required on the pure French lime plaster($500).

While I know cob is incredibly strong and structurally sound on its own, I have been willing to retrofit it to be harmonious with the current building code in order to preserve it and show people what it takes at this time to build a "legal" cob building in coastal California.  We will be encircling the inside and outside walls with 14 gauge wire mesh tied into an added foundation at the bottom and to the top of the wall blocking, and then replastering it all with "tested" pure St Astier lime plaster from France. We will also be adding airplane cable through all the rafters.  This whole process will cost  ten times more than what I paid in materials to build it, however since I am the guinea pig and this is a first for the City, I'm having to accept a large investment for the benefit of the next cob builders, to pave the way for legal cob building in urban areas and for saner building materials and practices on our precious Planet!  Let's fill the town with beautiful mud and straw houses that make us feel good and keep us mortgage-free!  Cob expansion will reduce the CO2 in the air from less concrete production and decrease the landfill dump from less conventional building materials residue.  It will also contribute to healthier humans living in breathable peace-inducing homes with walls that protect from EMFs and other harsh radiation waves.

While standard stick frame houses begin to deteriorate after 10 years and have a 50 year life expectancy before they begin to have serious problems, cob houses can last forever as long as they have a good hat (roof) and a good pair of boots (foundation) and are not exposed to flood conditions.  They get stronger with time and can withstand indirect moisture as they have clay plasters which wick moisture away and they can breathe. When totally "cured" they become akin to the original rock from whence they came....

Join me during this strategic time to reshape the way we build and the materials we use, making it legal and open to all to build with the most ubiquitous, affordable and healthy materials on the planet!!!!

Thanks for your contributions to this important campaign!

In Peace and Love

Claudine

story:
The Background

My name is Laura Bramley, and I'm a master's student in biodiversity conservation at Oxford University, planning to monitor a population of forest elephants in Kakum National Park, in the central region of Ghana. Forest elephants were traditionally thought to be a subspecies of the African elephant, but recent research has identified them as a distinct species, as different as Asian elephants are from mammoths.

That said, we know incredibly little about them. Part of that is due to where they live - deep in the rainforests of Western and Central Africa. They're also extremely difficult to observe; most insights have come from a few clearings where the elephants congregate to socialize and take advantage of minerals in the ground, and from dung counts, that draw conclusions based on the signs elephants leave behind.

Unfortunately, forest elephants are facing tremendous pressure, from both habitat loss and conflicts with humans. In Central Africa, a vast study recently estimated that their numbers have declined by about 60% in just a decade, and the population now only occupies 25% of its potential range. In Ghana, forest elephants cling on in tiny remnant forests in protected areas. One of these is Kakum Conservation Area, which holds what is thought to be one of the best-studied and best-protected populations. But even here the signs are worrying - the population is small, possibly less than 200 individuals, and poaching may also be on the increase. My research uses acoustic methods, which are a non-invasive, high-rewards way to study Kakum's elephants. But although I have secured a small travel grant, there is little funding available for master's-level conservation research, so I'm asking for your help to cover the gap and make this project happen.

The Goal

By using acoustic monitoring, not only can I add to what we know about how many elephants there are, where they go over the dry season and why (Do they congregate in certain types of forest? Near sources of fruit or water? And does this change as the season progresses?) but I can also analyze this against indicators of conflict with humans, such as crop raiding outside the park and illegal hunting inside. By knowing how the elephants' habitat preferences compare to places with higher levels of poaching or crop raiding, we can better protect Kakum's population. Acoustic monitoring will be particularly helpful because it will allow us to analyze whether the elephants' habitat preferences change, for example when a particular species of tree goes out of fruit.

To study these things, I will extend an acoustic study of Kakum's elephants that Cornell University's Elephant Listening Project (ELP) undertook over a decade ago. Using Autonomous Recording Units from ELP, I will record elephant calls over a period of three months from December to March. I'll use high-resolution satellite imagery to identify habitat factors that may affect distributions (forest types, species of fruiting trees, water sources, etc.) and see what draws Kakum's elephants to certain locations. In addition, I will record sounds of human activity in the park (particularly gunshots) to provide an "unbiased" estimate of hunting levels to compare to other indicators that park staff have, such as shell casings. This will help enormously to assess the extent of the poaching problem in Kakum!

The Impact

This research will provide important insights by combining two really amazing datasets - satellite imagery available here at Oxford with the non-invasive technology of Cornell's acoustic technology. It will expand our knowledge about Kakum's elephants' habitat needs as well as giving park management another tool to assess the extent of Kakum's poaching problem. By knowing more about where forest elephants congregate and why, we can better protect them from hunters as well as find more effective ways of preventing human-elephant conflict from crop-raiding.

In addition to being a valuable contribution to forest elephant conservation, it will be a tremendous personal journey, and one I look forward to sharing with you. I've got a wealth of advice and support from my supervisors at Oxford, from ELP, and from the field in Ghana, to get this project rolling. With your help, it will be a fantastic success!

Who I am and What I Need:

As a native of upstate New York, my passion for conservation originally came from growing up near the wilderness of the Adirondack State Park. I began my master's at Oxford last year, studying Biodiversity, Conservation and Management. This study will be the thesis project for my degree, and I'm excited to be doing such valuable work!

Although I'm covering my own subsistence costs and have successfully won a travel grant to cover my flight, doing research in Kakum is still expensive, and I'm asking for your help to bridge the gap. A rundown of the costs:

Room and board £1800 (I'm covering this myself)

Flight £600 (covered by a travel grant)

Hiring local park staff (required to work in park) £1100

Tree expert for several days to teach identification in the field £400 - to check the accuracy of the identifications from the satellite imagery.

Batteries (70 6-volt) and memory cards (12) for recording units £700

Transportation to and from site and around conservation area £400

Petrol for field team £100

Malaria medication £300

GPS: £70

Visa fees and park permits £200

Tools and equipment to camouflage and set up recording units £150

Shipping of samples and equipment £300

Internet, phone in the field £100

Indiegogo and credit card fees, perks £150

Although my total goal was £2000, I am hoping to actually make it to £1000 - I am cutting down on some of the time in the park (my biggest expense) and covering the rest through a loan and my student job, so it's all systems go!

What You Get:

I've worked out some great perks to allow you to take part in the journey. This is about YOU actually coming along for the ride, so if you have an idea for a perk you'd be interested in, let me know and I'll add it if I can!

£10 - Hooray! In addition to following the study's progress in my blog, you'll get your name in my thesis as a project supporter. Since the thesis will be deposited in Oxford's official collections, your name will be in the Bodleian Library for posterity! You'll also get a personal e-card thanking you for your support, with a beautiful photo from the field.

£25 - Kicking it old-school - as well as an e-card, get a real-live postcard in the mail, complete with the coolest Ghanaian stamp I can find.

£50 - In addition to all of the above, take an exclusive virtual journey to Ghana. I know you'd rather come along yourself, but here's the next best thing - a multimedia experience with the sights, sounds and experiences of the trip. See Kakum National Park, hear what it's like to be in the rainforest, or take a walk through Kumasi's famous market! All recorded, edited and narrated by yours truly.

£100 - A personal skype chat - ask me all about the project, and tell me your own story and why you are passionate about elephants. I'll post about it on the blog (with your permission) so that everyone can read about the people who are making this project possible.

£250 - For your fantastic support, in addition to all the other perks, you'll get a special gift from Ghana - some beautiful kente cloth, the famous Ghanaian chocolate, handmade jewelry, or a decoration for your living room!


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still be a huge help in supporting this project!

  • Help me spread the word - Facebook, Twitter, email, owl post, or whatever medium you prefer!
  • Follow along on my blog, whether you've contributed or not. See what I'm up to, get updates on how the research is going, and ask me questions!
  • Queries, comments, advice? Send me an email! You can contact me at laura.bramley@ouce.ox.ac.uk


All forest elephant images © Elephant Listening Project
