story:
So why aren't composting toilets more popular? 

Bad design.  Social conditioning.  Public health concerns. Regulatory barriers.  Lack of common knowledge around basic biological processes.  We hope to address all of these with our project...

The Project: Research. Demonstration. Advocacy.

The Occidental Arts & Ecology Center is proud to partner with Sonoma County regulators in securing a groundbreaking research permit to install and trial several different composting toilet systems in our retreat center’s new guest housing accommodations.  The outcome of this collaborative study is to provide technical and policy recommendations on composting toilets for multi-unit and medium-scale commercial facilities such as hotels and apartment buildings.  Through scientific testing of finished compost for pathogens, we hope to give regulators the hard data they need to facilitate widespread adoption of this technology throughout California and beyond. 

The installation will add to our existing on-site “Conservation Hydrology” (a concept coined by OAEC's Brock Dolman) demonstration projects, including roof water catchment and grey water irrigation systems.  The Decentralized Water Policy Council  and OAEC’s WATER Institute's have moved greywater policy forward, including helping to re-write Chapter 16a of the CA Unified Plumbing code.  OAEC's experience in this arena puts us in a key position to influence future solutions-based dialogue and inter-agency problem solving at the state level.

About the Occidental Arts & Ecology Center

Founded in 1994, the Occidental Arts & Ecology Center is an 80-acre research, demonstration, education and advocacy center in west Sonoma County California that develops strategies for regional-scale community resilience in the face of global ecological and cultural crisis.  With a 20-year track record of diverse, interrelated programs – organizing watershed groups, facilitating community scale ecological design processes, and spearheading strategic campaigns for policy reform, to name a few - OAEC has become a cherished meeting place for social change makers throughout the San Francisco Bay Area.  OAEC is poised to leverage our experience, our site, and our network of allies to push forward this timely project.  Modeling Resiliency.  Training Change Makers.  Building Community Capacity. Changing the Rules.  Visit us at www.oaec.org

Nature Calls!

Your contribution helps fund:

-Testing - Testing is expensive.  Each comprehensive lab test will cost upwards of $1,000 per sample!  

-Toilets and composters - While home-scale, rustic composters can be made very cheaply, large-scale certified systems for 15-30 users cost around $10,000 each. 

–Installation.  We’ve received a generous donation from the manufacturer for free installation of one out of three of the units.  However, to complete the full transition from the current septic system, anticipated costs are well over $6,000. 

-Documentation and advocacy.  The most valuable outcome of this project lies well beyond the basic physical infrastructure in the realm of education and policy change.  Associated costs include the documentation of work with county regulators, data analysis leading to a scientific “white paper,” and creating educational materials and downloadable PDFs for public distribution.  


We also need your non-financial support and networking - Even if you don’t have $ to donate, please help us by sharing your enthusiasm for this idea with your friends and networks! 

Please note:  At this early stage, we do not yet have the staff capacity (precisely why we need your help!) to field calls and emails from the general public about composting toilets.  Please refer to the resources posted on our website for more information.

What will happen to the money if we don’t meet our goal?  We will downsize the scope of what can we can accomplish in terms of educational outreach. 

What if we go over?  We will double down on our policy advocacy to change the rules at the county and state level!  It took us 2 years of negotiating to secure this permit – we want to leverage these resources to make it faster and easier for others moving forward.  

 

Project Impact Details

Barrier: Public Health Concerns      Solution: Scientific Testing

Policy supporting ecological sanitation depends on the guaranteed protection of public health.  We will be working with two local laboratories, as well as engineers from UC Davis and Stanford University to rigorously monitor and analyze the finished compost from three separate systems for pathogens, parasites, nutrient content, and other contaminants.  We hope to show that properly composted material is safe and beneficial to return to the soil.  Finished compost that has been deemed safe will then be used to fertilize trees and native shrubs in our wild lands restoration roject.  That's why we've nicknamed this campaign The "Toilet-trees" Project! 

Pictured right: Well and septic specialist at Sonoma County Permit and Resource Management Department handing over the Alternative Methods and Materials Permit to OAEC Staff Soil Scientist Miriam Volat. 

Barrier:  Permitting codes      Solution: Partnership with regulators to change the rules.

A key aspect of this collaborative project is to work side-by-side with our local regulators at the Sonoma County Planning and Resource Management Department, the Sonoma County Public Health Environmental Health Division, and the North Coast Regional Water Quality Control Board. Since the majority of our growing population lives in dense, urban settings, this is where solutions will have the greatest impact and where research is most needed. In the face of mandatory 25% urban water use reduction goals, regulators are eager for hard data.  We will document our successes and failures at every step of the process: navigating the red-tape of government agencies, the dirty details of toilet maintenance, and incorporation of user feedback.  We will present our partner agencies with a technical report of findings and will create resources (downloadable PDFs) designed for regulators so that they can make informed permitting decisions that prioritize public safety, financial efficacy, and environmental integrity.  

Barrier: Cultural Conditioning      Solution: Demonstration and Education 

One of the major barriers to mainstream acceptance of composting toilets is the misconception that they are stinky or downright uncivilized.  Update: composting toilets aren't just for backwoods outhouses any more!  Modern composting toilets are equipped with a urine diversion mechanism, proper ventilation, a balanced ratio of neutralizing carbon material such as sawdust (see graphic), and most importantly, education and proper instructions for users - all of which help to keep the composting process moving along and odors down.  Our well-designed, upscale ecological restrooms will provide visitors with a pleasant, “normal” bathroom experience – we aim to please both Government and Grandma!

Don't flush your resources down the toilet! 

Billions of public dollars have been put into creating our current water-hogging infrastructure - what a shame that so little investment has been made toward perfecting waterless sanitation design in modern times!  Please make a contribution to our campaign and help us use science to make ecological sanitation an accessible, viable solution to the drought/soil/energy crisis.
story_txt:
So why aren't composting toilets more popular? Bad design.  Social conditioning.  Public health concerns. Regulatory barriers.  Lack of common knowledge around basic biological processes.  We hope to address all of these with our project...The Project: Research. Demonstration. Advocacy.The Occidental Arts & Ecology Center is proud to partner with Sonoma County regulators in securing a groundbreaking research permit to install and trial several different composting toilet systems in our retreat center’s new guest housing accommodations.  The outcome of this collaborative study is to provide technical and policy recommendations on composting toilets for multi-unit and medium-scale commercial facilities such as hotels and apartment buildings.  Through scientific testing of finished compost for pathogens, we hope to give regulators the hard data they need to facilitate widespread adoption of this technology throughout California and beyond. The installation will add to our existing on-site “Conservation Hydrology” (a concept coined by OAEC's Brock Dolman) demonstration projects, including roof water catchment and grey water irrigation systems.  The Decentralized Water Policy Council  and OAEC’s WATER Institute's have moved greywater policy forward, including helping to re-write Chapter 16a of the CA Unified Plumbing code.  OAEC's experience in this arena puts us in a key position to influence future solutions-based dialogue and inter-agency problem solving at the state level.About the Occidental Arts & Ecology CenterFounded in 1994, the Occidental Arts & Ecology Center is an 80-acre research, demonstration, education and advocacy center in west Sonoma County California that develops strategies for regional-scale community resilience in the face of global ecological and cultural crisis.  With a 20-year track record of diverse, interrelated programs – organizing watershed groups, facilitating community scale ecological design processes, and spearheading strategic campaigns for policy reform, to name a few - OAEC has become a cherished meeting place for social change makers throughout the San Francisco Bay Area.  OAEC is poised to leverage our experience, our site, and our network of allies to push forward this timely project.  Modeling Resiliency.  Training Change Makers.  Building Community Capacity. Changing the Rules.  Visit us at www.oaec.orgNature Calls!Your contribution helps fund:
-Testing - Testing is expensive.  Each comprehensive lab test will cost upwards of $1,000 per sample!  
-Toilets and composters - While home-scale, rustic composters can be made very cheaply, large-scale certified systems for 15-30 users cost around $10,000 each. 
–Installation.  We’ve received a generous donation from the manufacturer for free installation of one out of three of the units.  However, to complete the full transition from the current septic system, anticipated costs are well over $6,000. -Documentation and advocacy.  The most valuable outcome of this project lies well beyond the basic physical infrastructure in the realm of education and policy change.  Associated costs include the documentation of work with county regulators, data analysis leading to a scientific “white paper,” and creating educational materials and downloadable PDFs for public distribution.  We also need your non-financial support and networking - Even if you don’t have $ to donate, please help us by sharing your enthusiasm for this idea with your friends and networks! 
Please note:  At this early stage, we do not yet have the staff capacity (precisely why we need your help!) to field calls and emails from the general public about composting toilets.  Please refer to the resources posted on our website for more information.
What will happen to the money if we don’t meet our goal?  We will downsize the scope of what can we can accomplish in terms of educational outreach. 
What if we go over?  We will double down on our policy advocacy to change the rules at the county and state level!  It took us 2 years of negotiating to secure this permit – we want to leverage these resources to make it faster and easier for others moving forward.  

 
Project Impact Details
Barrier: Public Health Concerns      Solution: Scientific Testing

Policy supporting ecological sanitation depends on the guaranteed protection of public health.  We will be working with two local laboratories, as well as engineers from UC Davis and Stanford University to rigorously monitor and analyze the finished compost from three separate systems for pathogens, parasites, nutrient content, and other contaminants.  We hope to show that properly composted material is safe and beneficial to return to the soil.  Finished compost that has been deemed safe will then be used to fertilize trees and native shrubs in our wild lands restoration roject.  That's why we've nicknamed this campaign The "Toilet-trees" Project! 

Pictured right: Well and septic specialist at Sonoma County Permit and Resource Management Department handing over the Alternative Methods and Materials Permit to OAEC Staff Soil Scientist Miriam Volat. 
Barrier:  Permitting codes      Solution: Partnership with regulators to change the rules.
A key aspect of this collaborative project is to work side-by-side with our local regulators at the Sonoma County Planning and Resource Management Department, the Sonoma County Public Health Environmental Health Division, and the North Coast Regional Water Quality Control Board. Since the majority of our growing population lives in dense, urban settings, this is where solutions will have the greatest impact and where research is most needed. In the face of mandatory 25% urban water use reduction goals, regulators are eager for hard data.  We will document our successes and failures at every step of the process: navigating the red-tape of government agencies, the dirty details of toilet maintenance, and incorporation of user feedback.  We will present our partner agencies with a technical report of findings and will create resources (downloadable PDFs) designed for regulators so that they can make informed permitting decisions that prioritize public safety, financial efficacy, and environmental integrity.  


Barrier: Cultural Conditioning      Solution: Demonstration and Education 
One of the major barriers to mainstream acceptance of composting toilets is the misconception that they are stinky or downright uncivilized.  Update: composting toilets aren't just for backwoods outhouses any more!  Modern composting toilets are equipped with a urine diversion mechanism, proper ventilation, a balanced ratio of neutralizing carbon material such as sawdust (see graphic), and most importantly, education and proper instructions for users - all of which help to keep the composting process moving along and odors down.  Our well-designed, upscale ecological restrooms will provide visitors with a pleasant, “normal” bathroom experience – we aim to please both Government and Grandma!
Don't flush your resources down the toilet! 
Billions of public dollars have been put into creating our current water-hogging infrastructure - what a shame that so little investment has been made toward perfecting waterless sanitation design in modern times!  Please make a contribution to our campaign and help us use science to make ecological sanitation an accessible, viable solution to the drought/soil/energy crisis.

story:
Why this project now? / Perché questo progetto ora?

We consume more water, air, flora and wildlife than the ecosystem is able to regenerate.

The consequences are disastrous and there for all to see: climate changes, deforestation, hydrogeological instability, biodiversity loss.

We want to plant trees to fight deforestation. We want help the environment and improve air quality by keeping the climate under control, reducing the risk of hydrogeological instability.

We want to share a global consciousness message to the world. It's time to change. It's time to become aware. It's time to BREATH.

Consumiamo molta più acqua, aria, flora e fauna selvatica di quanto l'ecosistema sia in grado di rigenerare.

Le conseguenze sono disastrose e sotto gli occhi di tutti: cambiamenti climatici, deforestazione, dissesto idrogeologico, perdita di biodiversità. 

Vogliamo piantare degli alberi contro la deforestazione. Vogliamo modificare l'ambiente e migliorare la qualità dell'aria, regolando il clima e riducendo il rischio di dissesto idrogeologico.

Vogliamo condividere un messaggio globale: è il momento di cambiare, è il momento di diventare consapevoli, è il momento di RESPIRARE.

 

What's BREATH about? / Su cosa è BREATH?

Mount Olivella is a 1,025 mt. high mountain rising above the Gulf of Sapri, in Southern Italy.

It was partly deforested by the middle of 1700s, with serious consequences as the hydrogeological instability which still causes floods in the surrounding areas.

BREATH will revive Mount Olivella, bringing balance and protecting the environment. Each new tree will be a new breath for the mountain.

Il Monte Olivella si innalza per 1.025 metri sul Golfo di Sapri, nel Sud Italia.

Fu parzialmente disboscato nella seconda metà del '700 con conseguenze disastrose, come il dissesto idrogeologico che ancora oggi causa alluvioni nelle zone circostanti.

BREATH farà rinascere il Monte Olivella, riportando equilibrio e proteggendo l'ambiente. Ogni nuovo albero sarà un nuovo respiro per la montagna.

 

BREATH will start with a huge organic drawing made of 5,000 new trees planted on Mount Olivella.

It is the result of a two-year long feasibility study, and it will cover a surface of 120,000 square meters, being visible from tens of kilometers away, from the sea and the surrounding towns.

Created by the Spanish artist Escif, BREATH is a battery which depicts the energy cycle.

It follows the rhythms of time and Earth, always renewing and regenerating itself and never staying the same. 

BREATH is absorbed by seasonal cycles and expresses them through the changing colors and the presence or absence of leaves.

BREATH inizierà con un grande disegno organico composto da 5.000 nuovi alberi piantati sul Monte Olivella.

Breath è il risultato di studi di fattibilità durati due anni e coprirà una superficie di 120.000 metri quadri, visibile da decine di chilometri di distanza dal mare e dai paesi limitrofi.

Ideato dall'artista spagnolo Escif, BREATH è una batteria che raffigura il ciclo energetico.

Segue i ritmi del tempo e della Terra, si rinnova, rinasce e non è mai la stessa.

BREATH è assorbita dai cicli stagionali e li esprime nel mutare dei colori e nella presenza o assenza delle foglie.

 

Timeline / Calendario

. February-March 2017. Crowdfunding campaign

. 19th May 2017. Damien Rice live in Naples

. September 2017. Forestation chapter 1: low battery (5,000 trees)

. September 2019. Forestation chapter 2: high battery (2,000 trees)

. September 2020. Free nature on its own

 

. Febbraio-Marzo 2017. Campagna crowdfunding

. 19 Maggio 2017. Damien Rice in concerto a Napoli

. Settembre 2017. Fase 1 della riforestazione: batteria scarica

. Settembre 2019. Fase 2 della riforestazione: batteria carica

. Settembre 2020. La natura fa il suo corso

 

Why not directly reforest the whole mountain? / perché non riforestare direttamente la montagna?

Well, this should be the first goal.

Unfortunately, in these crazy times, it would be so complicated to get funding directly for it, so let's try with some tricks. Art is only an excuse to make it happen. If everything goes as we wish, after some years, Mount Olivella will have thousands of new trees and no human traces on it.

Chapter 01. We plant 5,000 trees


Chapter 02. We plant, at least, 2,000 more trees


Chapter 03. We let nature free to do what she knows better to do: grow freely and erase any human trace

Questo dovrebbe essere il primo obiettivo.

Sfortunatamente, in questi tempi folli, sarebbe complicato ottenere fondi direttamente per la riforestazione, quindi meglio provare con qualche trucco. L'arte è solo una scusa per realizzarla. Se tutto va come speriamo, dopo qualche anno, il Monte Olivella avrà migliaia di nuovi alberi e nessuna traccia umana.

Fase 01. Piantiamo 5.000 alberi

Fase 02. Piantiamo almeno altri 2.000 alberi

Fase 03. Lasciamo la natura libera di fare quello che sa fare meglio: crescere liberamente e cancellare qualsiasi traccia umana.

 

Project funding / Finanziamento del progetto

 

To achieve the 1st goal (chapter 01) of Breath project, we need a budget of around 60,000 €.

We already have at our disposal 30,000 € (half of the budget) that comes from territorial resources and the benefits from Damien Rice concert in Naples.

30,000 € more will come from this crowdfunding campaign. If we exceed this sum, we will try to achieve the second goal (chapter 02).

 

Per raggiungere il primo obiettivo (fase 01) di Breath, abbiamo bisogno di un budget di 60.000 €.

Abbiamo già a disposizione 30.000 € provenienti da risorse locali e dal ricavato del concerto di Damien Rice a Napoli.

Altri 30.000 € arriveranno dalla campagna di crowdfunding. Se andremo oltre questa somma, proveremo a raggiungere il secondo obiettivo (fase 02).

 

 

About us / Chi siamo

BREATH is a unique project in scope and typology, conceived and curated by Antonio Oriente and Incipit. On the process of this project, Escif had been invited to join it and think how could be able to reforest Mount Olivella.

BREATH è un progetto unico per genere e dimensioni, ideato e curato da Antonio Oriente e da Incipit. Durante il processo, Escif è stato invitato a unirsi al progetto e a concepire la modalità con cui riforestare il Monte Olivella.


Incipit was created in Sapri (Salerno, Italy) with the aim to establish new nationwide networks and to host artists from all over the world. Incipit responds to our need to take action in the world through beauty and work, passion and culture.

Escif is an artist from Valencia, Spain, where he started painting graffiti in 1996. Through murals, public interventions, video, installations and drawings, Escif experiments life as an open process of knowledge and knowledge as an open process to experiment life.

Escif uses art as an excuse to approach different concepts: environmental issues, economical strategies, social movements, capitalism, politics, macropolitics and micropolitics, street life, food-related issues.

Incipit nasce a Sapri (SA) nel 2012, con l'obiettivo di creare reti di collaborazione a livello nazionale ed ospitare artisti da tutto il mondo. Incipit è la nostra necessità di agire nel mondo con bellezza e lavoro, passione e cultura.

Escif è un artista di Valencia (SP), città dove ha iniziato a realizzare graffiti nel 1996. Attraverso opere murali, interventi pubblici, video, installazioni e disegni, Escif sperimenta la vita come un processo aperto di conoscenza e la conoscenza come un processo aperto per sperimentare la vita.

Escif usa l'arte come mezzo per approcciarsi a concetti diversi: le questioni ambientali, le strategie economiche, i movimenti sociali, il capitalismo, la politica, la macro e micro politica, la vita di strada, i processi alimentari.

 

Damien Rice live in Naples / Damien Rice in concerto a Napoli

To support Breath project, Damien Rice will give a concert in Naples on 19th May. You can buy the tickets on www.ticketone.it

Per sostenere Breath project, Damien Rice si esibirà a Napoli il 19 maggio. I biglietti sono disponibili su www.ticketone.it

 

REWARDS / RICOMPENSE

Most of the rewards are described in detail on the perks list on the right side. Maybe you just want to see how some of them look like.

La maggior parte delle ricompense sono descritte in dettaglio nella lista dei "perks" sul lato destro. Ma forse ti interessa vedere subito quali sono.

 

INSIDE BREATH

You are part of the project. Your name will be covered on the website and the documentary.

Sei parte del progetto. Il tuo nome sarà coperto sul web e il documentario. 

 

ADOPT A TREE / ADOTTA UN ALBERO

We will plant a tree in your name or in the name of the person you ask for. We will send you an adoption certificate with the exact GPS location of your tree.

Pianteremo un albero a tuo nome o a nome della persona che preferisci. Ti invieremo anche un certificato d’adozione con l’esatta localizzazione GPS del tuo albero.

 

BROCCOLI tote bag / borsa da shopping "BROCCOLI"

This tote bag is a perfect gift for this spring season. Really comfortable and fancy, you can fill it with your school books, make up and cigarettes or even some vegetables.

Questa borsa da shopping è il regalo ideale per la primavera. Così comoda e divertente, puoi metterci dentro i libri di scuola, i trucchi o anche le verdure.

 

SAVE THE MOUNTAIN print / stampa "SAVE THE MOUNTAIN"

Offset lithograph print specifically done by Escif for this project on a 150-copy limited edition. Signed and numbered by the artist. Rock your wall with this stunning doped artwork.

Stampa litografica offset realizzata da Escif appositamente per Breath in edizione limitata di 150 copie, firmata e numerata dall'artista. Quest'opera stupefacente renderà unica la tua parete!

 

ORIGINAL DRAWINGS / DISEGNI ORIGINALI

These original drawings are frames taken from the animation that Escif made for the campaign video. Each drawing is a watercolor on Tintoretto Neve 280 gr paper, 24,5 x 17 cm, signed and numbered by the artist. Check availability HERE and specify your choice with your donation (sold drawings will be labeled as SOLD).

Questi disegni originali sono i fotogrammi dell'animazione che Escif ha realizzato per il video della campagna di Breath. Ogni disegno è un acquerello su Carta Tintoretto Neve 280 gr., 24,5 x 17 cm, numerato e firmato dall'artista. Puoi controllarne la disponibilità QUI e indicare la tua scelta con una donazione (i disegni già venduti saranno etichettati come SOLD).

 

TIME TO CHANGE NEW ORIGINAL DRAWINGS (from March 14th) / "TIME TO CHANGE" NUOVI DISEGNI ORIGINALI (dal 14 marzo)

A new series of original drawings specifically done by Escif for Breath project. Six watercolors on 240 gr. paper, 32,5x46 cm, signed by the artist.

La nuova serie di disegni originali realizzati appositamente da Escif per Breath. Sei acquerelli su carta 240 gr., 32,5x46 cm, firmati dall'artista.

 

TREEVOLUTION

 

NOT INTERNET HERE

 

WOODCUTTER

 

SNAPCHAT

 

CAMOUFLAGE

 

RECHARGE

CESTA CON FRUTA print / stampa "CESTA CON FRUTTA"

Offset lithograph print by Escif on Tintoretto Neve paper 260 gr., 50x70 cm,
signed and numbered by the artist on a 10-copy limited edition

Stampa litografica offset realizzata da Escif su Carta Tintoretto Neve 260 gr., 50x70 cm, numerata e firmata dall'artista. Edizione limitata di 10 copie.

 

BREATHLESS REWARD

Damien Rice concert in Naples on May 19th ticket + tree adoption + concert poster digital print special edition designed by Escif. Only 10 copies!

Biglietto del concerto del 19 maggio di Damien Rice a Napoli + certificato d'adozione dell'albero + edizione speciale del poster del concerto disegnato da Escif. Solo 10 copie!

PABLO S. HERRERO "CROW" PRINT / STAMPA "CROW" DI PABLO S. HERRERO

Silk screen print limited edition of 40 copies on paper FAVINI 240 gr., water ink, size 70x50 cm. All copies signed and numbered by the artist.

Serigrafia in edizione limitata di 40 copie in edizione limitata di 40 copie su carta FAVINI da 240 gr., inchiostro ad acqua, formato 70x50 cm. Tutte le copie firmate e numerate dall'artista.


INSIDE BREATH / DENTRO BREATH

Your name will appear on the website and in the documentary as part of BREATH project, along with all the people that made it possible.

Let's build a big community!    : ) ) )

Il tuo nome apparirà sul sito e nel documentario come parte di BREATH project, insieme alle persone che lo hanno reso possibile.

Costruiamo insieme una grande comunità : ) ) )

 

INDOOR FENG SHUI GARDEN / GIARDINO FENG SHUI AL COPERTO

Escif will make a deep Feng Shui study of the place you desire and will propose you a zen customised proposal. The proposal will include at least 10 nice artworks, 10 plants and 10 gifts that will revitalize the space with a lot of good vibes. 

Escif farà uno studio approfondito di Feng Shui per il luogo che desideri e realizzerà una proposta zen su misura per te. Nella proposta saranno presenti almeno 10 fantastiche opere, 10 piante e 10 regali che rivitalizzeranno lo spazio con tante buon vibrazioni.

OLIVELLA SKETCH STONE

Sketch of Breath Battery drawn on a stone coming directly from Mount Olivella. We are not really keen on taking stones from the mountain without her permission. But we firmly believe that the mountain would be happy if someone offered her 5,000 trees for this little stone.

Il disegno della batteria di Breath su una pietra del Monte Olivella. Non siamo entusiasti all'idea di portare via pietre dalla montagna senza il suo permesso, ma crediamo fermamente che lei sarebbe felice se qualcuno le offrisse 5.000 alberi nuovi in cambio di questa piccola pietra.

 

WIRED-MESH SCULPTURE BY EDOARDO TRESOLDI / SOLD OUT

Edoardo Tresoldi joins BREATH project.
Edoardo Tresoldi, included among the 30 most influential European artists by Forbes magazine and well-known worldwide for works like the reconstruction of the Basilica of Siponto, joins the project with 5 special edition birds metal sculptures. 
All the sculptures are hand modelled by the artist in galvanized wire mesh with approximate dimensions 120x70x55 cm.

Edoardo Tresoldi, inserito tra i 30 artisti europei più influenti dalla rivista Forbes, e conosciuto in tutto il mondo per interventi come la ricostruzione della Basilica di Siponto, supporta il progetto realizzando 5 sculture in rete metallica, i cui proventi finanzieranno direttamente Breath.

Le sculture sono tutte modellate a mano dall'artista in rete metallica zincata, con dimensioni approssimative di 120x70x55 cm.

 

How YOU can help

Every time you share this campaign with a friend, you help to seed this movement. Thank you SO much for sharing it with your community:

Share it on Facebook 

              Email it to five friends

                                          Tweet about it

                                                            Pray for us next time you go to the toilet

Water your plants once a week... and talk to them. They would do the same for you!

SO MANY THANKS FOR YOUR HELP!

www.breathproject.it

Escif usa l'arte come mezzo per approcciarsi a concetti diversi: le questioni ambientali, le strategie economiche, i movimenti sociali, il capitalismo, la politica, la macro e micro politica, la vita di strada, i processi alimentari.
 
Damien Rice live in Naples / Damien Rice in concerto a Napoli
To support Breath project, Damien Rice will give a concert in Naples on 19th May. You can buy the tickets on www.ticketone.it
Per sostenere Breath project, Damien Rice si esibirà a Napoli il 19 maggio. I biglietti sono disponibili su www.ticketone.it

 
REWARDS / RICOMPENSE
Most of the rewards are described in detail on the perks list on the right side. Maybe you just want to see how some of them look like.
La maggior parte delle ricompense sono descritte in dettaglio nella lista dei "perks" sul lato destro. Ma forse ti interessa vedere subito quali sono.
 
INSIDE BREATH
You are part of the project. Your name will be covered on the website and the documentary.
Sei parte del progetto. Il tuo nome sarà coperto sul web e il documentario.  
 
ADOPT A TREE / ADOTTA UN ALBERO
We will plant a tree in your name or in the name of the person you ask for. We will send you an adoption certificate with the exact GPS location of your tree.
Pianteremo un albero a tuo nome o a nome della persona che preferisci. Ti invieremo anche un certificato d’adozione con l’esatta localizzazione GPS del tuo albero.

 
BROCCOLI tote bag / borsa da shopping "BROCCOLI"
This tote bag is a perfect gift for this spring season. Really comfortable and fancy, you can fill it with your school books, make up and cigarettes or even some vegetables.
Questa borsa da shopping è il regalo ideale per la primavera. Così comoda e divertente, puoi metterci dentro i libri di scuola, i trucchi o anche le verdure.
 

SAVE THE MOUNTAIN print / stampa "SAVE THE MOUNTAIN"
Offset lithograph print specifically done by Escif for this project on a 150-copy limited edition. Signed and numbered by the artist. Rock your wall with this stunning doped artwork.
Stampa litografica offset realizzata da Escif appositamente per Breath in edizione limitata di 150 copie, firmata e numerata dall'artista. Quest'opera stupefacente renderà unica la tua parete!

 

ORIGINAL DRAWINGS / DISEGNI ORIGINALI

These original drawings are frames taken from the animation that Escif made for the campaign video. Each drawing is a watercolor on Tintoretto Neve 280 gr paper, 24,5 x 17 cm, signed and numbered by the artist. Check availability HERE and specify your choice with your donation (sold drawings will be labeled as SOLD).
Questi disegni originali sono i fotogrammi dell'animazione che Escif ha realizzato per il video della campagna di Breath. Ogni disegno è un acquerello su Carta Tintoretto Neve 280 gr., 24,5 x 17 cm, numerato e firmato dall'artista. Puoi controllarne la disponibilità QUI e indicare la tua scelta con una donazione (i disegni già venduti saranno etichettati come SOLD).



 
TIME TO CHANGE NEW ORIGINAL DRAWINGS (from March 14th) / "TIME TO CHANGE" NUOVI DISEGNI ORIGINALI (dal 14 marzo)
A new series of original drawings specifically done by Escif for Breath project. Six watercolors on 240 gr. paper, 32,5x46 cm, signed by the artist.
La nuova serie di disegni originali realizzati appositamente da Escif per Breath. Sei acquerelli su carta 240 gr., 32,5x46 cm, firmati dall'artista.
 
TREEVOLUTION

 
NOT INTERNET HERE

 
WOODCUTTER

 
SNAPCHAT

 
CAMOUFLAGE

 
RECHARGE

CESTA CON FRUTA print / stampa "CESTA CON FRUTTA"
Offset lithograph print by Escif on Tintoretto Neve paper 260 gr., 50x70 cm,signed and numbered by the artist on a 10-copy limited edition
Stampa litografica offset realizzata da Escif su Carta Tintoretto Neve 260 gr., 50x70 cm, numerata e firmata dall'artista. Edizione limitata di 10 copie.


 
BREATHLESS REWARD
Damien Rice concert in Naples on May 19th ticket + tree adoption + concert poster digital print special edition designed by Escif. Only 10 copies!
Biglietto del concerto del 19 maggio di Damien Rice a Napoli + certificato d'adozione dell'albero + edizione speciale del poster del concerto disegnato da Escif. Solo 10 copie!

PABLO S. HERRERO "CROW" PRINT / STAMPA "CROW" DI PABLO S. HERRERO
Silk screen print limited edition of 40 copies on paper FAVINI 240 gr., water ink, size 70x50 cm. All copies signed and numbered by the artist.
Serigrafia in edizione limitata di 40 copie in edizione limitata di 40 copie su carta FAVINI da 240 gr., inchiostro ad acqua, formato 70x50 cm. Tutte le copie firmate e numerate dall'artista.


INSIDE BREATH / DENTRO BREATH
Your name will appear on the website and in the documentary as part of BREATH project, along with all the people that made it possible.
Let's build a big community!    : ) ) )
Il tuo nome apparirà sul sito e nel documentario come parte di BREATH project, insieme alle persone che lo hanno reso possibile. 
Costruiamo insieme una grande comunità : ) ) )
 
INDOOR FENG SHUI GARDEN / GIARDINO FENG SHUI AL COPERTO
Escif will make a deep Feng Shui study of the place you desire and will propose you a zen customised proposal. The proposal will include at least 10 nice artworks, 10 plants and 10 gifts that will revitalize the space with a lot of good vibes. 
Escif farà uno studio approfondito di Feng Shui per il luogo che desideri e realizzerà una proposta zen su misura per te. Nella proposta saranno presenti almeno 10 fantastiche opere, 10 piante e 10 regali che rivitalizzeranno lo spazio con tante buon vibrazioni.

OLIVELLA SKETCH STONE
Sketch of Breath Battery drawn on a stone coming directly from Mount Olivella. We are not really keen on taking stones from the mountain without her permission. But we firmly believe that the mountain would be happy if someone offered her 5,000 trees for this little stone.
Il disegno della batteria di Breath su una pietra del Monte Olivella. Non siamo entusiasti all'idea di portare via pietre dalla montagna senza il suo permesso, ma crediamo fermamente che lei sarebbe felice se qualcuno le offrisse 5.000 alberi nuovi in cambio di questa piccola pietra.

 

WIRED-MESH SCULPTURE BY EDOARDO TRESOLDI / SOLD OUT
Edoardo Tresoldi joins BREATH project.Edoardo Tresoldi, included among the 30 most influential European artists by Forbes magazine and well-known worldwide for works like the reconstruction of the Basilica of Siponto, joins the project with 5 special edition birds metal sculptures. All the sculptures are hand modelled by the artist in galvanized wire mesh with approximate dimensions 120x70x55 cm.
Edoardo Tresoldi, inserito tra i 30 artisti europei più influenti dalla rivista Forbes, e conosciuto in tutto il mondo per interventi come la ricostruzione della Basilica di Siponto, supporta il progetto realizzando 5 sculture in rete metallica, i cui proventi finanzieranno direttamente Breath. 
Le sculture sono tutte modellate a mano dall'artista in rete metallica zincata, con dimensioni approssimative di 120x70x55 cm.

 
How YOU can help
Every time you share this campaign with a friend, you help to seed this movement. Thank you SO much for sharing it with your community:
Share it on Facebook 
              Email it to five friends
                                          Tweet about it
                                                            Pray for us next time you go to the toilet
Water your plants once a week... and talk to them. They would do the same for you!

SO MANY THANKS FOR YOUR HELP!
www.breathproject.it

story:
We're Green Initiative Foundation and for the last 5 years we've been working in West Java to protect vulnerable forests through our community based reforestation projects.  From 2009 - 2013 we helped to reforest over 38ha of the Gede-Pangrango National Park alongside the community of Sarongge and now we're creating a 28ha agroforestry buffer zone around the Gunung Gelis protected forest with the help of over 125 local farmers. 

One of our participating farmers, Kang Dudu, planting trees on his farm which boarders the protected Gunung Gelis forest.

 But to do this we need your help!  We desperately need to ensure a sustainable, high quality supply of trees which allow us to build on this successful pilot project and expand to more areas. 

So we're asking people like you, who care about the forest and the animals that call it home, to come together and help us to build a tree nursery!   This will create a sustainable supply over 10,000 trees per year for our agroforestry tree adoption project, helping to prevent against erosion and flooding, as well as reducing pressure on the pockets of vulnerable forest that remain.

What will happen to your donation?

We need $7,000 to build one unit of the tree nursery, which will get us started on our road to sustainability.  We'll use the funds as follows:

16% for the structure itself, including labour
24% for seeds and saplings and fertiliser
46% for community running costs, including the support of a tree expert
14% for project management, perks (including postage).

The nursery will be run by GIF, providing jobs and opportunities to the local community.  Pak Sopian, our local tree expert will oversee the design and construction of the nursery, in addition to providing training to the nursery managers.  If we're unable to reach our target we will prioritise the funds for the structure, seeds and staffing. 

View from the location of our tree nursery

To become a part of our community tree nursery you can help us by purchasing seedlings, sponsoring the running costs of a square meter of the nursery, sponsoring a nursery bed, or even the entire construction of the nursery unit, which we will name in your honour!  We'll keep you up to date with our progress via email and our Facebook page, providing photos of the finished nursery and our Wall of Fame of sponsors!

As a way of saying thank you for your kind support we've teamed up with a wonderful artist from Spain, who has spent the last two years painting the wildlife of Indonesia to inspire the protection of their forest and marine homes.  Indi has created 7 stunning portraits of some of Indonesia's most famous animal citizens for you.  They come in digital postcard, poster and even limited edition print format, depending on the level of support. 

The seven images available as a set of digital postcards, individual posters or individual limited edition prints
(Top L-R: Cockerel, Komodo Dragon, Duygong.  Bottom L-R: Rhino, Orangutan, Tiger, Elephant) 
Check out the perks to the right for more details. Posters and prints are of limited availability and will be allocated on a first come first served basis.  After making your donation please make a comment, providing your top 5 images in order of preference, to help with this process.  
Sizes
Print (left): 28cm x 36cm (including black border, perk does not include frame)
Poster (right): 65cm x 43cm

(These photos are not accurate representations of print or poster colour).

The Impact

This nursery will become the foundation of our community agroforestry project.  Over the last 6 months we've been working with farmers on a pilot project: adopting productive fruit trees on the land of poor farmers living near vulnerable forest, to create more biodiversity, increase farmer's income and relieve the pressure on the forest.  We believe we've found a solution that will enable both poor farmers and the remaining forest in West Java to thrive. 

Tree planting ceremony with Unilever, who adopted 1000 trees in April 2015

With the addition of the tree nursery we will be able to guarantee a high quality and sustainable supply of trees for this project and expansion to areas beyond Tunggilis.  This means more farmers can be supported and more forest relieved from the threat of encroachment.  Our aim for 2015-2016 is to plant 12,000 trees and work with 300 farmers.

Not only will this agroforestry project reduce erosion and flooding in Jakarta, but it will also will help to support the eco-systems that sustain some of the last remaining populations of endangered species like the Javan Leopard and Javan Hawk Eagle, plus countless others.

Green Initiative Foundation

We've been working with farmers in West Java for the last five years.  We're very proud to have received recognition from both the former-President of Indonesia and the current Minister of Forestry for our projects, which have been used as examples of successful community environmental protection projects in Indonesia.

Tree adopted by the current Minister of Forestry, Dr Siti Nurbaya in April 2015 (left) and former President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono adopting a tree in January 2013

We're also proud to be working with the Sarongge and Tunggilis communities, who have become great colleagues and friends.  Our local know-how means that we're better placed to help support the community, and our experience of community-based reforestry means we're well-known and trusted amongst adopters, all of which will help to ensure the success and longevity of the project.

Farmers that become part of our program will care for the trees and in return receive the income from the fruits the trees produce.  The tree adoption project will provide up to an 80% increase in farmer's income.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our story!  The more people that know about Tunggilis and our tree adoption program, the more people join with us to stand up for the forest and the farmers of West Java.  Please feel free to share this fundraising page or our Facebook page.

story:
Short Summary

  • About Me

 I have always had a deep compassion for animals, the environment, human rights, and traveling. I have discovered a way to combine all of these in a career. To quote the NRDC mission statement, I want to “safeguard the earth: its people, its plants and animals, and the natural systems on which all life depends”.

  • What My Is Campaign About

This summer I have the opportunity to volunteer with an organization overseas. I have whittled my choices down to 3 programs. I will be participating in a 2-3 week community service, hands-on learning program while experiencing an unforgettable adventure, living with a family, and expanding my mind and view on life. Over the course of the 2-3 week program I will be either aiding in the protection, conservation, and release of thousands of baby turtles into the sea; assisting in elephant conservation; working with orangutans, and much more.  In addition to these I may be supporting the local communities by assisting healthcare teams to promote health awareness, helping disabled orphans adapt to the real world, transforming and rebuilding decaying temples into incredible places of worship, or teaching a classroom full of Monks to speak clear English. I will also experience countless activities such as scuba diving, local culture and food, and unique markets.

  • The Change Your Contribution Will Help Achieve

You will be helping me grow as a person by expanding my world view through hands on work and experiences. You will also be helping me in my career path of service to the environment, people, and animals. And most importantly your donation is crucial to my success in healing the planet. Any donation is greatly appreciated no matter the amount.

What I Need & What You Get

I need USD $4000.00 to make this happen. This includes all in country expenses, including educational materials, lodging, three meals a day, all in country transportation, to country transportation, airport pickup, professional full time staff and experts from the US/Europe, travel medical insurance, 24/7 parent support hotline, cultural activities, lectures, weekend excursions, pre-departure materials and support.

  • The Perks you will receive with your contribution

With your extremely generous contribution of $100 or more, you will receive a personal thank you video upon my return. If you decide to donate $51-$99, you will receive a photo journal of the experiences I will have on this trip thanks to you, and a hand written thank you letter. If you decide to contribute less than $50, this is still greatly appreciated and you will receive a hand written thank you post card.

The Impact

·  Help me grow as a person

·  Help me on a career path that benefits others

·  Help heal the planet

·  Help me learn about service 

·  Allow me to experience a different culture and way of life

Other Ways You Can Help

·  Spread the word about my campaign-Even if you can’t contribute, you can still help. Tell your friends, family, co workers, use social network or any other way you see fit to get the word out there.

·  Please use the Indiegogo share tools to let others know about my campaign. It is easy to do and it makes a world of difference.

story:
'Let's Create a Legacy!'

                 OUR STORY


We all look for a secluded space to regroup, refresh and rejuvenate. Granite Belt Arboretum can offer this …plus a whole lot more.


We have created this funding campaign so that we can establish a living tree zoo in the high altitude, cool climate region of Queensland, Australia known as the Granite Belt.

We will import coast redwood (sequoia sempervirens) tissue culture from Archangel Tree Archive in USA, via New Zealand laboratory and into Australian Quarantine before being planted out into the Granite Belt Arboretum. We are aiming at 200 trees in the ground. More information can be found here: www.ancienttreearchive.org

This is a global preservation project to protect these endangered and magnificent trees in a living library. We believe these clones of ancient redwoods are genetically geared for resilience and as such, we want to participate in the preservation of these iconic forest dwellers. Their growth rate has been noted at up to 10 feet (3 metres) per year in the right microclimate, and we know our skills and experience and dedication will provide the best environment for them.

The clones of 4,000 year old Californian Coast Redwoods will form the foundation of the Granite Belt Arboretum. We want other people to experience the joy of an evergreen forest of ancient majestic trees.

The Californian Coast Redwoods are known as pest and fire retardant trees, with their thick bark and high levels of tannin repelling both. Their ability to store carbon is noted at three times more than any other forest type in the world. These giants cannot be left to die out!

A large section of the Granite Belt Arboretum will focus on an organically managed ‘Food Forest’ as a tribute to the agricultural roots of our region. It will become a reference resource for sustainable orchard management techniques and a hive of biodiversity and beauty.

We welcome scientists, researchers and school students to access the forest for learning opportunities.

We welcome people to revel in the sights, sounds and smell of nature.


Our Budget of $18,000 for plants only is as follows:



Our budget is for plants only. Brett and Sonia will cover all costs including land, branding, logo design and merchandise, landscape design, planting project costs including site preparation (keyline ripping), soil preparation, digging of holes, planting labour and long term watering costs as well as tree maintenance such as pruning, thinning etc as required. We will use Brett’s mature, microbe rich compost and our knowledge, skill, labour and passion to keep this project alive!

Incentives

We want to acknowledge the people who have shared in our vision with a host of once in a lifetime incentives as our way of thanking you for your support.

Incentives start from $25 for a leather notebook cover and notepad with the Granite Belt Arboretum Australia logo, and go right up to $10,000 for a unique arboretum, food, wine and provenance tour of the Granite Belt region with hosts Brett and Sonia!

Each Coast Redwood will have a plaque dedicating the tree to the fund supporter at the $250, $2,500 and $10,000 mark. Each of the 34 Oak Trees will also have a plaque dedicated to the supporter at the $150 Mark (Oak Tree Grove). The Koala Forest and Edible Food Forest will have a plaque on the wall naming each supporter in the $100 (Koala Forest) and the  $125 (Edible Collection) incentive range.

The plaques represent a tangible form of cataloguing the Coast Redwoods for future generations. It is a way for people to connect with the tree they have supported. All of our trees will be catalogued and include various details in our database as we hope to develop a map of the Granite Belt Arboretum Australia in due course.

Lunch for 6 people with the founders at $1,500, is a great way to get to know more about the Granite Belt Arboretum Australia, the story and effort behind it's formation and have a good laugh with some truly inspiring regional food and wine. We want to share the provenance of this region with you, so you will enjoy coming back to it for years to come.

Our Five Star Tour with Founders at $10,000 is a once in a lifetime opportunity to be treated with style! You will be collected by limousine from the Brisbane Airport and spend 4 glorious days sightseeing on the Granite Belt. You will have a personal tour of the Granite Belt Arboretum Australia by the Founders, Brett and Sonia and experience the culinary delights of this magnificent place.


Our People - Our Team - Our Region

Brett and Sonia are passionate about the natural environment. When we both stumbled across the magnificent landscape of the Granite Belt in Queensland Australia, a high altitude, cool climate environment with ancient rockscapes and a rich agricultural history, we knew we had found a special place to raise our four beautiful children with respect to our environment.

The Granite Belt has four distinct seasons, with warm wet Summers and in Winter the occasional snow fall. Large portions of the landscape have been cleared for agriculture so Winter in particular can present a cold harsh view. Leaves have fallen from the many deciduous trees and the vineyards and orchards look like barren skeletal forms. We believe this region can grow by ‘Greenscaping’ for not only the environmental benefits, but also the community benefits that come from living and thriving in an aesthetically pleasing environment.

Brett Tunstall & Sonia Ghiggioli, kids, animals and gardens!

Brett is a qualified and experienced Forester and has worked with the Department of Conservation in New Zealand in their majestic redwood forests. Within his role as Senior Forester of World of Trees, he has recently been engaged by Condamine Alliance and Headwaters Group and private landholders on the Granite Belt for species selection and establishment of large native biodiversity planting projects. He has the skills and passion to build this legacy on behalf of future generations. Along with growing trees, Brett has spent many years as a volunteer in the Rural Fire Service, and the past year as an Auxillary Fireman in the Stanthorpe branch of the urban brigade within the Queensland Fire and Emergency Services and this project shows his eagerness to share his knowledge about living firebreaks. Brett has had prior experience in Arboretums as he has worked in the National Arboretum in Canberra, ACT conducting pruning time studies for the Monkey Puzzle and the Chinese Dogwood groves. His business is called World of Trees and you can read more about it here: www.worldoftrees.com.au

Sonia has been an environmental advocate for as long as she remembers. Her mother still recalls how she was a defiant 4 year old trying to release the joey kangaroos from their fenced paddock at a wildlife sanctuary to free them. Fortunately Sonia has since studied, lived and worked in various roles in business and agriculture and the environment and can now use her knowledge and skills to take a practical, balanced approach to her life and work in sustainable viticulture and farm management. Sonia is a newcomer to the board of Ecological Agriculture Australia Association and has launched McLaren Vale’s Sustainable Australia Winegrowing program on the Granite Belt and founded the Granite Belt Winegrowers Association as part of her desire to build awareness of sustainable practices. Sonia and Brett grow freerange Wyandotte’s, American heritage chickens for food and eggs. They have an organic kitchen garden and share a passion for cooking with many people under the ‘Taste the Granite Belt’ name on Instagram and Facebook, all while raising 20, 11, 9 and 2 year olds! Sonia’s business is called Vine Time and you can read more about it here: www.vinetime.com.au

Kymba at Soulful Branding in the pristine rainforest region of Bangalow in NSW is contributing her talent to our campaign. She has a long family history of botany in Australia, with her ancestor, John Lewis on the Charles Sturt overland expeditions across Australia over 150 years ago. We wish to acknowledge Kym for playing her part in our vision. Her redwood tree logo features on all of our branding. More about Soulful Branding can be found here: www.soulfulbranding.com.au

Dr Daniel Stock at EnviroStock Consultants is our Environmental Scientist who provides accurate data and input into the arboretum. Danny has a love for the Granite Belt food and wine region and cannot wait to get this project off the ground! You can read more about EnviroStock Consultants here: www.envirostockconsultants.com.au

Our team is passionate about nature, people and life!

If we do not reach our goal of $18,000, the funds will be used in order of priority for the plantings with Coast Redwoods taking pride of place.

If we have the good fortune of the funds exceeding our target, we will use them to expand the Granite Belt Arboretum and choose other endangered tree species from throughout the world. Suggestions of your favourite trees are welcome.

If you are unable to contribute financially, we welcome your support in any way you feel you can. Sharing our campaign is fundamental to our success, so we would love for you to shout it out from the rooftops!

If you would like to get your hands dirty and volunteer for planting days, please subscribe to our newsletter at www.gbarboretum.com or send us an email at brett@gbarboretum.com to chat about how you can participate. Please don't forget to share!

There is a range of Indiegogo share tools so you can pick the ones you feel most comfortable with.
story_txt:
'Let's Create a Legacy!'                 OUR STORYWe all look
for a secluded space to regroup, refresh and rejuvenate. Granite Belt Arboretum
can offer this …plus a whole lot more.
We have
created this funding campaign so that we can establish a living tree zoo in the high altitude, cool climate region of Queensland, Australia known as the Granite Belt. 
We will import coast redwood (sequoia sempervirens) tissue culture from Archangel Tree Archive in USA, via New Zealand laboratory
and into Australian Quarantine before being planted out into the Granite Belt
Arboretum. We are aiming at 200 trees in the ground. More information can be
found here: www.ancienttreearchive.org 
This is a global preservation project to protect these endangered
and magnificent trees in a living library. We believe these clones of ancient
redwoods are genetically geared for resilience and as such, we want to
participate in the preservation of these iconic forest dwellers. Their growth
rate has been noted at up to 10 feet (3 metres) per year in the right
microclimate, and we know our skills and experience and dedication will provide
the best environment for them.
The clones
of 4,000 year old Californian Coast Redwoods will form the foundation of the
Granite Belt Arboretum. We want other people to experience the joy of an
evergreen forest of ancient majestic trees. 
The
Californian Coast Redwoods are known as pest and fire retardant trees, with
their thick bark and high levels of tannin repelling both. Their ability to store carbon is noted at three times more than any other forest type in the world. These giants cannot be left to die out!
A large
section of the Granite Belt Arboretum will focus on an organically managed ‘Food
Forest’ as a tribute to the agricultural roots of our region. It will become a
reference resource for sustainable orchard management techniques and a hive of
biodiversity and beauty.
We welcome
scientists, researchers and school students to access the forest for learning
opportunities.
We welcome people to revel in the sights, sounds
and smell of nature.

Our Budget
of $18,000 for plants only is as follows:



Our budget
is for plants only. Brett and Sonia will cover all costs including land, branding,
logo design and merchandise, landscape design, planting project costs including
site preparation (keyline ripping), soil preparation, digging of holes,
planting labour and long term watering costs as well as tree maintenance such
as pruning, thinning etc as required. We will use Brett’s mature, microbe rich
compost and our knowledge, skill, labour and passion to keep this project
alive!
Incentives
We want to
acknowledge the people who have shared in our vision with a host of once in a lifetime incentives as our way of thanking you for your support.
Incentives start from $25 for a leather notebook cover and notepad with the Granite Belt Arboretum Australia logo, and go right up to $10,000 for a unique arboretum, food, wine and provenance tour of the Granite Belt region with hosts Brett and Sonia!


Each
Coast Redwood will have a plaque dedicating the tree to the fund supporter at
the $250, $2,500 and $10,000 mark. Each of the 34 Oak Trees will also have a plaque dedicated to the supporter at the $150 Mark (Oak Tree Grove). The Koala Forest and Edible Food Forest will
have a plaque on the wall naming each supporter in the $100 (Koala Forest) and the  $125 (Edible Collection) incentive range. 
The plaques
represent a tangible form of cataloguing the Coast Redwoods for future
generations. It is a way for people to connect with the tree they have
supported. All of our trees will be catalogued and include various details in
our database as we hope to develop a map of the Granite Belt Arboretum Australia in due
course. 


Lunch for 6 people with the founders at $1,500, is a great way to get to know more about the Granite Belt Arboretum Australia, the story and effort behind it's formation and have a good laugh with some truly inspiring regional food and wine. We want to share the provenance of this region with you, so you will enjoy coming back to it for years to come.


Our Five Star Tour with Founders at $10,000 is a once in a lifetime opportunity to be treated with style! You will be collected by limousine from the Brisbane Airport and spend 4 glorious days sightseeing on the Granite Belt. You will have a personal tour of the Granite Belt Arboretum Australia by the Founders, Brett and Sonia and experience the culinary delights of this magnificent place.




Our People - Our Team - Our Region
Brett and
Sonia are passionate about the natural environment. When we both stumbled
across the magnificent landscape of the Granite Belt in Queensland Australia, a
high altitude, cool climate environment with ancient rockscapes and a rich
agricultural history, we knew we had found a special place to raise our four
beautiful children with respect to our environment.
The Granite
Belt has four distinct seasons, with warm wet Summers and in Winter the
occasional snow fall. Large portions of the landscape have been cleared for
agriculture so Winter in particular can present a cold harsh view. Leaves have
fallen from the many deciduous trees and the vineyards and orchards look like
barren skeletal forms. We believe this region can grow by ‘Greenscaping’
for not only the environmental benefits, but also the community benefits that come from living and thriving in an aesthetically pleasing environment.


Brett Tunstall & Sonia Ghiggioli, kids, animals and gardens!
Brett is a
qualified and experienced Forester and has worked with the Department of
Conservation in New Zealand in their majestic redwood forests. Within his role
as Senior Forester of World of Trees, he has recently been engaged by Condamine
Alliance and Headwaters Group and private landholders on the Granite Belt for
species selection and establishment of large native biodiversity planting
projects. He has the skills and passion to build this legacy on behalf of
future generations. Along with growing trees, Brett has spent many years as a
volunteer in the Rural Fire Service, and the past year as an Auxillary Fireman
in the Stanthorpe branch of the urban brigade within the Queensland Fire and
Emergency Services and this project shows his eagerness to share his knowledge
about living firebreaks. Brett has had prior experience in Arboretums as he has
worked in the National Arboretum in Canberra, ACT conducting pruning time
studies for the Monkey Puzzle and the Chinese Dogwood groves. His business is
called World of Trees and you can read more about it here:
www.worldoftrees.com.au
Sonia has
been an environmental advocate for as long as she remembers. Her mother still
recalls how she was a defiant 4 year old trying to release the joey kangaroos
from their fenced paddock at a wildlife sanctuary to free them. Fortunately
Sonia has since studied, lived and worked in various roles in business and
agriculture and the environment and can now use her knowledge and skills to
take a practical, balanced approach to her life and work in sustainable
viticulture and farm management. Sonia is a newcomer to the board of Ecological
Agriculture Australia Association and has launched McLaren Vale’s Sustainable Australia
Winegrowing program on the Granite Belt and founded the Granite Belt Winegrowers Association as
part of her desire to build awareness of sustainable practices. Sonia and Brett
grow freerange Wyandotte’s, American heritage chickens for food and eggs. They
have an organic kitchen garden and share a passion for cooking with many people
under the ‘Taste the Granite Belt’ name on Instagram and Facebook, all while
raising 20, 11, 9 and 2 year olds! Sonia’s business is called Vine Time and you
can read more about it here: www.vinetime.com.au
Kymba at
Soulful Branding in the pristine rainforest region of Bangalow in NSW is
contributing her talent to our campaign. She has a long family history of
botany in Australia, with her ancestor, John Lewis on the Charles Sturt overland expeditions across Australia over 150 years ago. We wish to acknowledge Kym for playing her
part in our vision. Her redwood tree logo features on all of our branding. More about Soulful Branding can be found here: www.soulfulbranding.com.au
Dr Daniel Stock at EnviroStock Consultants is our Environmental Scientist who provides accurate data and input into the arboretum. Danny has a love for the Granite Belt food and wine region and cannot wait to get this project off the ground! You can read more about EnviroStock Consultants here: www.envirostockconsultants.com.au
Our team is passionate about nature, people and life!

not reach our goal of $18,000, the funds will be used in order of priority for
the plantings with Coast Redwoods taking pride of place.
If we have the good fortune of the
funds exceeding our target, we will use them to expand the Granite Belt Arboretum
and choose other endangered tree species from throughout the world. Suggestions of your favourite trees are welcome.
If you are unable
to contribute financially, we welcome your support in any way you feel you can.
Sharing our campaign is fundamental to our success, so we would love for you to
shout it out from the rooftops!
If you would like to get your hands dirty and volunteer for planting days, please subscribe to our newsletter at www.gbarboretum.com or send us an email at brett@gbarboretum.com to chat about how you can participate. Please don't forget to share!
There is a
range of Indiegogo share tools so you can pick the ones you feel most
comfortable with.

story:
Our Story

My name is Emily Hunter, I am a young environmental activist that is fundraising to join her next campaign. DeforestAction: Project Borneo is a global action campaign driven by young people to help restore an endangered rainforest, save orangutans and help the local community in Indonesia. The project is led by acclaimed conservationist Dr. Willie Smits and Orangutan Outreach. If I achieve my fundraising goal, I will get the opportunity to participate in DeforestAction on the ground this summer!


  • Learn more about the approach in Willie's TED Talk
  • Learn more about DeforstACTION here
  • Learn more about Emily Hunter here 


The Impact

The forests of the world are disappearing fast. If we don't do something soon, they will all be destroyed, taking away the habitat of orangutans and other wildlife. In Indonesia alone, a forest the size of 300 football fields is being cut down every hour - to make way for palm oil plantations (product used for Dove soaps). DeforestACTION is about saving rainforests, regrowing destroyed forests, protecting the remaining orangutans, and holding those who are destroying our planet accountable.

 

What We Need & What You Get

If I can raise $5,000 & recruit 500 fans (here, see below), I'll be able to join DeforestACTION this summer! Any and all funds raised will go directly to securing and sustaining land for reforestation and protection. Willie Smits has secured land from the Sultan of Yogyakarta for DeforestACTION. This is in partnership with the local community for 99 years, the length of the land use agreement. You'll receive a certificate with the coordinates of the land you're preserving.


Other Ways You Can Help

  1. Become a fan on my page here: http://dfa.tigweb.org/hub/Huntress (see bottom, right > Join My DeforestAction Network) 
  2. Please spread the word by sharing this fundraising page to your social networks, see share buttons above!

story:
Short Summary

(photo: Proboscis Monkey, credit : Eric Somala)

This rainforest is the home of the proboscis monkeys, sun bears and hundreds of species of birds. We hope you can visit this amazing place.

To save the rainforest and these animals, the local community in Kalimantan must obtain income from the rainforest trees to financially survive.

Our project will enable the village community make a  good income from growing high value Organic Rainforest Fruit.

This will not only give them income but we will teach them about the value and importance of these rainforest trees and the wildlife that live there so they can protect  these animals and birds.

For every $10 you give we can grow 5 seedlings that will grow into Rainforest Fruit Trees.

A community village house will be given 5 rainforest fruit tree seedlings to plant.

A Rainforest Fruit Tree will generate over $500 per year when fully productive.

In 3 - 4 years these fruit trees will begin to produce substantial income for the local community.

We welcome you at any time to visit our project location in Sungai Wain Forest, Kalimantan to see the progress of your trees. It is a fascinating place with many rainforest animals like sun bears, proboscis monkeys and wild birds.  

Thank you to help us spread the story of how you can save a small bit of the Indonesian Rainforest.

WE NEED MONEY BUT MOST OF ALL WE NEED YOUR HELP TO TELL THE WORLD 

TELL YOUR  FRIENDS - SPREAD THE WORD IN YOUR NETWORK

 

(photo: Durian, Credit : Mustofa Ali)

What We Need & What You Get

We have already started the project with  funds from the Indonesian Rainforest Foundation.

We need a total of $2500 to develop the nursery and grow these seedlings for 1 year before we give them free for planting in the community. 

We have already raised $300 but need another $2200 to reach our goal to supply and plant 1000 rainforest fruit trees.

This means we can provide rainforest fruit tree seedlings to 200 village community homes supporting more than 1000 people.

If we do not reach the final goal the funds committed will reduce the number of seedlings we can grow. Let us hope this does not happen!!


(photo: Developing nursery in Sungai Wain Forest, credit : Rohim)

(photo: Developing nursery in Sungai Wain Forest, credit : Rohim)

(photo: Developing nursery in Sungai Wain Forest, credit: Rohim)


The Impact

  • The project will have a major social impact on the community to ensure the survival of the Sungai Wain Forest area in Kalimantan and the animals that live in this forest.
  • The Indonesian Rainforest Foundation have similar success in our other project areas in Central Java in Brebes and Borobudur.
  • This project will ensure the long term protection of the rainforest fruit trees planted in the Sungai Wain Forest area.
  • The income from every rainforest fruit tree will help reduce the need for the local community to cut down other trees for their daily income. 
  • The rainforest ecosystem will become stronger and more diverse from these rainforest fruit trees.

 

Risks & Challenges

  • To reduce the loss risk in the seedling growing stage we will employ 2 experienced persons full time to maintain these seedlings during the first year.
  • To reduce the loss risk of fruit trees we will train a leader in each village to advise the village community on how to maintain these seedlings as they grow into rainforest fruit trees.
  • We will bring in nursery experts to train the community leaders in organic cultivation techniques so they do not have to rely on fertilizers and chemical at extra cost.
  • The advantages will be the community can get a higher price with more income from the sale of the organic fruit.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you cannot donate that's ok as we appreciate your interest and reading about what we do.
  • LIKE our Indonesian Rainforest Foundation Facebook page and leave comments.  Facebook page:  https://www.facebook.com/saverainforests?ref_type=bookmark
  • Visit the Indonesian Rainforest Foundation web site and see all our projects. Our website : http://www.indonesianrainforest.org/
  • Maybe plan a holiday to visit us in Kalimantan as this will support the local communities.
  • Help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Tell your friends about the Indonesian Rainforest Foundation.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about our ideas and plans!


    About Us

    The United Nations on Climate Change in November 2007 stated that "Protecting and replanting Rainforests is the most effective way to combat global warming"

    The Indonesian Rainforest Foundation is a non profit organisation Registered by a Decree of the Minister of Justice and Human Rights of the Republic of Indonesia to assist the local people who live in Indonesia's Rainforest.

    The Foundation is dedicated to the reforestation, preservation,education and sustainability by eco and agro developments of the world's last ancient Indonesian Rainforests and the people and animals that depend upon them.

    The Foundation develops reforestation programs with long term sustainable eco and agro livelihood programs in conjunction with the local people and stakeholders in an area.


    Contact Us

    for more informations, Please don't be hesitate contact us.

    our email address:  info@indonesianrainforest.org
