story:
An ANIMATED FILM with a difference!

Hi everyone, I'm here to ask for your support and help.  I know people care about our oceans, like I do, and this why I want to convert my book into a short animated film to promote this awareness to a bigger audience.

Our children are growing up in a world of disposable plastic that we, the adults, have created which has caused our trash to float around in our oceans. 

What We Need

Like all Indiegogo creators I would love to exceed the amount that I aksed for and make a longer film than a short film. With the money raised it will give animators the opportunity to work on a project that's worthwhile so we can give them away in the end.  

I will also be upgrading the soft cover book to a new limited edition hard cover. I would love for them to be placed in school libraries for all the children to read.  It will document the journey of this project with everyone... lots will be students, or students still in colleges. They will get to show off their talents too.

Who is behind DAPHNE GOES BLUE -

My name is Tricia Kelly, and I wrote this book, created the art, and self published. Now I would love to make a short or longer feature film, as the script is bigger than the soft cover book. It's filled with drama and excitement like any other good screenplay.  I am a credited IMDB screenwriter and right now, for my own copyright protection, I am not disclosing what they are here. I am open to talking to any producers, or future distributors interested in being apart of this feature film project in the future.

AIM is to educate our kids - it's their future too

What I am trying to do now, with your help, is to create a a film that any kid, parent, or teacher would want to see. Some kids only learn by watching, some learn by hearing and others reading. This is a story that needs to be told. So I am asking you all to help this become the next Finding Nemo type of story to go global. Help this story influence people in making a difference, and saving our oceans together.

Where do the funds go if I do not reach our goal?

I will send children around the world my book if the film funding is not reached, and they will receive books for their schools as gifts since many schools can't afford to upgrade their school libraries. This is something that I would love to do more and more. this bookin libraries all around the world.  This is a new way of spreading  'love' in this New Age of business  You can learn share our profits with the rest of the world.

Others like Oprah have exposed these problems too. Her series: -' Great Pacific Garbage Patch - this plastic island was only the size of Texas in '09 - now it is the size of the whole Continent of USA in 2013.

HELP SPREAD THE WORD

So with your help, I promise to share this animated films about change, love, and positive attitudes with an enlightened message. It will inspire our children so we can reverse the direction that our planet it heading to. Our future generation are so close to missing out on our ocean, to swim amongst all the wonderful creatures that they call their home.. this BLUE PLANET is out earth and if we love her then we should protect her.

Thank you for your time, and all that contribute to a dear cause of mine. For ones that can't a simple share of the INDIEGOGO link would pass on this great message. Your contribution will be from your heart and that is extremely powerful too. We are on the path of change more than blaming another ... Mirror who you are and recycle with LOVE. Help change and make a difference.

LIKE and follow our stories as we promote all things wonderful, people, pictures and our own journey ON FACEBOOK

http://www.triciakelly.net/

A book review by another "Daphne Goes Blue" BLOG:

Daphne is the most beautiful and happy dolphin living in her big blue ocean. She had lots of friends and is always very positive and optimistic until one day she spotted some dirty brown water in her ocean. She also comes across some friends tangled in plastic and covered in oil and she knows that she must do something. She decides to gather her friends to send a message with love because nobody listens to a message filled with anger.

This is a wonderful way to help teach children to be kind to everyone and to love themselves most of all. It also raises the issue of pollution and the dangerous effects it has on our friends in the ocean presented in a way children can understand and relate to. The most valuable lesson is to send your message with love not filled with anger so that others will listen and understand.

Daphne’s message is to teach children about our beautiful oceans and to show by example how to take care of our oceans and our planet by recycling and being aware and concerned for the future of our planet and our children. I suspect this is a great lesson for adults as well.

See more on AMAZON

ENDLESS ENDORSEMENTS FROM OTHERS ABOUT THIS STORY

"Daphne Goes Blue", teaches children how precious sea life is, and how their actions can begin to reverse the damage done to the oceans' ecosystems and its inhabitants.  Tricia has given sea creatures personalities that jump off the page, and their charm elicits an emotional response that will motivate children to treat the sea and it's precious creatures as the true gems that they are."    Regards, Daria Justyn - www.dariajustyn.com

Real Coastal Warriors
Oh Tricia, I just finished reading! What a beautiful book! Every single factor that we try daily to emphasize, encompassed so beautifully through Daphne's eyes! Yes, I will be putting up a link on our page and encouraging people to support the book and the project. Thank you for the honor and privilege of being given the opportunity to read and share this. When the book is published, by all means let me know and I will promote the retail purchase as well. Thank you SO much for putting things in a perspective for children - and adults - to understand. Your words through this book and Daphne's eyes are exactly what the doctor ordered for them all! Thank you so much again! 

"Daphne Goes Blue is a touching and truthful reminder of the impact we as people have on the health of our oceans, and all living beings that call the ocean their "home". Like Daphne, we too hope that "one day people will discover that our sun, and the wind, and even water can supply all the energy that people on earth need" and we are pleased and proud to recommend this book to our Gulf Coast families still impacted by the BP Oil Disaster and our friends around the globe who truly care about the future of our oceans." -Maureen Dauphinee, Real Coastal Warriors

Tricia,  I just read your wonderful book.  It is great.  Positive message with solutions that work.  Thank you so much for what you do.  This would be soooo good in schools and out in world to reach children — in all size bodies to change our world. Bobbie G -. www.BobbieG.com

Hi Tricia, sends a very big message that could work if everyone understood that they have a job to do, and it comes from the heart first. Even though it was short, it is a message that needs to be repeated over.
and over again until we all wake up.  Good job.  Nancy Wallace -   www.childsmiraclemind.org

I was charmed and touched by this precious book! Daphne is a delightful Ambassador of the sea who shines the light of loving and compassionate awareness on the trouble state of our oceans on planet Earth. May Daphneʼs message of hope ripple far and wide, until her vision of a healed and whole Blue Planet, for all to enjoy! ~ Linda Shay, Dolphin Ambassador and Author of Dolphin Love... From Sea to Land.  www.dolphinheartworld.com

Our children can make a significant influence in the future of our oceans too, and Daphne speaks to them in a fun youthful way. Let US ALL take better care of our kids' legacy.  Aloha, Oriana Kalama www.oceandefenderhawaii.com

A sweet, thoughtful and positive story. Daphne reaches out to both ocean friends and earth friends to teach them about the sea. She wants all to know the importance of keeping the sea....a safe, clean, and happy place to be. I highly recommend this book. Nancy - High School Youth Advisor

 “I loved it too. I think this is a really wonderful story -- very beautiful. Thank you :)” Andrew Brewer - www.alchemicalheart.com

“I Love this story, it truly is important to keep our oceans clean and what a wonderful way to spread the message. Great Book :)”  Jackie - 18-year-old

“What a charming book for children of all ages!  Daphne and her friends are a credit to planet Earth.  Absolutely charming."  Sharon - Grandma of four kids

“I just read the book to Summer. She really enjoyed the book. She loves the ocean and dolphins”  Summer and April - Mother and her 4-year old daughter

Your words through this book and Daphne's eyes are exactly what the doctor ordered for them all! Thank you so much again! 
"Daphne Goes Blue is a touching and truthful reminder of the impact we as people have on the health of our oceans, and all living beings that call the ocean their "home". Like Daphne, we too hope that "one day people will discover that our sun, and the wind, and even water can supply all the energy that people on earth need" and we are pleased and proud to recommend this book to our Gulf Coast families still impacted by the BP Oil Disaster and our friends around the globe who truly care about the future of our oceans." -Maureen Dauphinee, Real Coastal Warriors
Tricia,  I just read your wonderful book.  It is great.  Positive message with solutions that work.  Thank you so much for what you do.  This would be soooo good in schools and out in world to reach children — in all size bodies to change our world. Bobbie G -. www.BobbieG.comHi Tricia, sends a very big message that could work if everyone understood that they have a job to do, and it comes from the heart first. Even though it was short, it is a message that needs to be repeated over.and over again until we all wake up.  Good job.  Nancy Wallace -   www.childsmiraclemind.orgI was charmed and touched by this precious book! Daphne is a delightful Ambassador of the sea who shines the light of loving and compassionate awareness on the trouble state of our oceans on planet Earth. May Daphneʼs message of hope ripple far and wide, until her vision of a healed and whole Blue Planet, for all to enjoy! ~ Linda Shay, Dolphin Ambassador and Author of Dolphin Love... From Sea to Land.  www.dolphinheartworld.comOur children can make a significant influence in the future of our oceans too, and Daphne speaks to them in a fun youthful way. Let US ALL take better care of our kids' legacy.  Aloha, Oriana Kalama www.oceandefenderhawaii.com A sweet, thoughtful and positive story. Daphne reaches out to both ocean friends and earth friends to teach them about the sea. She wants all to know the importance of keeping the sea....a safe, clean, and happy place to be. I highly recommend this book. Nancy - High School Youth Advisor “I loved it too. I think this is a really wonderful story -- very beautiful. Thank you :)” Andrew Brewer - www.alchemicalheart.com
“I Love this story, it truly is important to keep our oceans clean and what a wonderful way to spread the message. Great Book :)”  Jackie - 18-year-old “What a charming book for children of all ages!  Daphne and her friends are a credit to planet Earth.  Absolutely charming."  Sharon - Grandma of four kids“I just read the book to Summer. She really enjoyed the book. She loves the ocean and dolphins”  Summer and April - Mother and her 4-year old daughter

story:
Why chip in?

This online fundraiser is on behalf of our housemate, Alison Fairbrother - an investigative journalist focused on reporting on misrepresentations of science by corporations and government. 

Last week, two teenagers kicked down our dead-bolted door and stole Alison's laptop. We admire Alison for her sacrifice of a competitive salary to work on filling much needed gaps in investigative reporting, and if her work resonates with you we'd really appreciate your contribution.

What will the money pay for?

The money will cover the cost of the stolen laptop, and help pay for programs and services that help Alison do her job: Microsoft office for writing scathing articles about the failure of government regulatory oversight; cell phone for interviewing executives and government officials; bike repair for sweltering summer rides down to court houses and libraries, and other features of the investigative life. 

More information

Check out Alison's recent picece in the Washington Monthly about the mismanagement of Atlantic menhaden by the regulatory agency charged with overseeing marine species in state waters. 

Read more about the Public Trust Project, an organization Alison directs.

story:
Update 11/21/13

Clean Energy Action (CEA) has recently received a generous outside contribution of $50,000! Because of this amazing contribution CEA will match every $1 that is contributed to CEA's indiegogo page. All proceeds will be allocated towards CEA's objective to promote this report to the press, research institutions, government agencies, organizations, and individuals. 

Urgent!

The Energy Information Administration (EIA), in the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE), has improperly estimated the economically recoverable reserves of U.S. coal resources. This improper estimate has equated the U.S. coal reserves to be economically viable for 200 more years. This projection is incorrect! 

U.S. coal companies are facing rising production costs and declining profit margins. The cost of coal to U.S. utilities and their customers is rising 2 to 3 times faster than inflation. 

Important Note: Our intention is not to state that the EIA's data is completely wrong or that the EIA is lying to the American people, rather to show that the data being compared, and the projections being made are incorrect. CEA wants the EIA to re-evaluate the way they report their findings so that future political and economic decisions are made with correct supportive information. 

Please donate to ensure this report gets into the hands of decision makers, so they may use this report to ensure the reliability of future energy production in the U.S.!  


Short Summary

Clean Energy Action (CEA) needs your help to raise $45,000 of tax-deductible donations to promote "Warning: Faulty Reporting of US Coal Supplies" aka “Running on Empty” a compelling new report which lays out in detail the dramatically rising costs of coal in the United States. Our exclusive report will disclose data showing that the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) overestimates U.S. coal reserves to the detriment of utility customers around the country.

Our goal is to promote this report to the press, research institutions, government agencies, organizations, and individuals in an attempt to spread the word about the rising cost of coal supplies.  

And most importantly, this will improve how future resources of coal will be estimated by the federal government and other U.S. agencies. 


Your Contributions Will Help CEA:

  • Direct this report to editors at magazines, blogs, newspapers, radio and more, as well as decision makers in and related to the electric utility industry (bankers,  investors, industry analysts, commissioners, regulators, elected officials and their key staffers).

  • Launch local and support regional events to educate citizens of the truth of U.S. coal reserves vs. resources.

  • Present our findings to the Public Utility Commission of Colorado and other PUCs as expert witnesses so we may accelerate the transition to a safer, cleaner, long-term reliable, renewable energy portfolio.


The Impact

Clean Energy Action’s hard-hitting coal report will reveal to the press, government agencies, organizations, research and financial institutions, the rough economic change this nation faces if it does not prepare for a sharply shifting supply from affordable to expensive coal and repower America swiftly.  


The 2013 Coal Report -"Running on Empty"

There may be lots of coal in the ground of the United States - but it’s increasingly costly to bring it up for the power plants that serve you and commerce.  Every year the economic, environmental, and health costs of using coal as our primary energy source continue to rise. From 2004 to 2011, the average cost of coal in Colorado increased by 81%. Nationally, similar increases were experienced (Coal Costs).

Many people have already begun to realize that coal is an uneconomical resource. The Wyoming Star Tribune reported that on August 21st, 2013, a Bureau of Land Management (BLM) lease sale for 149 million tons of publicly-owned coal in Wyoming failed to attract a single bid. It was the first time in Wyoming history that this has ever occurred. CEO of Cloud Peak Energy, Colin Marshall, gave a statement saying that the company evaluated the coal tract and declined to bid due to "current market conditions and the uncertain political and regulatory environment of coal and coal-fired electricity." (Coal News Article).

The U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) of the Department of Energy publishes a coal report every year which includes a section called Estimated Recoverable Reserves (ERR). The EIA has determined that the recoverable amount of “reserves” of coal in the U.S. is about 238 billion tons of coal. At our current level of coal consumption, these “reserves should last approximately 200 years.” In reality, the coal that the EIA is reporting to be “reserves” includes all coal in the ground, the majority of which is not economically feasible to retrieve.  

Clean Energy Action is publishing its coal report calling attention to the fact that the US Geologic Survey predicts that 80% of what the EIA is calling coal “reserves” is actually a resource that is not economically recoverable.


About CEA

Clean Energy Action is a nonprofit organization whose mission is to accelerate the transition from fossil fuels to a clean energy economy by:

  • educating citizens on the impacts of fossil fuel use and on clean energy options

  • supporting informed action in coal-dependent states

  • conducting and disseminating research on coal supplies and utilities

  • envisioning the integrated renewable energy future without the use of fossil fuels

Brief History of CEA

Clean Energy Action (CEA) was co-founded by a small team of concerned citizens in 2005 in opposition of the construction of Xcel Energy’s newest and largest Colorado coal-fired power plant, Comanche III, in Pueblo, Colorado. Continuing to educate decision makers regarding the construction of Comanche III, CEA then built momentum around retiring existing coal plants by demonstrating the detrimental impacts of diminishing coal supplies in the United States.

Since 2009, Leslie Glustrom, Co-founder and Research Director of Clean Energy Action, has published two reports on coal: "Coal: Cheap and Abundant, or is It?" and "Trends in U.S. Delivered Coal Costs: 2004-2011". These two reports revealed that there is little economically viable coal left for extraction. Costs to extract coal continues to rise, making it more expensive to burn the coal and convert it into electricity, taking more money out of our pockets to turn the lights on. 


Networks

CEA is constantly striving to create a collective - a group of organizations, policy makers, businesses and individuals all reaching for the same goal. Several of our organizational connections include 350.org, COSEIA, New Era Colorado, Empower our Future, Our Longmont, PLAN Boulder, Wild Earth Guardians, EcoCycle and more.

Follow Us On - Facebook and Twitter

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help with money, please let others know about this campaign.

If you'd like to give, but are having problems with the credit card processing, drop us a line.

And hey, you can also give your time. Click Here to volunteer.

A Jake Becker Film. Contact: YouKnowMedia@gmail.com

Brief History of CEA

story:
AMAZON RAINFOREST: THE BIRTH OF A BIRTHING CENTRE

Pioneering Support to Child and Maternal health

________________________________________________

 SAVE THE PEOPLE, SAVE THE FOREST, SAVE THE PLANET

______________________________________

 

The Facts

  • The Amazon rainforest is called the lungs of the world producing one fifth of the world’s oxygen
  • The Amazon indigenous peoples for centuries have preserved and protected their habitat
  • As many babies are dying in the Amazon rainforest as in most African nations
  • They are dying not from hunger, but from poor health conditions

 

Who are we?

We are a group of volunteers from Canada who lend our time at a non-profit called e-KSS™. Our mission is to help decrease the high rates of infant mortality and improve maternal health conditions in the Amazon rainforest. Along with a travel grant and our own money we took the helm in two previous workshops to identify needs and prioritize actions. Our next step is to return to the Amazon; but we need your help.

 

We need to raise $ 16,150 for our 3rd week-long workshop at the headquarters of the FOIRN indigenous federation in the Amazon city of Sao Gabriel. It will allow us to start the actions on child and maternal health improvements by focusing on new midwifery methods. There will be two of us and a local anthropologist. Your contribution will help reduce costs for travel, food, lodging, and workshop preparation and expenses. In fact, you will be helping us begin a journey to build the first Amazon indigenous birthing centre; a centre run by and for the indigenous peoples.

 

What’s our plan?

Our plan is simple yet innovative.

 

By empowering Amazon peoples to deal with health issues by themselves, they will raise healthier babies as next generation that will help maintain a healthy rainforest and a healthy planet. Our plan starts with knowledge transfer based on successful Canadian aboriginal midwifery services leading to exchanges in traditional pregnancy and birthing practices. An integral part is knowledge transfer about proper and representative health data collection and ownership of this data to empower Amazon peoples. And finally, the use of technology to connect them with advances in western medical practices, an expectation of the Amazon peoples they have expressed to us in previous workshops.

 

The birthing centre in the Amazon rainforest represents these steps as the birth of a new reality for rainforest peoples, and the preservation of an environment we all depend on.

 

What is in it for you!

  • Contributing $25 - $99 lands your name on our web site’s “Friends Page”
  • Contributing $100 - $499 earns you an original piece of art from the Amazon rainforest and your name on our Friends Page as “Notable Contributor”
  • Contributing $500 - $999 will earn your company’s web site or personal page featured on our web site, the original piece of art and your name on our Friends Page  as “Distinguished Contributor”
  • Your $1,000 contribution and over will earn you an invitation to participate in our Advisory Committee, the Amazon rainforest piece of art and your name on our Friends Page as “Benefactor”

 

A Big Thank-You

We would like to thank you for taking the time to read this information and hope you will join us in the movement to improve maternal health in the Amazon.

 

_________________________

  We know some of you just can’t contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. You can help us spread the e-KSS message of providing a healthier life to the Amazon rainforest peoples and make some noise about our campaign. Don’t forget to use the Indiegogo.com share tools!

 _________________________

story:
Brief project description

What we want to achieve

We want to inspire business and economic growth by providing African communities with access to reliable and environmentally friendly electricity resources.  The majority of Tanzanians uses kerosene as source of light. However, this brings along many disadvantages such as the excessive contribution to pollution through the CO2 emission from burning kerosene. We provide people with high-quality solar systems by giving them loans in order to pay for the product in installments. Hereby it is of utmost importance to us that our African partners are at eye-level with us and don't receive donations but investment capital.

What you will assist us in

This campaign will enable electrifying the village Kulungwa near Dar es Salaam. Your investment will help us to provide the inhabitants with the possibility to acquire high-quality solar systems on credit. Each solar system includes a light, a torch and a mobile phone charging function. For Kulangwa ca. 50 solar systems are needed. This will provide ca. 300 people with solar energy and hence substitute 50 kerosene lamps. Eventually this will lead to a reduction of 5 tons of CO2 per year.


Project details

The solar system at stake is the so-called MB2-200 Omnivoltaic and costs ca. 50$. We will hence need 2500$ in order to acquire 50 solar systems for Kulungwa. Hereby, it is especially important to offer the solar systems on credit. You will provide us with the necessary working capital to make credits possible. The earnings of the payments in installments will go to a revolving solar fund which enables us to finance new solar systems for further households as well as to offer after-sales and technical maintenance. Additionally, 500$ will be needed for installation, distribution and training purposes. A total of 3000$ will therefore be needed for equipping Kulungwa with solar systems.


Our perks for you

To express our thanks for your support we want to offer you something in return. Ranging from the traditional Tanzanian music DVD to a guided tour through Tanzania, we came up with something for everyone. Experience our solar products yourself or get the change to visit us in Tanzania - it is your choice. Take a look at our perks and enjoy.


Your impact

The new solar systems in Kulungwa will lead to a reduction of 5 tons of CO2 per year - only just the beginning of many more equipped villages to come.

The credit model will enable also poor people to gain access to solar energy. With the help of your investment not only is clean solar energy brought to Tanzanians households but also new workplaces are created through the distribution of the solar systems - the basis for a sustainable economic development.


Challenges

When we give out the products on a credit basis, we see that we have very faithful customers who pay back their loan in time. However we need to pre-finance the products first which is a big challenge because there are so many people in need of solar energy. Should the crowd-funding goal not be reached, the amount so far collected will still be used for the purchase of solar systems and the subsequent distribution to Kulangwa. We will provide as many inhabitants as possible with solar energy. 


Our previous projects

We built up a solar training center, the Simba Solar Village, in which we train solar entrepreneurs and technicians in how to sell and install solar energy products to the rural villages in Tanzania.


Who we are

The campaign's project sponsor is SolarGrid Tanzania Ltd.,a local Tanzanian company, which was build up with the support of African Solar Rise e.V., a German non-profit organization.


Spread the word

Invest in green energy and support our crowd-funding campaign. Everybody can help: no matter whether you support us financially or you want to get involved personally. Feel free to share our campaign and speak about it. Tell your friends, family or coworkers. You can make use of the tools directly below the video. Thank you for your support. Help us build a brighter world - for a better tomorrow.

campaign_city: Kulangwa, Kindoni District, Tanzania, United Republic of

story:
We are Colton and Ashley Akers, some people call us Aquaman and Tricks.  Those are our trail names, the names we will be using while we thru hike the Appalachian Trail. Aquaman got his name because of his background in scuba diving and Tricks carries a hula hoop in her back pack to dance with along the way! We have been married for a little more than 2 1/2 years and we are best friends! The biggest thing that we have in common is our love of hiking and of the outdoors. We are from Indiana, not much hiking to be done around here. That is one reason we have decided to start this adventure, thru hiking the Appalachian Trail.

Thru hiking the AT means that we will be starting at the southern terminus, Springer Mountain, Georgia and walking all the way to the northern terminus, Mt. Katahdin, Maine.  The total length is 2,185.3 miles and crosses through 14 states! Why would we want to do that? To see what we can see! We will be meeting tons of amazing people, seeing a lot of amazing places and changing our lives for the better every day that we are out there. This hike should take between 5-6 months to complete, we aren't going to rush this once in a lifetime adventure!  This is a very important step that we feel that we need to take in our lives, before we settle down and start a family! Now is the best time for that! :)

What we need:

 

We have been working hard and saving money for a few years but could use a little bit more help! :)  We are trying to raise at least $2000. The donations we would receive from you would help with food.  When we get to town, we will need to go to the store to fill our food bags back up to sustain us for the next week. We will be resupplying in towns every 5 to 6 days. It would also help fund our stay at hostels/hotels. For the most part, we will be sleeping in our tent or in shelters along the trail. Occasionally, we will stop at a hostel/hotel for a good nights sleep in a bed and a nice hot shower!! Also, walking that many miles puts a lot of wear and tear on our gear.  Something could break, or our clothes could wear out...anything can happen.  Most thru hikers will go through 3 pairs of shoes or more along the hike. Help us out and follow along on the ride! We will be doing a Facebook page where we will be posting pictures, stories and maybe even a few videos! :) The link to that page is:  www.facebook.com/AquamanandTricksAT

 

We leave the first week of April 2014!! The day is coming up fast! We can't wait to start this adventure and with your help the trip of our dreams will come true!! :)

 

 

YOUR PERKS!! (besides following along with us on this amazing adventure!!!!) :)

For a $10 donation, we will send you a summit photo (the photo of us at the northern terminus of the Appalachian Trail, Mt. Katahdin) after we complete the hike with a personalized thank you.

For a $20 donation, we will send you a post card during our hike along with a summit photo. (See above)

For a $30 donation, we will send you a 48" x 9.5" map of the Appalachian Trail!! BUT WAIT THERE'S MORE!! :) We will also send you a post card during our hike AND a summit photo! (See above) HURRY FAST AS ONLY 2 ARE AVAILABLE. GET THEM WHILE YOU CAN!!

For a $40 donation, we will send you a handwritten copy of one of my personal journal entries along with a summit photo.

For a $50 donation, we will send you a handwritten copy of one of my personal journal entries, a summit photo and a postcard during our hike.

For a $75 donation, we will send you 3 of our favorite photos after the completion of our hike, along with a handwritten copy of one of my personal journal entries, a post card during our hike and a summit photo.

For a $200 donation, we will send you a DVD of our collection of photos after the completion of our hike, a handwritten copy of one of my personal journal entries, a post card during our hike and a summit photo.

 

Even if you can't contribute, share this page and follow along on our Facebook page, tell your friends to follow along too!! Maybe we will inspire you to do something like this one day!

story:
Summary

We feel this is a campaign you can be passionate about and we are people you can trust. Here's a bit about us:

  • About Michael Meade:
    • ​Environmental educator providing sustainability programs for public schools
    • MC/Singer/Songwriter advocating for environmental justice
    • Organic gardener and permaculture activist
    • Visit http://www.allaboardearth.com for more info
  • About Maya Lïona Rose - Visit http://mayalionarose.com for more info
    • Women's Life Coach - Helping Women develop greater Self-Love, Embodiment & Courage
    • Singer, Percussionist/Songstress for the Earth <3
    • Facilitator of Song Carriers Women's Circles (See http://thesingingwaters.org)
    • Group Facilitator - Cacao, Wild Voice, Embodiment, Self-Love and Soul Nourishment
  • About our campaign:
    • We received the call in June 2019 to attend a gathering of water protectors in Haines, Alaska, called "Aquasension", in which elders of the Tlingit, Kogi and Lakota tribes came together with musicians, ecologists and Earth stewards to pray and organize a campaign for protection of the Chilkat River from a sulfide ore mining operation.
    • Although the word is getting out about the controversy of this mining speculation, there is much work to be done to ensure a safe and sustainable solution. Learn more about the water protection efforts at the Chilkat River:
      • Watch this amazing documentary funded by Patagonia: https://www.outsideonline.com/2395045/klukwan-people-fight-its-life?utm_medium=social&fbclid=IwAR39zKcBeQR3GuVo-uOa9TopDXI0CSZh72_kS1QpoPF5DiEj6XKyBdLotrY
      • Earth Justice: https://earthjustice.org/cases/2017/defending-the-chilkat-river-watershed
      • American Rivers: https://endangeredrivers.americanrivers.org/chilkat-river/
      • Audubon: https://www.audubon.org/news/proposed-mine-threatens-worlds-largest-concentration-bald-eagles?fbclid=IwAR1p9FJY8f7Dn2q35wMpZ7Bes1bEM1Kbnv796CqdfWVPFpUaMsaP5JR_saE
  • Your donations will enable us to travel to this gathering and provide much needed funding to the efforts of the Tlingit peoples in preserving the Chilkat River.

What We Need & What You Get

Funding Needs

  • Maya and Michael's travel costs:
    • $500 each for airfare
    • $500 each for housing and food
  • $1000 (or 1/3 of what we raise) for the needs of the Tlingit people water stewardship efforts

Perks

  • Every donation above $5 will receive a gift to show our gratitude for your support and return the love energy back to you!
    • $5-20 gets you a collectible All Aboard Earth sticker
    • $20-40: one-on-one organic gardening advice session with Michael
    • $44: Maya
    • $50-100: a custom All Aboard Earth hat or 1lb of Organic Cacao
    • $100-500: your very own theme song, produced by All Aboard Earth
    • $500-1000: a personal or business event concert by All Aboard Earth
    • $1100-1200: a personal or business event concert by Maya Liona Rose
  • If we don't reach our goal completely, all the funds will be utilized for the needs outlined above

The Impact

  • At this time on the planet, as we become more globalized and aware of how our individual actions affect the whole, it is crucial to build strong networks across cultures and geography promoting stewardship of water - our most precious collective resource.
  • Our experience and past success:​
    • Michael
      • 2010-2011: tended organic farms in Maui, HI.
      • 2013-2015: managed a permaculture project for an eco-village in Mexico, teaching gardening and sustainability at the local Montessori school.
      • 2015-2016: care-taker of Onipa'a Sustainability Center on Maui, HI.
      • 2017-2018: Environmental educator at Lafayette Elementary in San Francisco, CA
      • 2018-Present: Instructor of sustainability studies at Mandela Magnet School, Santa Fe, NM
    • Maya​
      • 2011-2018 Holistic Health Coach, Pilates Instructor, Yoga Teacher, Neurokinetics Pilates Instructor, Santa Fe, NM, Orange, CA, Maui, HI
      • 2018-Present: Women's Life Coach, Global
      • 2018-Present: Musician/Songstress for the Earth, Global
      • 2018-Present: Indigenous Song Carrier and Group Facilitator, Santa Fe, NM

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and share this campaign across all of your social networks. Ask friends to share with their friends so we can make the greatest impact!
  • Get involved in local and global water stewardship efforts. Send out your prayers for healing of the waters of the world!

We received the call in June 2019 to attend a gathering of water protectors in Haines, Alaska, called "Aquasension", in which elders of the Tlingit, Kogi and Lakota tribes came together with musicians, ecologists and Earth stewards to pray and organize a campaign for protection of the Chilkat River from a sulfide ore mining operation.
Although the word is getting out about the controversy of this mining speculation, there is much work to be done to ensure a safe and sustainable solution. Learn more about the water protection efforts at the Chilkat River:
Watch this amazing documentary funded by Patagonia: https://www.outsideonline.com/2395045/klukwan-people-fight-its-life?utm_medium=social&fbclid=IwAR39zKcBeQR3GuVo-uOa9TopDXI0CSZh72_kS1QpoPF5DiEj6XKyBdLotrY

$500 each for airfare

Our experience and past success:​

Michael
2010-2011: tended organic farms in Maui, HI.
2013-2015: managed a permaculture project for an eco-village in Mexico, teaching gardening and sustainability at the local Montessori school.
2015-2016: care-taker of Onipa'a Sustainability Center on Maui, HI.

Maya​

2018-Present: Women's Life Coach, Global

Other Ways You Can Help

Use the Indiegogo share tools and share this campaign across all of your social networks. Ask friends to share with their friends so we can make the greatest impact!
Get involved in local and global water stewardship efforts. Send out your prayers for healing of the waters of the world!

story:
THE BACKGROUND

The Amazon basin is being threatened by an ever-increasing encroachment by man.  More specific, the Amazon River and its tributaries are being threatened by: loss of habitat due to development in and harvesting of the forests; slash and burn agricultural practices; clearing of land for mining purposes; introduction of exotic species for food purposes; drought; and over fishing. Not only is the physical environment being affected, but so is the aquatic life in the area.


One of the regions hardest hit by this encroachment is the Peruvian Amazon.  Over 85% of the approximate 900 freshwater fish species of Peru are found within the Amazon basin, with 30% found only in Peru.  Many of these fish are exported for the aquarium trade, further reducing their numbers in the region

The aquarium trade is a multimillion-dollar business for some of the poorest areas of Peru where most other business opportunities do not exist.  In 2013, over 400 metric tons of live aquarium fishes were exported out of the Peruvian Amazon basin to the United States and Southeast Asia (primarily Japan) bringing in $3.4 million.  Money goes directly into the local fishing communities, creating revenue that would otherwise have to be sought by cutting down the forests.

Because of unregulated logging, mining and environmental degradation, fish populations are decreasing.  If this continues, the entire ecosystem will suffer.  In addition. economies of villages which rely on the fish for their livelihood will be devastated.


WHO WE ARE

In 2009, myself and 2 fish biologist from Iquitos, Peru purchased 2 acres of land from the pueblo of 31 de Mayo in order to build a research facility devoted to the research of sustainable breeding, diseases, ecology, and conservation of ornamental fishes (Amazon Research Center for Ornamental Fishes).  This will be the FIRST research facility solely devoted to ornamental fishes.  This land, located 10 km southwest of Iquitos, had previously been cleared for the construction of homes and is ideal for the research center as a natural spring flows year round through the land.  This natural spring water is not used for drinking water as the government has built wells throughout the village for household use.


The Team

Anthony I. Mazeroll, Ph.D.

Dr. Mazeroll received his Ph.D. from Northern Arizona University in the field of zoology.  His research was on the daily migratory behavior of coral-reef fish in the Red Sea.  After  graduating, he continued to work in the Red Sea and was awarded a Fulbright Fellowship to Jordan in 1999.  Dr, Mazeroll was a professor of Biology at West Texas A&M University 8 years.  He has been at Soka University of America in Aliso Viejo, CA since 2002.  At Soka, Dr. Mazeroll teaches courses in Sustainable Aquaculture, Fish Biology, Aquatic Conservation, Freshwater Biology, Alien Invaders, and Marine Biology.  He began working in the Amazon in 2004 and continues today where his research centers on the impacts of invasive species on the aquatic ecosystem.  As a hobby, he has been breeding and raising tropical freshwater fishes for over 40 years.


Carlos Chuquipiondo G.

Mr. Chuquipiondo has been involved in the fish industry in Peru for over 20 years. 

After graduating from the Universidad Nacional de Amazonia Peruana with a bachelors degree in Aquaculture, he began working at FONDEPES (the Peruvian national fish hatcheries).  After 5 years, he started working for the tropical fish industry.  For many years he was the general manager at Stingray Aquarium, the largest fish exporter in Iquitos, over seeing all operations of the aquarium.  He now is the general manager of Amazon Tropicals Aquarium in Iquitos.  Carlos has been invited to give lectures in Peru, Colombia, and Brazil on the aquarium industry. Additionally, Carlos breeds 20 different varieties of aquarium fishes.

Fernando Carlos Ramos E., M.S.

Mr. Ramos is a specialist in tropical fish diseases.  He has a certification in Veterinary medicine from the National University in San Marcos, Peru.  In addition, he has a Masters degree of fish pathology from the same university.  Fernando was

an intern at Stingray Aquarium for two years before taking a job veterinarian/fish

disease specialist and inspector for the Peruvian Ministry of Fisheries.


WHAT WE PLAN TO DO AT THE RESEARCH CENTER

The facility will be a tool used by faculty and students from all over the world.  We currently have students conducting research at the facility for both their undergraduate and Master degree programs from the Universidad Nacional de Amazonia Peruanain and Soka University of America. The center will be open to scientists throughout the globe to conduct research on ecology and conservation of local fishes.  We hope to help develop sustainable aquaculture practices of local aquarium fishes and share that information with local fish farmers resulting in the reduction of fish being extracted from the surrounding waterways. In addition, the pathology lab will undertake research on the diseases that are commonly found in the ornamental fish trade in Iquitos.  The information on prevention and treatments of these diseases will again be disseminated to the stakeholders in Iquitos.


WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

With your help, we can begin working on phase 1 of our 3 phase building plan. Phase1 entails the building of laboratories and all research ponds. In total, it will take an estimated $100,000.00 to complete all phases.  With the $15,000 we are seeking in our initial fundraising, we can complete Phase 1. Any additional funds raised, will be designated to building phase 2, the lecture hall and museum/education center. The final phase, phase 3 will be the building of the dormitories.


REMEMBER, ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX DEDUCTIBLE.

For those who have PayPal, donations can be sent to the PayPal account of amazonresearchcenter@gmail.com.  You will still be eligible to the perks and will still be tax deductible.

THANK YOU and MUCHAS GRACIAS.

story:
Mercury Cafe & Community Supported Clean Energy

Our goal is to purchase and install an additional 36 solar panels & big storage batteries for the roof of the Mercury Cafe.  And we need your help.

For the past 39 years the Mercury Cafe has been an integral part of the Denver community. Every day we are thankful for the foodies, neighbors, artists, dancers, actors, musicians, poets and activists who frequent the Mercury. 

Earth Is Changing. We Are Earth. We Must Change Too.

We serve organic locally sourced food and community is our purpose. Over the years we have continually worked to "green" our building and ourselves. We have put our money where our mouth is, and paid the higher costs of doing business that comes with buying and serving organic food, beer, liquor, and alternative energy. For several years we have enjoyed creating clean energy with our 36 solar panels and 2 little wind turbines. Since it was offered, we have purchased 100% of our additional electricity from Xcel Wind Energy Program. But we want to do more! 

Our goal is to purchase and install an additional 36 solar panels & big storage batteries for the roof of the Mercury Cafe.  And we need your help.

Why does it matter?

 When you donate to our Community Supported Clean Energy Fund you will be helping to reduce CO2 in our atmosphere. You will be contributing to reducing climate change catastrophe and set a precedence for a "Solar Raising".  Like the old-fashioned Barn Raising in which community members supported each other, collectively accomplishing something that would be unattainable otherwise. With your help we can work towards a clean energy future. A good friend provided the financing for the solar & wind power we have now. He is unable to do that again. The solar companies offer financing for residential but not for small commercial buildings. We could lease them, but purchasing them outright would help contain the skyrocketing costs of the Mercury Cafe. Any money that we raise will go towards the purchase and installation of solar panels for the Mercury Cafe, and batteries to store the energy they make.

Sustainability at the Mercury

We are always working to further our sustainability as much as possible at the Mercury Cafe. To learn more about everything we do, please check out our "Green" Page on our website. 

Help us to Create a Clean Energy Future

So if you can and would like to help fund this project by contributing $5 or $50 or more, please do so. Our goal is 39,996. We will be so grateful if we are able to create more clean energy together. Thank You! Thank You! Help us broaden our efforts for a sustainable model of living. Community is our Purpose. We can’t do it without YOU.

Our goal is to purchase and install an additional 36 solar panels and big storage batteries for the roof of the Mercury Cafe.  And we need your help.


  • Please help us get the word out. Share our campaign on Facebook and any other way you can.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools on this page.

Mercury Cafe & Community Supported Clean Energy


Our goal is to purchase and install an additional 36 solar panels & big storage batteries for the roof of the Mercury Cafe.  And we need your help.For the past 39 years the Mercury Cafe has been an integral part of the Denver community. Every day we are thankful for the foodies, neighbors, artists, dancers, actors, musicians, poets and activists who frequent the Mercury. 
Earth Is Changing. We Are Earth. We Must Change Too.

We serve organic locally sourced food and community is our purpose. Over the years we have continually worked to "green" our building and ourselves. We have put our money where our mouth is, and paid the higher costs of doing business that comes with buying and serving organic food, beer, liquor, and alternative energy. For several years we have enjoyed creating clean energy with our 36 solar panels and 2 little wind turbines. Since it was offered, we have purchased 100% of our additional electricity from Xcel Wind Energy Program. But we want to do more! 
Our goal is to purchase and install an additional 36 solar panels & big storage batteries for the roof of the Mercury Cafe.  And we need your help.
Why does it matter?
 When you donate to our Community Supported Clean Energy Fund you will be helping to reduce CO2 in our atmosphere. You will be contributing to reducing climate change catastrophe and set a precedence for a "Solar Raising".  Like the old-fashioned Barn Raising in which community members supported each other, collectively accomplishing something that would be unattainable otherwise. With your help we can work towards a clean energy future. A good friend provided the financing for the solar & wind power we have now. He is unable to do that again. The solar companies offer financing for residential but not for small commercial buildings. We could lease them, but purchasing them outright would help contain the skyrocketing costs of the Mercury Cafe. Any money that we raise will go towards the purchase and installation of solar panels for the Mercury Cafe, and batteries to store the energy they make.

Sustainability at the Mercury
We are always working to further our sustainability as much as possible at the Mercury Cafe. To learn more about everything we do, please check out our "Green" Page on our website. 
Help us to Create a Clean Energy Future



So if you can and would like to help fund this project by
contributing $5 or $50 or more, please do so. Our goal is 39,996. We will be so
grateful if we are able to create more clean energy together. Thank You! Thank
You! Help us broaden our efforts for a sustainable model of living. Community
is our Purpose. We can’t do it without YOU.



Our goal is to purchase and install an additional 36 solar panels and big storage batteries for the roof of the Mercury Cafe.  And we need your help.



Please help us get the word out. Share our campaign on Facebook and any other way you can.

You can use the Indiegogo share tools on this page.

story:
The Pacific Coast SunTrail Route is the first 100%-renewable-energy electric vehicle fast charging network on California's Highway 1.

Sunspeed Enterprises is building the first 100%-renewable-energy-powered fast charging network of electric vehicle (EV) charging hubs along California's scenic, rural Highway 1 from Eureka to Malibu.

THE BACKSTORY

As a Californian, I've always loved the ocean and the beach.  After getting my Nissan Leaf, I discovered that driving to the beach required a lot of planning if I didn't want to get stuck.  That's if I could get there and back at all.  As a member of the local electric automobile club, I discovered that I'm not alone, but also that the government and business were busy building charging stations along the major highways and at workplaces.  The coast just isn't a priority.  So, I decided to do something about it.  And thus the idea of the Pacific Coast SunTrail Route was born.

Armed with the idea, I started looking at how to make it happen.  I joined forces with Ken Coker, an experienced architect and EV driver.  We started working on what to include in the hub and came up with these features:

  • Level-3, DC Fast Chargers (480v)
  • Level-2, AC Medium Speed Chargers (220v)
  • Accept standard credit cards, as well as RFID, QR code, and cell phone payments.
  • Compatible with multiple connectors - CHAdeMO and SAE
  • Security
  • 24/7 access
  • Renewable energy supply, and ultimately emission free energy.
  • Located at unique and enjoyable destination sites along the route which offer something to do (i.e. inns, restaurants, resorts, towns, etc.)

These stations would be the "champagne" model of EV charging stations.

OUR FIRST LOCATION - Point Reyes Station

Point Reyes Station is located some 25 miles north of the golden gate bridge in western Marin County on Highway 1.


We've leased office space in the old Livery Stable in Point Reyes Station and plan to open our first Charging Hub in the parking spaces right outside the doors.  The video above shows where to eat and drink nearby, places to refresh while recharging.

There are quite a few places to eat and drink within walking distance of our Charging Hub.  Here's a list with links to their websites where available.

  • Tomales Bay Foods - Cowgirl Creamery and Cantina, for cheese tours and deli.  
  • Pine Cone Diner - Open breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  Breakfast is a specialty.
  • Bovine Bakery - Organic coffee and fresh organic, handmade pastries.
  • Toby's Coffee Bar - Organic teas, treats, and coffees
  • Osteria Stellina -  Point Reyes Italian with an unwavering commitment to local organic products.  Open lunch and dinner.
  • Station House Cafe - Open breakfast, lunch, and dinner with live music on Sundays at 5pm and a great outdoor garden. 
  • Whale of a Deli - Good deli for sandwiches, mexican food, and more.
  • Cafe Reyes - Wood fired pizza and a nice deck.
  • Old Western Saloon - Drinks served in a classic old western bar.


The Plan

To start, we plan to install a single Level-2 charger and 20Kw Level-3 Charger with CHAdeMO connector which can charge a Leaf to 80% in less than an hour.  Phase II would replace this Fast Charger with a more powerful one that could charge a Leaf in less than 20 minutes and would have both CHAdeMO and SAE Combo connectors.  Phase III would add more chargers.  

Phase I of the project (Goal of $30k)

  • Level-3 DC Fast Charging (480V) 20Kw Single CHAdeMO Connector 
  • Level-2 AC Medium Speed Charging (240V) SAE J-1772 Connector
  • Accepts Standard Credit Cards, Greenlots RFID cards, QR code payment, and phone payments
  • Lights
  • Security

Phase II of the project (Stretch goal of $50k)


  • Upgrade the Level-3 DC Fast Charger to 50Kw Dual CHAdeMo/SAE connectors.

Phase III of the project ( Stretch goal of $90k)


  • Add a 2nd Level-3 DC Fast Charger with 50Kw Dual CHAdeMo/SAE connectors
  • Add up to 3 Level-2 AC Medium Speed Chargers

Risks and challenges

This is a construction project, so there is always the risk of schedule delays. These could be late deliveries, installation issues, weather, and inspection delays. 
For Phase II, supply of the SAE DC Fast Charging connector may cause delays.

Financing for Phase II and III are stretch goals of this project. Without reaching the stretch goal, installation of Phase II and III will be delayed until enough revenue is generated to cover the upgrade cost.

Other Ways You Can Help

Electric Vehicles are the cars of the future and Sunspeed Enterprises is adding another piece of the puzzle to complete the transition from gas cars to electric cars, the way electric lightbulbs eventually replaced gas lamps.  Whether you decide donate or not, you can help in many ways:

  • Tell your friends that Sunspeed Enterprises is building a fast charging network on California's coast.  They could drive an electric car and not get stranded.
  • Forward a link to the campaign to someone, visit Sunspeed's facebook page.
  • Use the IndieGoGo share tools to make other's aware of our campaign.
  • Learn more about electric vehicles at www.pluginamerica.org or join the electric automobile association at www.electricauto.org
  • Become active in an environmental organization like the Sierra Club.  The Sierra Club has created their own ev guide at content.sierraclub.org/evguide/

story:
Short Summary

We live and work near the precious mangrove ecosystems at the coast of Kenya. From various researches and our experience we know that our fishermen and many other local people are completely dependent on the mangroves. That´s why, we have dedicated decades of our work to mangrove forest conservation and livelihood creation with increasing success. In a long term we are succeeding. One of the things we pioneer at the coast is marine aquaculture, which we call Mariculture. We grow sea fish and other sea creatures such as prawns and crabs in marine fish ponds. This is to help the fishermen to have their own food source in case they come home from the sea empty handed. But this is not helping us to maintain the populations of sea animals at healthy levels. Overfishing, inadequate marine protection, unsustainable fishing methods or pollution are all contributing to the depletion of the natural fish stock and are damaging the ocean. The fish (at their juvenile stage), which the fishermen grow in their fish ponds are also obtained directly from the sea (trapped in nets in shallow waters). 


What We Need & What You Get

We now have a vision to solve this problem and build the VERY FIRST MARINE FISH HATCHERY and BREEDING FACILITY in Kenya, which will help us to stock the marine fish ponds with fish instead of catching fish from the ocean. This will not only reduce the pressure on the natural fish population, but will enable us to release more fish back to the wild and will complement our long term efforts in supporting the livelihoods of many local people and protecting the globally precious ecosystems. 

We are looking for an investment of 10.000 USD

If we do not reach the target, we will be able to invest into fish feeding facility, which is the first step to build the hatchery and will improve the feeds for fish bred by our communities.   

So what does our environment need from us?

Only 500 people who will adopt fish for 20 USD

20 USD is the approximate price for a dinner out for two,

20 USD is what you have paid for the taxi to take you home from night of drinking, where you spent another 20 USD for drinks and snacks.

Wouldn't you enjoy more watching a nice movie at home knowing, that thanks to you millions of fish can be produced every year, big number of fishermen can benefit from fish sale and the tremendous pressure on our local environment will be significantly reduced? You can follow our progress on our Facebook page, where we regularly post updates or on our website.


The Impact

This important task comes at the time when the whole world is turning their attention to the Oceans. Growing populations and economies in the Western Indian Ocean region are increasing risks to the world's least ecologically disturbed coasts, where ecosystem services are conservatively valued at US$25 billion annually according to a new report by United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP). Urbanization and unsustainable fishing and extraction practices are driving the depletion of natural resources and a decline in biodiversity in the region, affecting livelihoods, says the Regional State of the Coast: Western Indian Ocean. "From fisheries to tourism, to energy, oceans support approximately 350 million jobs worldwide. When about half of the population of African countries along the West Indian Ocean will live in the coastal zone by 2020, this region has the capacity to drive employment and economic growth for countries up and down and off the coast," said UN Under-Secretary-General and UNEP Executive Director Achim Steiner.

Risks & Challenges

There are very few risks to our project as we have been involved in the field of mariculture for past 2 decades. We are working closely with research institutes (e.g. Kenya Marine and Fisheries Research Institute), Universities (e.g. Pwani University) and relevant government public offices. We have technical people, advisors and consultants available at the moment. Our biggest challenge is time. We can lose our unique opportunity to take the development of Mariculture in Kenya a step further, hence continue with the degradation of the ocean and its fish stock, if we don´t act now.     

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to support KWETU in our noble cause - not just money. We can use your expertise as volunteer and of course your networks which can open many more doors, we haven't even thought about. First of all - spread the word, share the video "KWETU works" and ask your family, friends, partners, colleagues to support our cause thus making a huge change to the lives of many rural people at the Kenyan Coast.

story:
I am a performance artist, theater-maker, and writer based in both Orlando, FL and New York, NY. I have recently been working within two artist collectives, making works like the original musical, Aniima Mundii (NYC Winterfest 2019), and Transmotions, a movement score that paints the language of movement and moves through the language of painting (Playwrights Horizons). I don’t know about you, but I am sick of hearing about ecological peril in the news. I am interested in making art that tries to figure out more sustainable approaches to living. 

I am ecstatic to receive a fellowship at the Nature, Art, & Habitat Research Center in Val Taleggio, Italy. I am invited to Sottochiesa this June to "explore ways to build dynamic relationships between the Valley’s ecological resources, socio-cultural practices, and the built environment." The topic this year is Grasses and Pastures: Imagining a Regenerative Economy of Cheese. This fellowship is an amazing opportunity to not only explore what is the best future iteration of the northern Italian cheese economy, but also to practice tackling the universal question, how can we transition our systems towards wisdom and sustainability for the health and prosperity of all involved? 

This work is important to me because the way most of our economies run now is not regenerative. Our unsustainable resource extraction is contributing to deforestation, holes in the ozone layer, polluted waters, excess CO2 in the atmosphere, and other havoc. It is urgent that we transform our systems, and what better way to test these ideas than through art? We can experience alternative ecologies through theater and public art, and imagine how we can improve our world. I hope to transfer whatever I learn in Italy to another project and then another, to keep tackling this issue that affects us all. I am so grateful for any support you can provide to my case study in sustainability. Your contribution is towards systems that are more just for all earth-dwellers. 

 

To read about my project proposal, and proposals of the other artists, follow this link:
https://nahr.it/Fellows-Residenti

 

I am asking for funding in the amount of $2,066.69 to help pay for this research fellowship. The funds will go towards travel and living expenses from late May through late June of this year. Every contribution, no matter what it is, helps immensely. 

Through my project, I propose to build on my recent collective work. In the original musical, Aniima Mundii, myself and eight other artists of various disciplines engaged in physical labs and historical research, in order to explore how the animals we fear may move through our increasingly polluted, shared Earth. Our work consisted in building anatomical and environmental containers in which to embody our animals on stage. While I understand that I cannot become a coyote, I recognize that they straddle the fence between "the environment" and we humans, and as such they face invasion of their territories by human waste just as we do. Aniima Mundii explored how and to what extent we can intersect the personal with the environmental, which we often feel so disconnected from. “The stronger we can make that connection between ourselves and the earth, the more intuitively we can start respecting the planet without it seeming so cosmically out of reach,” said my great director, Oliver De Mers. 

In Transmotions, we practiced deep listening to environmental stimuli through improvised movement, responsive movement, solo movement, and group movement. Our incredible curator, Jacqueline Brockel, practiced painting the impossible (a moving body), and then we movement artists re-embodied our painted landscapes through choreographed scores. The end result in this process was six canvas landscape paintings, enlivened on stage by the bodies that inspired the paintings.

The hurdles of these projects were time and money, of course. There was also the awkwardness, at times funny and at times frustrating, of trying to capture something that can’t be captured, and of trying to embody a two-dimensional thing in a three-dimensional physical body. I am excited by these fruitful limits because they produce more questions and maybe helpful systems of thought along the way. When hiccups arise, reach out to others. Share what you have even if you don’t feel ready, because the exchange is important. These are mantras I continue to learn through collaborative art, and they are also foundational tools for building a healthier world.  

If you find you cannot contribute monetarily, I understand and I GREATLY appreciate you reading this. Please share this campaign through the Indiegogo share tools with those you think would like to connect with it. Please reach out with any ideas or questions or cow puns. I can be reached at katiedebari@me.com.

story:
Raise the Roof by Saving Theirs!

A truly awesome friend of mine lives with her husband and their two adorable children in a lovely little house in Lehi, Utah. Recently her roof sprung leaks—many leaks, all at once—and the entire thing needs to be replaced. They have done everything they can to patch the holes and now have the entire roof covered in tarp, but to no avail; the effects of the last rainstorm were especially bad.

After hearing their plight I discovered that new roofs are astonishingly expensive. I have known my friend since Jr. High; I have watched her children grow and her career blossom and to see their lives come to a screeching halt over a leaky roof makes me sad. The house was remodeled just before they moved in; the roof is less than 3 years old. The fact that their homeowner's insurance will not cover it is vexing.

So I am making myself the method of last resort! My goal is to collect enough money to get the roof replaced. While this is not the most world-changing goal on earth, it will have a lasting positive impact on the lives of this family in need. So let's get 'er done!

The Goal

While any money raised will be an enormous help, our goal is to reach $7500, the full amount needed to replace the roof. Every dollar of money raised will go directly to the family. If we do not raise the full amount, we will put it in the roof fund and use other fundraising opportunities to collect the rest. The roofing contractors have been hired and will expect payment upon completion of the work in about 3 weeks, hence our short timetable.

The family and I have put together some awesomely breathtaking perks for those who help. Plus, who can put a price on the buckets of karma and good feelings you will receive from knowing you did a good deed? You're like guardian angels, every one of you.

Make a Difference

I usually go through life simply living it: working, spending time with family and friends, and enjoying the fact that, being in the United States in the 21st century, we are among the happiest, healthiest and wealthiest human beings who have ever lived. When I discovered my friend's troubles (they did not initially tell me—I had to drag it out of them), I thought I could find a way to get the money they need to have a warm, safe home for themselves and their kiddies. If you can help in any way, I will be so grateful that I will happily kiss your feet and sing your praises. More importantly, this family will love you forever. FOREVER.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about these wonderful people and this fundraiser. We are trying to get the roof fixed as quick as we can to avoid further damage from the next rain. The faster we spread the word, the sooner we can raise the roof!

If you happen to know anyone who is part of a roof company—or if you are a fine upstanding member of the roofing community yourself—and might be able to help with supplies and labor, please do let us know.
story_txt: Raise the Roof by Saving Theirs!A truly awesome friend of mine lives with her husband and their two adorable children in a lovely little house in Lehi, Utah. Recently her roof sprung leaks—many leaks, all at once—and the entire thing needs to be replaced. They have done everything they can to patch the holes and now have the entire roof covered in tarp, but to no avail; the effects of the last rainstorm were especially bad.After hearing their plight I discovered that new roofs are astonishingly expensive. I have known my friend since Jr. High; I have watched her children grow and her career blossom and to see their lives come to a screeching halt over a leaky roof makes me sad. The house was remodeled just before they moved in; the roof is less than 3 years old. The fact that their homeowner's insurance will not cover it is vexing.So I am making myself the method of last resort! My goal is to collect enough money to get the roof replaced. While this is not the most world-changing goal on earth, it will have a lasting positive impact on the lives of this family in need. So let's get 'er done!The GoalWhile any money raised will be an enormous help, our goal is to reach $7500, the full amount needed to replace the roof. Every dollar of money raised will go directly to the family. If we do not raise the full amount, we will put it in the roof fund and use other fundraising opportunities to collect the rest. The roofing contractors have been hired and will expect payment upon completion of the work in about 3 weeks, hence our short timetable.The family and I have put together some awesomely breathtaking perks for those who help. Plus, who can put a price on the buckets of karma and good feelings you will receive from knowing you did a good deed? You're like guardian angels, every one of you.Make a DifferenceI usually go through life simply living it: working, spending time with family and friends, and enjoying the fact that, being in the United States in the 21st century, we are among the happiest, healthiest and wealthiest human beings who have ever lived. When I discovered my friend's troubles (they did not initially tell me—I had to drag it out of them), I thought I could find a way to get the money they need to have a warm, safe home for themselves and their kiddies. If you can help in any way, I will be so grateful that I will happily kiss your feet and sing your praises. More importantly, this family will love you forever. FOREVER.Other Ways You Can HelpPlease spread the word about these wonderful people and this fundraiser. We are trying to get the roof fixed as quick as we can to avoid further damage from the next rain. The faster we spread the word, the sooner we can raise the roof!If you happen to know anyone who is part of a roof company—or if you are a fine upstanding member of the roofing community yourself—and might be able to help with supplies and labor, please do let us know.

story:
The Jetlagged: divers, filmmakers, conservationists

The Jetlagged travel around the world and film adventures over and under water. They focus on scuba diving, but don't exclude the ocean & beach lifestyle from their dynamic films that appeal with quick cuts, slow motion shots, time-lapses, light reflexion effects and modern soundtracks. 

They inspire young people to go out and explore the world and the oceans themselves, and create awareness for the fragility of the amazing underwater world. 

On their travels all over the world, The Jetlagged experience up close how the oceans and its inhabitants are in danger, how they are facing tremendous problems like overfishing & destructive fishing methods, pollution, acidification and global warming. But without healthy oceans, life on planet Earth cannot exist. 

With this campaign, The Jetlagged want to make a direct impact by helping damaged reefs to regenerate and become again a healthy ecosystem for many generations of reef fish, turtles, sharks and all kinds of marine animals.


You can help us help Indonesias's reefs

The 3 Gili islands, Trawangan, Meno and Air, situated off the coast of Lombok, Indonesia, are a laid-back and popular travel destination for surfers, backpackers and scuba divers. 

Global warming and a strong El Niño did a lot of damage to the surrounding reefs, which are home to hundreds of reef fish species, turtles, reef sharks and bumphead parrot fish. Small critters like seahorses and different kinds of shrimp find a habitat here and occasionally even manta rays and whale sharks swim by. 

The Jetlagged want to help protect and regenerate the fragile and amazing underwater world by installing a new artifical BioRock reef on Gili Trawangan in September 2014, in cooperation with Gili Eco Trust and Manta Dive Gili Trawangan. 



What is a BioRock articial reef?

BioRocks are large submerged metal frames on the sea floor with a low voltage current running through the whole structure. Divers attach coral fragments to the frame. Hard and soft corals, sponges, tunicates, etc. are observed to grow on BioRocks faster than in natural conditions, hard corals 2-6 times faster! 

The shape of the BioRock also provides great hiding places for juvenile fish and other marine animals.  

  • The Jetlagged are raising money to build a new artificial reef in the shape of their logo, a paper plane, which will be submerged in the waters around Gili Trawangan in September 2014. 

  • This is your chance to participate in ocean conservation: build your own reef, the new home for many marine species. In the near future, you can travel there yourself and dive/snorkel on the reef you helped building!  

  • The Jetlagged in cooperation with Manta Dive Gili Trawangan will post pictures and updates about coral growth and development of the new reef regularly on the  internet.

Electricity lets corals grow up to 6 times faster

BioRock artifical reefs consist of metal structures that are placed on the ocean floor and have a low voltage current applied to them (safe to humans and all marine organisms). This initiates an electrolytic reaction in which the structure is being covered with calcium carbonate and magnesium hydroxide which was before diluted in the surrounding sea water.

When divers attach coral fragments to the metal frame, the corals bond to that mineral substrate and start to grow at extraordinary rates, hard corals for example 2-6 times faster than in natural conditions.

Dependent on the shape of the BioRock, large numbers of fish, especially juveniles, start populating the structures as they provide great hiding places. The shape of the paper plane structure will create a large cavernous area, where a lot of marine animals can hide.

BioRock reefs are also great wave-breakers and have turned severely eroding beaches into 15 meters of beach growth in a few years. 


Strong partners: Gili Eco Trust & Manta Dive Gili Trawangan

With the money raised, The Jetlagged will work together with Gili Eco Trust and dive center Manta Dive Gili Trawangan to build a new BioRock artifical reef.

The Gili Eco Trust was founded in 2000 by the dive shops on the Gili islands. In 2004 they imported the BioRock technology in Gili islands and launched a Coral Reefs Restoration Program with amazing success to regenerate and protect the reefs areound the Gili islands. 

The Jetlagged and Manta Dive Gili Trawangan will dive on the BioRock and transplant coral fragments to the new reef structure.

www.giliecotrust.com  |  www.manta-dive.com


Financing & how to build a BioRock

3,300 $ are needed to

  • build a new metal structure, weld it into the shape of the paper plane
  • transport it by boat to the right spot off shore
  • submerge and anchor it on the sea floor
  • install a new floating platform and solar panel to produce electricity for the new reef structure 
  • dive to collect and transplant coral fragments to the new frame
This will take approx. 10 days to complete and a lot of hands are needed to help. 

If we don't reach the full funding goal, the paper plane metal frame will be build and attached to an already existing electric in a spot off the beach of Gili Trawangan.


Film documentary: Life at the BioRock

The Biorock reef system has helped global efforts for reef restoration due to its positive effects on the overall marine life and growing interest ecotourism.

Since 2006 the Gili Eco Trust has been organizing international BioRock workshops every two years to spread this amazingly successful and easy technique.

The Jetlagged will document the building of the new BioRock with their cameras over and underwater. 

With this film, they want spread the knowledge about the incredibly successful technique of building BioRocks all over the world, wherever reef restoration is needed.

They will come back regularly to document the process of coral growth and population of marine animals.

Donors traveling to Gili Trawangan themselves will be able to visit the BioRock reef they helped financing and see the great positive impact of this artifical reef themselves!


Share our story, spread the ocean spirit! For Gili Trawangan's reefs!

If you can't donate money, but like the project, please spread this campaign on all media channels!

Visit our websites, lean back and enjoy our adventures on the oceans around the world. And then, go out an explore yourself! Always adventure!

www.thejetlagged.com

www.facebook.com/thejetlagged

www.vimeo.com/thejetlagged
